With a little capital that he had he began to buy medicines and rented a place for his pharmacy. Currently he works from 7am to 9pm every day selling medicines such as apronax, relmez and ampollas. 

With this loan he wants to buy medicines such as meloxicar, brocotocil and nemulabo expectorante. In the future he wants to have another pharmacy in another location which his children can manage.

loans.use: Medicines

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been engaged in mixed farming in his home town of Kisii in western Kenya for ten years. He produces tea, maize, milk, and bananas and sells these locally at market. He is married with four children between the ages of 8 and 2 years.

He has requested this loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes this will raise his family's living standards in terms of food and education. He aspires toward a venture into public transport through the eventual purchase of a vehicle in the next five years.

Price fluctuations in the market for produce like maize and milk are his greatest challenges.

loans.use: The purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza de 32 años, es madre de dos niños y esposa de un comerciante, realiza la actividad de venta de víveres de primera necesidad. Pero antes de tener su tienda ella sacrifico mucho para conseguir lo que ahora tiene. Una de las cosas fue caminar recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil vendiendo artículos de casa. Pero como no le fue bien en esa actividad decidió comprar víveres de primera necesidad y venderlos a sus vecinos. 

En la actualidad su esposo le ayuda comprando los productos para la tienda mientras que ella los vende desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En su tienda vende la libra de arroz, a $ 0.30, enlatados a $ 1.20, litro de aceite a $ 0.57. 

Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cajas de aceite, lácteos, quintales de arroz, etc. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio con una restructuración de ambiente y mercadería.
texts.en:
Maritza, 32, is the mother of two children and the wife of a merchant.  She sells groceries.  Before having her store, though, she sacrificed much to have what she now has.  One of the things was having to traverse Guayaquil’s streets selling items for the home.  Because she did not do well in this business she decided to buy groceries and sell them to her neighbors.

Currently her husband helps her buy products for the store while she sells from 7am until 10pm every day.  In her store she sells a pound of rice for $0.30, canned items for $1.20, and a liter of oil for $0.57.

To stay in business she needs to use the loan to buy cases of oil, dairy products, quintals of rice, etc.  In the future she’d like to increase business restructuring the ambience and the merchandise.

loans.use: For cases of dairy products, oils.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Comité Santa Lucia, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en de Capiata en fecha 11 de Agosto de 2010,gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas, quien se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de comidas ,contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Antonia es una de las integrantes, una mujer muy creativa quien se dedica a la fabricación de bijouterie, comenta que le gusta mucho su trabajo por disfruta haciéndolo y crea modelos de aros, gargantillas, y pulseras muy atractivas para sus clientas.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios que utiliza para la fabricación de bijouterie.
texts.en:
This group of women is called the "Santa Lucia" Committee. The group was formed in Capiata on August 11, 2010, thanks to the financial director, who prepares and sells foods. She contacted the advisor in a weekly meeting that she was having in the zone, to train in the type of work that the "Enterprising Women" Committee has. Once advised about the program, she began to get 16 women together who were already working really hard on the 2nd cycle, together and on their own with the program.
Antonia is one of the members. She is a very creative woman who makes costume jewelry. She mentions that she like her job a lot. She enjoys making it and creating very attractive models of hoops, necklaces, and bracelets for her customers.
She asks for the loan to buy accessories that she will use to make costume jewelry.

loans.use: To buy accessories to make jewelry.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 19-year-old single man from Chtoura. He has owned an aluminum sales shop since 2009. Since Rami is fresh with his new business, he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his aluminum capital, to be able to meet most of his clients orders. Rami is an ambitious hard worker who started his business with a small amount of capital and is working hard to improve his business as much as he can. His dream is to enter the wholesale trade world. Then, he might think of making the family he always dreams of.

loans.use: To increase his aluminum capital

loans.name: Yamileth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
LA SRA. YAMILETH M. G. ES MADRE SOLTERA DE DOS HIJOS Y ESTOS DEPENDEN ACTUALMENTE DE ELLA Y A LA VEZ SE ENCUNETRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ES UNA PERSONA EMPRENDEDORA QUIENTIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE JUGUETES, BOLSOS Y PRODUCTOS DE LIBRERIAS EN EL MERCADO ISRAEL LEWITE, ELLA TRABAJA DE LUNES A SABADO DE SIETE DE LA MAÑANA HASTA LAS SEIS DE LA TARDE CON UNA TRABAJADORA QUE SE ENCARGA DE  A TENDER A LOS CLIENTES.
ELLA HA TRABAJADO A CUATRO PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL Y ESTOS HAN SIDO PARA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA SU NEGOCIO, EL CUAL HA VENIDO INCREMENTANDO EN SU MERCADERIA Y AHORA COMPITE CON LA COMPETENCIA.
ELLA A CUDE DE NUEVO A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR PRODUCTOS DE LIBRERIA YA QUE ESTA ES LA TEMPORADA DONDE MUEVE MAS ESTOS PRODUCTOS.
texts.en:
Señora Yamileth M. G. is a single mother of two children, who depend on her now since they are of school age.  She is an enterprising person who has a business selling toys, handbags and office products in the Israel Lewite market.  She works from Monday to Saturdays from seven in the morning to six in the evening with a worker that she supervises to tend to the clients.   

She has had four loans with Ceprodel, which have been to purchase merchandise for her business, increasing her inventory so that she now competes with competence.  She has come once more to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy office products, since now is the season when she sells more of these products.

loans.use: To buy products for her bookstore such as notebooks, pencils and backpacks

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira A. is the treasurer of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 58 years old and married to a farmer. Together they have raised three sons and two daughters. 

Damira works in the hospital, and in order to earn additional money she and her husband breed cattle. They have been doing it since 1996. Reselling cattle after fattening, they earn an additional $107 per month. With money received from the loan, Damira wants to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell. In the future she dreams of purchasing a house in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Doris Elisa

texts.es: Doris Elisa tiene 44 años, su actividad es la veta de mercadería en general. Este negocio lo inicio con esfuerzo propio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mejorar sus ingresos. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, por lo que se siente muy agradecida con este medio de vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de cosméticos, trajes, ropa interior, tratamientos entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar su capital de trabajo y aumentar cada día más su inventario.
texts.en:
Doris Elisa is 44 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She started her business through her own efforts since she has always liked to improve her income.  This is not the first time that she has requested a loan.  She feels very thankful to be in this line of work.

This loan will be used to buy cosmetics, dresses, underwear, treatments, and other products.  Doris Elisa dreams of improving her working capital and continuing to increase her stock.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 31 years old and is a married woman with two children. The oldest child is 7. 
 
She is a fish seller working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in this business for a year. She earns about $63 per month doing this fish selling.
 
This loan will be used to buy more fish, plastic bags and a weighing scale. In the future, Arlene hopes to grow her business and have her children finish college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, plastic bags and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 29 years old and single. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. His farm produces milk, which he sells to the local market, and tea, which he sells to Finlay factory. He employs one farmhand. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business.

Edwin has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale. He will also be able to use this dairy cow as collateral to acquire more loans in the future. He says that his major challenges are a poor road network and lack of enough knowledge on animal diseases and feeds. He plans to build a modern dairy unit in the future and also acquire more high-yielding dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish E. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old. Irish is single and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Irish provides motorela or habal-habal (a motorcycle with extended seating for two to six people) services. Irish has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Irish joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Irish has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. 

Irish is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools and equipment needed to provide service. This will be the second loan taken out by Irish from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment needed to provide service

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O., 30 years old, is currently in a business of selling maize.  She will use the loan to stock more maize.  Mary is married to a farmer and they have four children, two of them are in school.  Her future goal is to buy a domestic animal.

loans.use: stock more maize for sale.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 56  años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque.  El distrito de Túcume es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100 familias y es un distrito conocido por ser un destino turístico Lambayecano, donde los artesanos del pueblo deleitan  alos extranjeros con sus productos. Además de esto , Túcume se le conoce por ser una comunidad agrícola y ganadera.

José se dedica a la venta de animales desde hace 20 años, lo que le da una ineludible experiencia en este rubro. José se dedica, actualmente, a la venta de ganado porcino y ovino a compradores e la zona. 

José solicita un  crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles los cuales invertirá en compra de animales y alimento balanceado para estos.Para ques estos sean más y de mejor calidad y José pueda obtener mayores ingresos gracias a sus ventas.

Este es el tercer préstamo solicitado por José a Edpyme aLternativa. Es un cliente responsable  y puntual.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old.  He lives with his wife in their own home, located in the Túcume- Lambayeque district.  The Túcume district is a small community of approximately 100 families.  Lambayeque is an area known for being a tourist spot where village artisans delight visitors with their products.  In addition to this Túcume is known for being a farming community.  

José has sold animals for 20 years, which gives him an inescapable experience in this field.  José is currently focusing on selling pigs and sheep to buyers in the area.

José is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 soles which he will invest in buying animals and balanced feed for them.  This way he will have more animals of better quality.  José will be be able to receive a better income thanks to his sales.  

This is the third loan José has requested from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a responsible and punctual client.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Ama sells cosmetics and kenkey, a local dish of fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves, at Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast. Kenkey is normally served with fried fish and hot pepper sauce. Ama uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Ama will use the loan to purchase maize, fresh fish to fry, tomatoes,and peppers. With the profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to build a store. She is seen in this picture taking out a kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase maize, fresh fish, tomatoes, and peppers

loans.name: Sochan

texts.en:
Sochan is 28 years old and her husband, Vannak, is 31 years old.  They have been married since 2003 and have one son who attends school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sochan is asking for a loan of $500. She will use part of the loan to purchase a new motorbike, because the old one breaks very often. She will also use a portion to pay school fees for her brother, who is training to become a barber.

Photo: Sochan and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and to pay school fees for her brother, who is training to become a barber.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children.

Hussein has had a shop for working aluminum since 2004; he makes doors and windows. He has good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator and to make an advertising light box for his shop. He is aiming to increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and to make an advertising light box for his shop.

loans.name: El Paraiso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso está formado por 13 mujeres quienes son amigas, tienen sus propios negocios y también se dedican en la cría de animales y la agricultura, estas actividades les permiten aportar a la economía del hogar y salir en adelante con sus familias. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es muy trabajadora, se dedican a varias actividades y también han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades.  Su gente muy amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias  es la Señora María Doolores, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe. Ella se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal ya que hace un tiempo atrás pertenecía a otro banco. 

Tiene 60 años de edad pero su alma muy joven ya que tiene gran sentido del humor, es  viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, todos son solteros trabajan y le ayudan economícamente. Con el sacrificio y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de animales, esta actividad la desempeña desde que tenía 20 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales como pollos, cuyes y chanchos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio de venta de animales.

El niño de la fotografía que está sentado con una chompa roja es hijo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank is composed of 13 women who are friends, have their own businesses and also are dedicated to farming and to raising animals.  These activities allow them to contribute to household economy and to get ahead with their families.  They live around Cumbe Parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose residents are very hard working and dedicated to various activities; some of them have migrated in search of better opportunities.  Its people are very kind, cordial and they still practice their culture and traditions.

One of the members is María Dolores.  She lives around Cumbe Parish.  She is rejoining the communal band because a while back she was a member of a different one.

She is 60 years old but her soul is very young and she has a great sense of humor.  She’s a widow but in her marriage she conceived three children who are adults now.  They are all single and working and help her economically.  With work and sacrifice she managed to build her own house.

María is a small farm animal merchant.  She’s been in this line of work since she was 20 years old.  She works Sunday to Sunday.

She wants to use the money from her loan to buy animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs to continue in business.  Her goal is to continue growing in animal sales.

The little boy in the photo who’s seated wearing a red sweater is the son of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Eric is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy tools & pay for the utilities needed for the service.

Eric has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eric hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for utilities

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Daniel est âgé de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Daniel est marié à une ménagère du nom de Rebbéca. Le couple a un  enfant scolarisé et vivant avec eux. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Daniel a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Daniel a appris le métier de couture. Daniel exerce cette activité passionnément depuis trois ans dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Daniel vend des produits de mercerie dans son atelier de couture. Daniel achète ses produits au Bénin. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Daniel sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le premier crédit dont Daniel avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Daniel is 26 years old and lives in Benin.  His wife is a homemaker named Rebbéca.  The couple has one child who lives with them and attends school.  They work together to cover the various household  expenses.  Daniel only went to school for a short time.  He learned to become a tailor in order to cover his family’s needs.  He has been working passionately in this field for three years in a city in Benin.  On the side, Daniel also sells dry goods out of his tailor studio.  He purchases his supplies in Benin.  In order to increase his working capital and to better meet his customers’ needs, Daniel is asking for financial support from Alidé for the second time.  He has paid back the first loan that he took out.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making shirts

loans.name: Năm

texts.en:
Năm is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Năm owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs and spices in the local community. Năm has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Năm joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Năm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Năm is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Năm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the food business.

loans.name: Pahe

texts.en:
Pahe is 45 years old, married, and a mother of four children.  Pahe sells dried fish in Mariakani. Her business has been in operation for the last thirteen years.

Pahe, as a KADET LTD client, is requesting her fourth loan to finance her business.  With this loan, she plans to expand her business by purchasing more fish for reselling. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand her business further. Her dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, tiene 42 años, es madre de cinco hijos de (19 – 15 – 10 – 7 y cinco años) con quienes vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. EL trabajo de Lucia consiste en la venta de comida por las noches y venta de jugos por las mañanas, este trabajo lo realiza un local alquilado en una avenida muy concurrida dentro de su zona, este trabajo lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que gana dinero haciendo algo que le gusta, dice que siempre le gusto cocinar, y espera aumentar su negocio y poner una heladería en su local. Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene y espera contar con la ayuda de todos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes y materiales implementar su restaurante, además de frutas y otros insumos para su juguería.
texts.en: Lucia is 42 years old and the mother of 5 children (19, 15, 7 and 5 years old). She lives together with her husband and their children in their own house. Lucia sells food at night and juice in the mornings in rented premises in a busy avenue in the area. She does this work with the help of her children. What she likes the most about her work is that she makes money doing something she likes. She says that she always liked cooking. She expects to increase business and set up an ice-cream parlour on the premises. This is her 2nd loan and hopes that you will all support her. She will use the amount sought to buy ingredients and materials with which to stock up her restraurant as well as fruit and other consumables for her juice bar.

loans.use: to buy products and fruit with which to stock up her restaurant and juice bar.

loans.name: Eliphas

texts.en:
Eliphas is 33 years old. He is married with two children in school. He sells bed covers, bedsheets and curtains to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to grow his business into a wholesale one in five years.

Eliphas has requested a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtains and bed sheets.

loans.use: To buy curtains and bed sheets

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба жительница города Худжанд. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она окончила институт бизнеса и сервиса. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей женской и школьной одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки женской зимней одежды.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 23 years old, married and has two children.  She graduated from a business and service institute.  Today, Nasiba is involved in sales of women's and school clothing.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of women's winter clothing.

loans.use: to buy women's winter clothing

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married Kenyan lady, age 32 years old. Her husband is a businessman. They have 6 children, ages ranging from 4 to 17 years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. Millicent's business is located in a busy market at a residential area in Nairobi. She has been selling clothes for 6 years. She says the business is good and the challenges she has are those of seasonality and high cost of clothes. In the future, Millicent hopes to open another stall. She describes herself as aggressive and responsible.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene un hijo de 4 años vive en la casa de sus abuelos en la zona de Chacacollo, ella se dedica a la venta de almuerzo y por la tarde otros platos especiales,  atiende su puesto de lunes a domingo su esposo se dedica al servicio de transporte, el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una cocina e insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas ya que tiene mucha clientela por la buena comida que ofrece y también por la buena atención que la Sra. brinda ya que la Sra. es una persona muy amable, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Verónica has a four-year-old son, and lives in her in-laws' home in the Chacacollo area.  She works preparing lunch and in the evening makes other special dishes.  She works in her job from Monday to Friday.  Her husband works in transportation.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of a stove and supplies for preparing her meals, as she has many customers who come for the good food she offers and also for the good service that she provides.  The Señora is a very friendly woman, who is grateful to the financial institution for the support that's being provided.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Santos Noe

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Noé tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado y muy orgulloso de sus 4 hijos, Santos es Caficultor y Agricultor, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y agricultura,  lo que ha sido la fuente de ingresos para el sustento de su familia. 
Don Santos utilizara el credito para comprar un sistema solar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia ya que él manifiesta que al tener energía podrá ayudar a la superación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Noé is 36 years old, married, and extremely proud of his four children. He is a coffee grower and farmer. Santos has more than 10 years of experience with farming and growing coffee. These activities make up the source of income that helps to sustain his family.

Don Santos will use this loan to buy a solar panel system, which will improve the living conditions of his family. He says that having this type of energy system will help his children thrive.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Ruth has operated a retail business selling firewood for 4 years. She works 7 days out of every week, selling her products from home.

Ruth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. Ruth also generates additional income through poultry farming and a small retail shop. Ruth's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her businesses are to be come a wholesaler of charcoal and to own 1,500 chickens.

Ruth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria, es de la ciudad de Luque, ella es una cliente recurrente de la fundación, ya que ella por medio de la ayuda que le damos ha podido ir creciendo y ampliando su mercado de ventas. La misma es casada, vive con su marido y sus cuatros hijos.
Maira se dedica a la artesanía hace mas de 10 años, fabrica sombreros y canastas artesanales y los vende por los barrios y las fiestas patronales de cada ciudad. Comenta que actualmente tiene muchos pedidos por que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y le pidieron para hacer canastas de navidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de canastos prefabricados para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con el pedido que le habian hecho.
Dicho prestamo le dara un mejor margen de ganancia a su negocio, lo que le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida y la de sus hijos ya que cuenta con 4 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes y a su vez le ayudan a su madre en dicho trabajo
texts.en:
María is from the city of Luque.  She is a recurring client of the foundation, since by means of the help we give her she has been able to grow and expand her sales market.  She is married and lives with her husband and four children.

María has been working in crafts for more than 10 years.  She makes hats and baskets by hand and sells them in the neighborhoods and at the patron saint day festivals in each city.  She comments that currently she has many orders because the holiday season is coming and she has requests for Christmas baskets.

She is requesting the loan to buy prefabricated baskets to be able to fill the orders she has received.

The loan will give her business a better profit margin, which will help her to improve the standard of living for herself and her children, since she has four children, all of whom are students and also help their mother in her work.

loans.use: to buy baskets to sell.

loans.name: Roger Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Alejandro tiene su negocio de venta de comida en la terminal de buses que viajan a los departamentos de occidente del país.
El cuenta con dos trabajadores quienes se encargan de elaborar  la comida, el vende almuerzos y desayunos. El es casado con dos hijas y estas dependen de el actualmente uno se encuentra en educación primaria y la otra tiene solo un añito de edad.
Ha trabajado ocho créditos con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. Agradece a ceprodel por los préstamos otorgados.
texts.en:
Mr. Alejandro has a food stall at the bus terminal for buses that travel to the departments in the western part of the country.  He has employees who make the food and sell breakfast and lunch.  He is married and has two daughters, one in primary school and one who is only a year and a half old.

He has had eight loans through Ceprodel and all have been used to buy merchandise for his business.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loans he has received.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and soda.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 53, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a contractor, and mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. Olivia works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Olivia hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Khoudia

texts.fr:
Madame Khoudia est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 22 octobre 2007. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de produits de mercerie. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années. 

Son nouveau crédit de 450.000 francs cfa lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l'augmentation de son niveau d'approvisionnement en produits de mercerie. 

Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son activité de petit commerce lui permettront d'acheter une machine à coudre et également d'épargner suffisamment au niveau du Banc Villageois
texts.en:
Ms. Khoudia is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (local village fund) since 22 October 2007.

She has developed a small business selling cloth and dressmaking supplies. She has gained lots of experience in this field, having run her business for several years.

Her new loan of 450,000 francs CFA will allow her to strengthen her business by increasing her supplies of haberdashery items.

The profits realized from her small business will allow her to buy a sewing machine and also build up sufficient savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy cloth and dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en: Erastus is 20 years old. He sells water to earn a living. He has been in the business for one year. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a plastic tank and pipes.

loans.use: To buy a plastic tank and pipes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 29 years old and lives in Northern Poblacion, Baliangao. She is married and has three children.
 
To earn a living, Ofelia has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 4,200 each month doing this work. 

Ofelia has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients for her snack vending business.

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mrs. Juana is a 54 year old woman. She has had a Stationary and Gifts Store for 20 years. This began when her husband was fired from where he used to work, and with the settlement they decided to start a small business as a unique source of income to cover the necessities of their children.

She offers scholastic products and gifts, but she realizes more of these gifts would let her obtain higher gains. She is requesting a loan of $925 USD to pay back in a period of 3-6 months. And with this loan, she wishes to buy more scholastic articles and gifts. She will take advantage of the back to school season, as it is one of the best seasons of the year for her business.

ESPAÑOL

La señora Juana es una mujer de 54 años que tiene un negocio de Papelería, Mercería y Venta de regalos el cual inició hace 20 años, debido a que su esposo fue despedido de donde trabajaba y con el dinero que le dieron pusieron su pequeño negocio como única fuente de ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades de sus tres hijos.

En su negocio ofrece productos escolares y de mercería, aunque confiesa que la venta de regalos es la que deja mayores ganancias. Esta solicitando un crédito por $925 USD a pagar en un período de 3-6 meses, para comprar artículos escolares y regalos y poder aprovechar la temporada escolar que inicia y que trae consigo altas ventas.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Tanumia

texts.en: Tanumia of Maagiagi is an active member of one of the 162 village solidarity groups organized by SPBD. She is a fisherwoman.  With help from her husband, she manages their small fish stand. Monetary assistance from SPBD helped her to fish on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Their sales proved to be worthwhile as they earn $50 each day from selling their fish to the villagers. The income helped pay for school for their 2 smaller children, as well as and family and church obligations. By improving their fishing gear and nets, Tanumia hopes to earn more from her fishing enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and nets

loans.name: Leone

texts.en: Leone S. is a thirty-six year old mother of five children.  She runs two ventures – a taro plantation and a business making and selling banana chips.  On her land she grows both taro and bananas.  The taro she takes to the local market to sell and the bananas she uses to make the chips to sell in the village.  Leone is divorced and raises and supports her children on her own.  She inherited her father’s land when he passed away, and she has developed this land into a solid plantation and she continues to expand it year by year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her taro farm and packaging for banana chips

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like buy two piglets.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is married and has three children, ages 5, 8 and 16. Her husband has a job in the United States, but it was difficult for him to send money to his family. Still needing to provide for her children, four years ago Martha started her own business selling undergarments and footwear. Little by little, she has stocked her business better and incremented her number of clients. Her youngest daughter helps her with the business, and together they have been able to grow it.

To cover current orders and improve her customer service, Martha is requesting a loan of $425, which she plans to repay within six months. You can help this family improve their quality of life. They are grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 5, 8 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo consiguió un trabajo en Estados Unidos le era difícil mandar dinero a su familia, ante esta necesidad y para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban sus hijos desde hace cuatro años Martha inició su propio negocio con la venta de blancos y calzado, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio e incrementando su número de clientes, su hija mayor le ayuda en el negocio y juntas han logrado hacerlo crecer.

Con la finalidad de cubrir pedidos que tiene y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece Martha está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos agradecen mucho el apoyo y la confianza que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Brígida Fríjida

texts.es:
To give her family the best of herself, Doña Brígida has found many ways to provide each person's daily bread. The skill that her mother taught her, embroidery, has served her as a way of earning a living. But this is not the only place she excels; her flavorful tastes has made her into one of the best cooks in her area and she pleases her followers with varied dishes that she offers during holidays in her community. She has developed these abilities thanks to a decision she made 12 years ago to improve her way of life and her family's economic situation. Above all, she is motivated by the desire to see her children become good men and outstanding professionals. She has great dreams of improving herself and for these she is requesting a loan of $850 to acquire materials that she will use for her embroidery and to invest in various other home-based services that she performs. She is thankful to each one of the united hearts that decide to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Para dar lo mejor de si a su familia Doña Brígida ha visto mil formas de proveer el sustento diario a cada uno de sus miembros, es así que el oficio que le enseñó su mamá, el del bordado, le ha servido como un medio para ganarse la vida; pero no solo se desempeña en esta actividad, también su buena sazón la ha convertido en una de las mejores cocineras de su zona y siempre complace a sus seguidores con los variados platos que ofrece en la temporada de celebraciones de su comunidad. Estas habilidades las desarrolló gracias a la decisión que tomó hace 12 años para incrementar el nivel de vida y la economía de su familia. La motivan sobre todas las cosas, el anhelo de ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos excelentes profesionales y hombres de bien. Tiene grandes ideales de superación y por ello solicita un préstamo de 850 dólares para adquirir materiales que le sirvan para sus bordados e invertir en los diversos negocios que ella desempeña en la comodidad de su hogar. Desde ahora agradece a cada uno de los corazones solidarios que se decidan a ayudarla.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for embroidering various garments

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Business Description

Jorge has 20 years experience selling clothes such as skirts, blouses and t-shirts. He was able to obtained some cash from some of his friends to be able to open up his own business. His products varied according to the seasons. His work hours are from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. His wife helps him by selling fish throughout the week.

Loan Use

He will use the loan to purchase a variety of products to add to his merchandise. His products are in high demand and he has a lot of orders. He will also use the loan to purchase more fish so that his wife can sell from home.

Personal Information

Jorge is 47 years old. He's married and he has a baby. His house is made out of reed, and he lives near a creek. He hopes that his income will improve so that he can fix his house little by little. Most importantly to give him peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jorge tiene una experiencia de 20 años con su actividad en la venta de prendas de vestir, faldas, blusas, camisas. Por medio de unos amigos pudo conseguir capital y comenzar a trabajar. Sus productos son variados de acuerdo a la temporada en la cual se encuentra. Su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Además su esposa le ayuda con la venta de pescado salado todos los días de la semana.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería variada. Tiene bastantes pedidos. Además de compra de pescado para que su esposa venda en el portal de su domicilio.

Información Personal

Jorge tiene 47 años. Es casado y tiene 1 bebe. Su casita es de caña y vive a la orilla del estero. Espera poder mejorar sus ingresos para poco a poco ir adecuando su domicilio. Mas que todo darle seguridad.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and to help his wife with her business as well

loans.name: Cesar Hernan

texts.es:
Mr. B. D. has lived in Chosica for 6 years. He and his wife come from the Junin and Puno departments respectively. They have two children, 6 months and 12 years old.

Initially they sold food and breakfast where they gave out food roving through the markets of Chosica. They saved their money little by little to be able to have a store and to provide themselves with commodities for their children that they themselves could not have.

His goal is that his children become professionals so that they can have a better quality of life and so that the same difficulties do not happen to them. For this he exerts himself every day so that his business is profitable and gives his children the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

El señor vive hace 6 años en Chosica, él y su esposa vienen de los departamentos de Junín y Puno respectivamente, tienen 2 hijos de 6 meses y 12 años. Inicialmente se dedicaron a la venta de comida y desayuno en donde repartían ambulatoriamente a los señores de los mercados de Chosica, fueron ahorrando poco a poco su dinero para poner una tienda y poder brindarles las comodidades a sus hijos, ya que ellos no lo pudieron tener. Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales para que así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y no pasen las dificultades que ellos pasaron, por eso se esfuerzan cada día para que su negocio les sea rentable y darles las comodidades básicas a sus hijos.

loans.use: Opening a store

loans.name: Sifatbonu

texts.en:
Sifatbonu C. is 43 years old. She is raising two children alone.

Sifatbonu has been breeding cattle for six years. She sells the cattle in the local market. Currently she has three cows. This business generates a stable income, which is the main source of income for the family. Sifatbonu's older son is 18 years old and helps his mother.

Today Sifatbonu requests $350. She is going to use the loan to purchase a cow. Having proved herself a reliable client , Sifatbonu promises that she shall pay the loan in 12 months, and she thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas are members of the community bank “Estrellas”. Mercerdes joined the bank just two years ago, while Delia and Felicitas have been members for over twelve years. In that time they have learned punctuality and responsibility. They also have found support and friendship among the other members of the bank.

Mercedes is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. Mercedes sells fruits such as tuna, which is a local fruit that comes from a cactus. She sells her fruit from the central market in Ayacucho and has had this business for 15 years.

Delia is 43 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 10 and 23. Since becoming a member of the community bank, Delia has not only been able to improve her business but was also able to save enough to buy her home. Delia sells a variety of products and changes seasonally. Right now she is selling tuna; soon she will begin to sell cochinillo, which is a small bug found on the cactus plants and used to make red dyes.

Felicitas is 46 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 17 and 29. Felicitas travels to different markets around the region buying grains that she then sells in Ayacucho along with selling clothing. Two months ago she also started selling fresh orange juice on one of the main streets of Ayacucho.

Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in the purchase of fruits, tuna, oranges, and a nicer juicer.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas are all saving to pay for their children’s education. Mercedes and Felicitas have daughters in university, one studying nursing and the other anthropology. Delia has a daughter about to start her first year of college. Their dreams are for their children to have a better life.

loans.use: Mercedes, Delia, and Felicitas need loans of 1000, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in the purchase of fruits, tuna, oranges, and a nicer juicer.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Alpha is 45 years old and married with 4 children. He sells second-hand clothes in the town of Kabala.  Before joining the Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) program, life was hard for the family. His stock was too small to generate sufficient income.  With his previous loan, his stock increased and, with the daily income, his children can now have two meals a day, and he can also meet their school expenses. Alpha would like to continue expanding his business and is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000.

loans.use: To further expand his clothing business.

loans.name: Marqueza 1 Group

texts.es:
The group "Marqueza 1" consists of Nery M. H., who runs a convenience store; Ariely L. D., who sells chicken; Carmen M. G., who also runs a convenience store; and Guadalupe G., who start her perfume, cosmetic and lotion business three years ago. She sells her products to all the women she knows, especially the ones who are more wealthier because she collects her bills weekly or every other week depending on her finances. With the loan Guadalupe, who is 37 years old and has three children, will invest in the purchase of more products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO MARQUEZA 1 ESTA INTEGRADO POR: NERY M. H. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES), ARELY L. D. (VENTA DE POLLO), CARMEN M. G. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y GUADALUPE G. G. QUE INICIO SU NEGOCIO DE PERFUMES, COSMETICOS Y CREMAS DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS. ELLA OFRECE SUS PRODUCTOS A TODAS LAS MUJERES QUE CONOZCA Y SEPA QUE SON PAGADORAS YA QUE LOS PAGOS SON SEMANALES O QUINCENALES DEPENDIENDO SU ECONOMIA. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS PRODUCTOS Y CONSIDERA QUE ES BUENO QUE UNA MUJER SE DE “ UNA MANITA DE GATO “. ELLA TIENE 37 AÑOS Y TIENE TRES HIJOS.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of perfumes, lotions and cosmetics / INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE PERFUMES, CREMAS, COSMETICOS

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo M. is 28 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who all attend school. She is responsible for household expenses of her children. To earn money, she sells bananas on the side of the road. Since bananas are found everywhere in this region of Togo, a large part of the population consumes them. Adjo wishes to use this loan to buy more fresh bananas in neighboring villages in order to resell them in Kpalimé. With the profits she will make from her sales, she will be able to provide for her childrens' needs at school.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adjo M. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, tous à l’école. Elle est responsable des charges du foyer pour ses enfants et pour gagner de l’argent, elle vend les bananes au bord de la route. Comme les bananes sont partout ce région du Togo, une grande partie de la population les consomme. Adjo souhaite avec ce crédit acheter plus des bananes fraîches dans les villages environnants pour revendre à Kpalimé. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école.

loans.use: Acheter les bananes

loans.name: Oimgul

texts.ru:
Oimgul H. lives in the Khuroson region. She is married and has 2 children. Their family is very close and strong, which helps them deal with common problems. She stays at home and takes care of animals. She feeds calfs, so they could gain weight, and her husband sells them later on. She would like to obtain a loan to purchase one more calf. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months. Her business helps local residents purchase fresh and quality meat, and also helps Oimgul and her husband provide for their family.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хотамова Оимгуль проживает врайоне Хуросон. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Они живут очень весело и дружно , что помогает им пережить возникающие проблемы. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Откармливает молодых бычков , а муж продает на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Погасить кредит она сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Ее бизнес помогает населению покупать свежее и качественное мясо , а так же помогает мужу обеспечивать семью.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Gladys And Magdalena Group

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34-year-old mother of one son. Gladys has a small store in her house where she sells house supplies and vegetables and is helped by her husband during his free time.

Meanwhile, Magdalena is a married, 52-year-old mother of six children. Magdalena is a fabric artisan, working with cloth to make blankets with the help of her husband. She sells her products in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes in the city of Huancayo.

Gladys and Magdalena are members of Las Entusiastas Village Bank. They need loans of 300 and 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles respectively to invest in rice, sugar, wool, and thread.

Gladys and Magdalena’s dream is to change their businesses to something more profitable, to improve their standard of living, and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in rice, sugar, wool, and thread

loans.name: Alejandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Alejandra Lisseth M. R. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi.  Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan. 

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.



“Hola mi nombre es Alejandra M. R., soy ama de casa, trabaja de una empresa comercial, soy casada y tengo 4 hijos, solicito este préstamo porque necesito una barda en la parte posterior  de mi casa ya que mis hijos juegan ahí, y me urge la seguridad en ellos también protecciones para las ventanas y vitropiso, porque la familia esta creciendo y queremos mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.”

loans.use: Construccion y protecciones en la vivienda.

loans.name: Ludwin Osay

texts.es:
El microempresario Ludwin B. J. tiene 48 años de edad, es de la etnia creole, es casado con 5 hijos quienes estudian en la universidad y nivel secundario, tiene un bus desde hace un poco mas de 4 años con el cual brinda servicios de transporte a estudiantes del nivel primario de la localidad, ofreciéndoles el servicio de ida y regreso al colegio, tiene un total de 60 estudiantes a los cuales por contratos mensuales les facilita el servicio.

Este negocio le permite ingresos para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar, sin embargo por las condiciones de las vías públicas a los vehículos se les debe dar mantenimiento sistemático para que puedan funcionar permanentemente. 

Por tal razón el señor B. necesita financiamiento para comprar: 4 pares de llantas para el microbús las que cuestan US$ 128 cada par, 4 pares de retenedores que cuestan US$ 14 cada par, 1 filtro de aire valorado en US$ 16, 1 juego de fricciones traseras a US$ 48 el juego, 1 banda de agua US$ 70, 2 bombillos de frenos a US$ 15 cada uno y el mantenimiento al motor le cuesta US$ 90.
texts.en:
Ludwin B., a micro-entrepreneur, is 48 years old, is from the creole ethnic group, married with five children who study university and high school, he has had a bus for over four years, with which he provides transporting services to elementary level students of the community, taking them to and from school, he has a total of 60 students with whom he has monthly contracts, which facilitates the service. This business generates income to help with home expenses; however, the road conditions cause the need to maintain the vehicle so that it works properly. This is why Mr. B. needs financing to buy 4 pairs of tires for the microbus at US$128/pair, 4 pairs of retainers at US$14/pair, 1 air filter valued at US$16, 1 set of back frictions at US$48/set, 1 water band at US$70, 2 break lights at US$15 each and motor maintenance at US$90.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment to give maintenance to bus

loans.name: Ur

texts.en:
Mrs. Ur S. was born in 1965 and lives in Suong Keit Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food to villagers and tourists. Mrs. Ur S. is a 43-year-old widow with three children, one of whom repairs cars, while the remaining two are attending the local school. The repair business has a problem because of insufficient car parts in inventory.

Mrs. Ur S. decided to ask for a loan to buy car parts for her child who is in the car repair business.

loans.use: To buy car parts for a car repair business.

loans.name: Niger Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Níger habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Libertad, tiene 44 años de edad, desde muy joven ha trabajado con sus padres pues el negocio de la familia ha sido la venta de marisco, actualmente vende chacalines, ostiones y otros productos de mariscos tiene veinte años en las ventas, sus ventas son bajas cuando hay marea roja, este negocio fue heredado por sus padres, ahora desea invertir mas en compra de marisco para ofertar mas a sus clientes ya que se vende bastante, por eso opciono hacer un préstamo en Afodenic para comprar mas producto de marisco, lo cual desea con esta inversión lograr mas clientes y ingresos. A futuro es comprar un medio de transporte para a si transportar el sus mismo productos.
texts.en:
Niger lives in the Villa Libertad neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. He is 44 years old and has worked with his parents since he was young selling seafood. Today he sells shrimp, scallops and other seafood. He has been selling seafood for 20 years. His sales are low when there is red tide. He inherited this business from his parents, now he wishes to invest in buying more seafood to offer to his customers as he sells quite a bit, and therefore he opted for a loan through Afodenic to buy more seafood products so he can acquire more customers and income. In the future he plans to buy a means of transportation so he can transport his products himself.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seafood

loans.name: Join

texts.en:
Join J. sells charcoal and beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Join is 35 years old, married, and has eight children. Her husband is a store keeper in the UN office. Her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs and services are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Success

texts.en:
Success M. is 45 years old and married with 7 children.

Success sells second hand clothes and fish. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to purchase her goods to sell in Benin City.

She needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more fish and second hand clothes to sell. She says thank you to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and also second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Shama James Group

texts.en:
Shama baji is a 28-year-old married lady and has lived in an area called Ismail Nagar of the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 11 years. She completed her education up to 5th standard but couldn’t study further because her parents were not able to provide for her education. She is married to a man whose name is J. and he is a driver by profession. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) with an experience of 6 years. She is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. All of her kids are getting an education from a local school.

Shama baji is a very responsible lady. She gives priority to her family over herself. She gets up early and does all the household work. After that she sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to pay the remaining installments of her husband’s auto-rickshaw.

Shama baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, beads, and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Maria baji wants a loan to buy mobile phones for her mobile phone shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments of her husband's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra.María B. tiene 55años de edad,está casada con el Sr.Antonio González,juntos tienen 4 hijos, dos mayores de edad, una en edad escolar y otro es un chico especial.

                Hace 10 años que tiene su puesto de venta de comidadas  ràpidas  en la entrada de la ciudad de Carapeguá, donde la concurrencia de clientes  es mayor y existen  mas  posibilidades de venta  y aumentar  los  ingresos

Es una Sra.muy sacrificada que manifiesta que gracias a su trabajo  pudo solventar siempre los tratamientos de su hijo, que requiere de mucho cuidado.

               Con el crèdito adquirido comprara : maiz, queso ,grasa
texts.en:
María B. is 55 years old. She is married with Antonio González and together they have four children: two are adults, a school-aged daughter and a special-needs son. They have had a fast-food stall for 10 years, located at the entrance of the city of Carapeguá where there are a great number of clients and a greater possibility of making sales and increasing their profits. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who says that thanks to her work she has always been able to afford her son's treatments; he requires a lot of care. She will use the loan to buy corn, cheese and lard.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese and lard for her fast-food business

loans.name: Lusajo M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Lusajo K. from Tukuyu. She is divorced and has children between the ages of 5 and 18. Lusajo has been selling maize since 2004. She buys the maize from the farmers and sell it in town. 

She works at her business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lusajo currently earns about $200 USD each month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 USD to purchase more maize in bulk. In the future, she plans to start selling crops other than maize. Lusajo thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more maize in bulk

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sinten

texts.id: Setelah dua kali mengikuti program pinjaman ternak babi di Dinari, Ni Ketut Sinten kini melanjutkan pinjamannya ke tahap yang ketiga. Dari induk babi yang dipeliharanya saat ini, sudah melahirkan 8 ekor anak. Jika dijual dengan Harga Rp. 325.000.- / ekor Ni Ketut Sinten bisa memperoleh keuntungan bersih setelah di potong biaya pakan dan obat sebesar Rp. 800.000.- Keuntungan ini di pergunakan untuk biaya keperluan pendidikan anaknya dan biaya hidup sehari – hari. Ni Ketut Sinten berharap Kiva melalui Dinari dapat terus membantunya dalam hal permodalan. Sehingga usahanya dapat terus berjalan dan semakin meningkat.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sinten participated in Dinari pig farming loan program twice in the past. She is now participating for her 3rd term. The breeding pig that she has now has produced 8 piglets which can be sold for USD 29/ piglet. From this she can earn a net profit of USD 72 (after all deduction for pig feed and raising cost). She uses this money to fund her children eduction and their daily living cost.

She is hoping for Dinari to be able to assist her with further loan so she can expand her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy feeds

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Diện Thị Trần was born in 1972. She and her husband go to work at the market together. She has two daughters. They have a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND (or about $197). Everybody in her group loves her. She is a group leader. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND (or about $38) to buy goods to resell in the market.

There are three other fund participants in her group. Thúy Thị Trần was born in 1975. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND (or about $233) to repair her house. Thái Thị Nguyễn was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 4.578.000 VND (or about $258) to buy a pig and chicken. Mùi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1964. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND (or about $307) to buy a pig and chicken.

loans.use: To buy more goods to resell at the market

loans.name: Ramzana M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Ramzana baji is a wife of M. S. who lives in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband operates a fruit selling business. He buys fruits from the famous market (Sunday Bazaar) at low rates and sells to the fruit shops to earn a profit. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Ramzana baji is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to increase the profits of her husband.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy material (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her Punjabi food selling business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Anwar Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Anwar baji is married to Mr R.,and together they have lived in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines, for the past ten years. Anwar baji fills small packets with various spices and sells them in her community. She earns a good income from this business and can pay the utility bills easily. Mr R. runs a leather business. In Kasur most people come into contact with leather-selling businesses because people wear 'Khussa', a traditional kind of footwear made from leather. Anwar baji is applying for a loan to buy leather to expand her husband’s leather-selling business.

Anwar baji is the leader of a group loan that includes six other women. Naziran baji, Salma baji, Nazia baji, Zainab baji, Bable Shaheen baji and Ayesha baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

As this is a group loan, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Agness M. from Mbeya. She is married with one 7-year-old child. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one orphaned dependent. 

Agness has been running a beauty salon business since 2002. Her business is the place where her friends and fellow women can gather and literally let their hair down.  Most beauty salons in Tanzania are places where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Agness currently earns about 90 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her salon. In the future, she plans to open another salon. Agness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her salon

loans.name: Dora Josefa

texts.es:
Gracias a los grandes esfuerzos llevados a cabo por la señora Dora A., ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio de venta de ropa habiendo mejorado su negocio adquiriendo mercadería la cual la ofrece a diario en su establecimiento. 

Ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa y así mantener sus estantes listos para cuando llegan sus clientes puedan llevar el producto y lograr su satisfacción. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua y se dedica a este negocio desde hace siete años.
texts.en:
Thanks to the blessings of a greater power, Mrs. Dora has achieved success in her clothing business. She has improved her business by acquiring merchandise that she offers daily to her customers in her establishment. She is looking to Ceprodel for a loan to buy clothes and stock her shelves so that when her customers arrive they can buy her products and be satisfied. Her business is located in the wholesale market in Managua. She has been in business for seven years.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Adela es casada tiene seis hijos todos mayores y están trabajando.
Adela  empezó vendiendo en el mercado en un puesto alquilado papa, y verduras, le fue bien,  pero decidió  vender en su  casa puso una bodega hace un año y medio, también ella tiene maquinas indústriales y con su familia confeccionan faldas 
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser cumplida en el trabajo y con las cuotas.
Adela necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para invertirlos en su bodega, y comprar verduras, saco D. papas, arroz, aceite. 
El sueño D. Adela es crecer mas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Adela is married, and she has six grown children who work. Adela started selling potatoes and vegetables from a rented stand in the market. It went well for her. But, a year and a half ago she decided to set up a mini market in her house. She also has industrial machines, which she and her family use to make skirts. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to be very responsible in her work and with her payments. Adela needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes, rice, and oil for her mini market. Adela’s dream is to grow more in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes, rice, and oil for her mini market

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June A., a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Vavau, is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, June owns and operates a general store whose main income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. June has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately $3500 WST a month.

In 2002, June joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of $2500 WST from SPBD that was used to expand the business, she is now requesting a new loan of $3250 WST to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. The loan will be her seventh from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
“Time is gold”: this is Gina’s main principle in life. She is already 27 years old and married to Rogelio S.. They have one child named Princess Aira who is just two years old.

Gina and her husband have a lot of hopes and dreams for their child and their future children. According to her, she doesn’t want her child to experience what she’s been through. She never had a stable life because she did not finish her studies. She wishes that her child will not suffer by being uneducated like her.

Gina has run a general store for three years already. She started operating her business when her husband went abroad to support them. They sacrificed being away from each other for the sake of their future. Her husband’s salary is being saved for the education of their child and for their future as a whole family.

Gina engaged herself in her retailing business hoping to help her husband in gaining income to support their daily needs. Gina wants to ask for a loan of PHP 5,000 to further expand her business. She’s always wanted to grow it with her own ability. Her future plan for the loan is to purchase additional products like rice to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Plank Field Good People Group

texts.en:
Plank Field Good People, led by Joseph F., is a group of five borrowers living and working in New Road, West Point, a very poor neighborhood near downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  Joseph is 56 years old, married with five children ranging in age from 8 to 29. Their levels of education are range from 5th to 9th Grade.  Joseph is illiterate.

Joseph sells construction wood, which he buys wholesale, to the residents of West Point. He has been running his business for 19 years, and his dream is to build up his wood business until he can sell it in order to buy a pig farm. Joseph started this business with a small amount and needs more funding to improve his operation.  With the profits from this business and the pig farm, Joseph dreams of sending his children to school and living in a better environment.

loans.use: For the purchase of more wood plank in order to acquire more profit.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Rogelio es casado con la señora Irma Yolanda y son padres de 2 hijos en edad escolar. El labora para un taller de soldadura desde hace 2 años. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de su vivienda ya que sus hijos están creciendo y desean tener mas espacio para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio is married to Irma Yolanda and they are parents to 2 school-aged children. He has worked at a welding shop for the past 2 years. They are requesting this loan to expand their house given that their children are growing and they would like to have more room to provide more comfort for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their house.

loans.name: Laura Lizethe

texts.es: Laura Lizethe T.  y su esposo Antonio de Jesús venden ropa nueva y usada en un lugar muy conocido de la ciudad. A esta actividad se dedican desde hace un año, esto lo hacen por que es una pareja que se caso muy joven, cuentan con un bebe esto hace que en su familia tengan mayor gastos por lo que con este proyecto tendrían mas oportunidad de sacar a delante a su hijo, además estudian la universidad y también requiere gastos de escuela y gastos de quien cuida a su hijo en lo que ellos estudian.

loans.use: Surtir Mercancia

loans.name: Danys Edgardo

texts.es: Danys Edgardo M. C. originario del departamento de La Libertad vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 meses de nacido.
