He currently owns 3 industrial sewing machines, which are used to give a quality finish to the seams. His business is family operated and all his children except the smallest work with him creating and repairing mattresses.

Mr.P. is requesting a loan to allow him to purchase cotton, cloth and other materials to increase production which will allow his family to offer their goods to local retailers.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Kirinyabigo I(B) Group

texts.en:
Racheal is 27 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells snacks for a living. She wants to use the extra business profits to begin a poultry business. Rose has a retail shop and wants to use the loan to expand business. Mariam offers tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Marleney's Group

texts.en:
Marleney and Magna have been members of the community bank “Estrellas” for eight months. In that time they have learned how to manage their businesses more efficiently. They joined the community bank because the process was simplified and they receive more support.

Marleney is 23 years old. Marleney sells construction materials. She travels to a variety of regional markets to buy construction materials, which she then sells from her home. In addition, Marleney is an artisan weaver who makes beautiful blankets and tapestries. She has been weaving all of her life and learned this art from her parents. Marleney is also studying nursing at the local university.

Magna is 25 years old. She is the single mother of one son. Magna travels to both the Ayacuchan jungle and Lima, both of which are about eight hours away, where she buys and trades goods such as fruit, clothing, and potatoes.

Marleney and Magna need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use for buying construction materials, and a variety of other products.

One of the important aspects of the community bank is interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Marleney and Magna plan to use their savings to pay for their own education and for the education of their children. Their dreams are to be a good nurse and to help those who need it, and to own a home.

loans.use: Marleney and Magna need loans of 600 and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use for buying construction materials, and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is 43 years old and married with 4 children. With his previous loan from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Suleman and his wife started selling roasted goat meat in the market of Kabala in Sierra Leone. The roasted meat is in high demand. Due to lack of sufficient capital, Suleman buys meat in small quantities and goat meat is scarce in the market. He is requesting a loan of Le.1,000,000 to purchase 6 goats at a time to meet his customers demand and to generate more income.

Suleman has a great opportunity to incease his business and meet the needs of his customers. He needs additional capital to purchase enough goats to supply his hungry patrons.

loans.use: To purchase 6 goats

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Pablina is married and has 4 children. She is the owner of a business, Despensa, a general store, located in one of the most crowded and busiest neighborhoods in the city of Itacuribi in the Cordilleras.

Pablina comments, that apart from the store, she also has six cows, which she takes care of, and part of her income comes from the sale of their milk.

To manage her multiple jobs, Pablina has the help of her daughters at the general store.

She and her daughter have undertaken projects in cheesemaking, and selling them in the city of Eusebio Ayala y Caacupe.

With the loans provided by the Paraguaya Foundation, Pablina could buy merchandise to supply for sale at a good price, and in quantity, including sugar, milk, meat, oil, cheese, cookies, and all kinds of drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

Pablina esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a las venta de productos de consumo diario (Despensa), su negocio esta úbicado en uno de los barrios mas concurridos y con mucho movimiento de gente de la ciudad de Itacuribí de las Cordilleras.

Pablina comenta, que aparte de la despensa, también tiene 6 vacas lecheras al cual también le dedica su atención y es mas forma parte de una de las actividades que le genera ingresos como la venta de leche.

Para hacer frente a las múltiples ocupaciones, las señora es ayudada por una de sus hijas en la atención de la despensa.

Tiene proyectado conjuntamente con su hija la de fabricar quesos, y proveerles a los fabricantes y vendedores de chipas de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala y Caacupé.

Con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar mercaderias para surtir su despensa a un buen precio y en cantidades importantes, entre la que podemos detallar son azúcar, leche,carne vacuna, aceite, quesos, galleta, y bebidas de todo tipo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cookies, sugar, yerba (tea), coffee, all times of drinks, meat, oil, etc.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
I've been doing some remodeling at my house but I haven't been able to finish because I don't have the money to do so. That's why I'm applying for a $1,100 loan. Installing the flooring and finishing the interior work is all that I have to do to finish the remodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

He estado haciendo unas remodelaciones a la casa. Pero no e podido terminarla por falta de dinero. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,100.00 Dlls. La colocación del vitropiso y acabados de interior de la casa ya que nada mas eso me esta haciendo falta para ya tenerla total mente terminada la remodelación.

loans.use: Install flooring and finish interior work.

loans.name: Anvar.

texts.ru: Шокиров Анвар живет со своей семьей в районе Рудаки. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Кроме того вместе с ним живет сноха и маленькая внучка.  У них большая семья , но они все помогают друг другу. Его жена занимается золотошитьем. Шьет и вышивает нациoнальные наряды для невест. Сам он  работает на рынке «Дехкон» , где имеет торговую точку. Продает овощи. Хочет получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот . Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika is a married woman with 2 children aged 9 and 5. She became a bites seller in 1990. Every day, she works from 6:30am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Zalika has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zalika now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 44 years old. She is married and she has 7 children aged between 3 and 16 years old. She has been selling charcoal and chicken since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 4 PM at her business and she can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Maryam is seeking a loan to buy more charcoal and chicken to resell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and chicken

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina A. started her fish sales nine years ago in Dunkwa, a suburb of Obuasi where she lives. Regina prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of assorted fish so she can increase her income and support her children's education. She belongs to the Gospel Light Trust Group in which members guarantee the repayment of loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Yok

texts.en:
Mrs. Yok S., 28, is a farmer in Kosh Nhaer Village in the Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Soy Set, is a construction worker who makes a small income to help support his family. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Yok S. and her husband have income from different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. To improve their living standards, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings and purchase timbers to build a new house for her family. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To add to savings and purchase timbers to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Evelyn Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Evelyn está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6xto crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), trabaja como docente de la Escuela César Augusto Salinas PInell desde hace 10 años, tiene una hija de 11 añitos que estudia su quinto grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y comparten los gastos del hogar, además ayuda  a cuidar a sus ancianos padres;  Evelyn es una mujer  con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños  a aprender a leer y escribir en la zona urbana de la Nueva Guinea ,  su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con créditos anteriores inicio poco a poco a mejorar sus condicones de vida y de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is seeking refinancing for a sixth loan to invest into making improvements to her home (building a new room). She has worked as a teacher at the César Augusto Salinas Pinell School for the past 10 years. She has an 11-year old daughter who is in fifth grade. Her husband works in construction and they share the household expenses. In addition, she helps to take care of her elderly parents. Evelyn has high hopes of personal success, is very responsible, and an educator who loves her work since she helps many children learn to read and write in an urban zone of New Guinea. Her dreams include finishing her degree in Education Sciences, having stable employment, good health, living in a home with better conditions. She is thankful to AFODENIC, since the previous credits have allowed her to slowly improve her living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a new bedroom.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old and married with 6 children, who are all enrolled in school.

Joyce A. O. has been selling cereals in the local market in Rongo, Kenya since 2002. Over the past 6 years, Joyce has been purchasing her cereal supplies from the towns of Sinare, Busia, and Ahero. She has recently decided to expand her business and would like a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings ($150.00) to expand her inventory and purchase larger quantities of cereals.

loans.use: Buy more cereal to sell

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud lives in Penjikent, Tajikistan. He is 43 years old, married, and has one son. Mahmud is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling livestock. Every year he purchases young calves from local villagers, raises them for 8-9 months, and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Mahmud is thinking about expanding his business, because his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He wants to purchase more calves and fodder. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for the term of 12 months. Extend your solidarity to Mahmud so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key location along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and many great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve ittheirs agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have the opportunity to support themselves through viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Celia Pastora

texts.es: Doña Celia  tiene 35 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama memorial sandino, junto a su esposo y sus hijos, son dos de 14 y 18 años de edad,  que están cursando sus estudios, su esposo trabaja de cadete de taxis trabajo agotador y a veces están mal y tiene que buscar clientes en toda la ciudad para ayudar a su familia. La Sra. Celia tiene una pulpería, la cual inicio con ayuda y recursos que su esposo dio, para cubrir las necesidades del desempleo de el. Este es su segundo crédito con este va invertir en la compra de productos variados para surtir la pulpería y se incrementen las ventas, que espera que sea de mucho beneficio como en su negocio, como en su vida personal para salir adelante y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijas con los estudios. Sus planes a  futuro es poder tener un mayor financiamiento para poder crecer y tener otra diversidad de productos, también espera seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Celia is 35 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of the capital city, Managua. She lives with her husband and two children, who are 14 and 18 years old. Her children are students and her husband works as a taxi driver, which is exhausting work. Sometimes things don’t go well and he has to drive all over the city looking for customers so he can earn money to take home to his family. Celia has a general store which she opened with money that her husband gave her so she could support them when he was unemployed. This is the second loan that she has requested and she will use the loan to invest in the purchase of various products to stock her store and increase sales. She hopes that this will help the store a great deal, as well as help her get ahead in her personal life and keep supporting her children’s education. In the future she plans on having better financing so the store can grow and have a greater variety of products. She also hopes to keep improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her general store

loans.name: José Leopoldo

texts.es:
El negocio de panadería en todo momento requiere de inversión para llevar a cabo la elaboración del pan y así ofrecerlo a los clientes que lo demandan. En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino el señor José Leopoldo Gutierrez se dedica a su negocio de panadería donde todos los días elabora todo tipo de pan desde simple hasta dulce con el propósito de comercializarlo en su municipio.

Actualmente ha logrado mejorar sus ventas y acaparar más clientes y esto por la razón de que muy sabiamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos los cuales le han beneficiado en la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración del pan. Con el crédito que solicita actualmente se beneficia grandemente y beneficia su negocio ya que lo invertirá en el mejoramiento de su local con el propósito de brindarle mejores condiciones a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The business of a bakery in all moments requires an investment to carry out bread making and consequently offer the goods to clients who demand it. In the municipality of Sandino City Mr. José Leopoldo Gutierrez dedicates himself to his bakery business where every day he makes all types of bread, from simple to sweet, with the purpose of selling it all over his municipality. At present he has been able to improve his sales and garner more clients, and this because he has wisely turned to Ceprodel to obtain loans that have benefited him in the purchase of basic bread making materials. This loan that he is currently requesting benefits him and his business greatly given that he will invest it in the improvement of his business locale with the purpose of offering his clients better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to his bakery locale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice A. has a business selling onions and cooking oil at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Joice is 44 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has five children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en: Balbina A. is a sixty-nine-year-old mother of four. Her husband is a farmer and a fisherman. The family resides in a beautiful village in front of Cuyo East Pass facing the South China Sea, on the island of Panay, Philippines. She buys and resells fish and vegetables to support the needs of the family. She applied for this loan to buy farm supplies such as seed, fertilizer, and insecticides, and to get additional capital for fish vending. Balbina wants to purchase these items in advance so as to get a lower price, because when she buys during planting season the cost is much higher. She hopes that in the future she can save their harvest for their own consumption rather than sell the harvest to finance their next crop.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and insecticides for farm, and for capital for fish vending business.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a clothes seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Hidaya Njema group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business for 7 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for sale, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Rahma is 41 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, 15 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale, to improve her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 50 years old, is married with four children. They are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in garlic and ginger. Apart from being used to spice up food, garlic and ginger have medicinal properties. They are used in preparation of local herbal mixtures in the treatment of malaria and other common ailments.

Beatrice has been a retailer of ginger and garlic for the past two years and has since been very resourceful to her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of garlic and ginger to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country. This she believes will decrease her cost very significantly to enable her to raise good income to support her children at school.

Beatrice is a member of the trust group called Olivet. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase garlic and ginger in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Kyarwabuyamba A Animu Bangamba Group

texts.en: Animu B. is aged 44 and a single mother of four kids, all schooling. She has been operating her business of selling restaurant items for over three years but she does not have a refrigerator for perishables. She is using the loan to purchase restaurant items like food (bananas, meat, millet flour, maize flour, etc). She is an active entrepreneur, whose dream is to obtain a refrigerator for perishables and construct another house.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant items like food (bananas, meat, millet flour, maize flour, etc).

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia N. is 41 years old, married, and has one child—a son who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Cecilia’s husband is a farmer. She sells cosmetics such as powder, cream, perfume, and so forth, on a tabletop at the lorry station. She also sells footwear. Cecilia buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Cecilia aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, or Lhor to her friends, is 48 and has been in the rice-distribution business for six years. She lives, together with her family, a couple of blocks away from the city's garbage dump area, popularly known as Payatas. Under and around the foot of the gigantic mountain of garbage live Philippines' poorest urban residents, the scavengers. Lorna has four kids, two of whom are in college. Her eldest already graduated from college, all thanks to her rice business. 

Lhor owns one of the only three government rice-distribution stores in Payatas. She regularly receives two rice deliveries per week. Each delivery gives her 20 sacks (50 kilos each) of government rice, which she pays for upon delivery. She then repacks the rice and sells it to the community for PHP18.00 per kilo, half the price of other commercial rice. The delivery, repacking and selling all lasts but a day after delivery. The business earns an income of PHP20,000.00 per month.

Lhor considers the business not only as a blessing to her family, but most importantly to her community. More than 300 residents, some of them scavengers from around Payatas, line up every week to get their weekly ration of rice. The line can go as far as 100 meters from the front of Lhor's store. She says she wants to upgrade her order of 40 sacks a week to 70, because more and more families are not able to buy their ration because Lhor's supply runs out every time for them. Dealers like Lorna are chosen by the Social Welfare Department as authorized distributors to poor communities.

Lhor has never missed a savings or loan payment for all her six years of borrowing. Her previous loan was for PHP30,000. She is now borrowing her 13th loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

CCT is a Filipino family-oriented and Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates equal business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: Expand her government rice-distribution business

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es: Es un grupo que esta en su 2º ciclo, formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio "Valle hermoso", donD. se conocen bien, el Banco D. Emprendimiento "LAS OBRERAS" esta conformado por la socia Erika A., quien dirige al grupo, muy bien, ella tiene como negocio , la venta D. calzados y cosmeticos por catalogos, tambien tiene una tienda D. barrio, ella esta concubinada y tiene un solo hijo, es una persona muy sacrificada para salir adelante. Como tesorera esta la socia  Martha  Flores quien actualmente esta separada del esposo, tiene una hija, recibe renta D. su auto ella contola al chofer, pero tiene pensado tener alguna otra entrada mas por que desea tener su casita propia. Y como secretario esta es socio  Elmer C., es un socio que trabaja con taxi en la linea nº 131 en el Sindicato San Miguel, es soltero, no tiene hijos, pero si colabora a sus padres. dice que el credito lo usa para mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.
texts.en:
This is the Las Obreras community bank's second cycle. The members are women who live in the same Valle Hermoso neighborhood and know each other well. The group is well-led by member, Erika Argandona, who has a business selling footwear and cosmetics that she buys from catalogs and resells. She also has a neighborhood shop. Erika is patnered and has one son. She is someone who has give up a lot to get ahead. The treasurer, Martha Flores, who is now separated, has one daughter. She receives an income from a car that she leases to a driver and is thinking of getting another so that she can ultimately make enough to own her own house. The secretary, Elmer C., has a taxi business that he operates along Line 131 for the San Miguel cooperative. Elmer is single and childless, but he helps out his parents. He says that he will use the loan to service his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en:
Sifaga L. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 60-year-old woman, living in the town of Mulifanua. She is married and has seven adult children. Sifaga has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 700 WST a month. (0)

In 2004, Sifaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sifaga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Sifaga is now requesting a new loan of 2,600 WST which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be her fifth loan from SPBD. Sifaga plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating a general store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. manages a general store business in the rural village of San Jose, Santiago City, where her family lives happily. Elena is married to Vicente Sr. The couple are blessed with five children, four of whom graduated from high school and one of whom was able to finish a two-year course at college. Elena and her husband do not have the financial resources to sustain their children's education as the store is their only means of income.

Elena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to use as additional capital for the improvement of her store. She hopes to buy stocks of merchandise to retail in the store. In doing this, Elena believes she can increase her income, and will wisely reinvest it back in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora emprendedora Yamileth del Socorro C. V. tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es casada, esta señora tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella. Tiene sueños de instalar su negocio en un lugar más cómodo para sus clientes.  Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Su ubicación es en su casa de habitación. Sus inicios empiezan desde hace más de 5 años,  al adquirir la practica en el negocio su mama decide dejarle el negocio a ella  para que este no pierda los antecedentes familiares y desde entonces es ella quien ha tenido a cargo este negocio. Por lo que es necesario el financiamiento para la compra de capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de calzado, pantalones, camisas, faldas y cosméticos.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo T. is from the village of Biasong. He is 53 years old. Alfredo is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alfredo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alfredo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James P. is from the village of Magsaysay in Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. James is single. To make a living, James owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. James has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, James joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. James has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. James is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by James from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria's home-based beauty supply retail business was started out of her desire to begin something on her own, proving to herself that she could succeed and earn money on her own. For five years, she has been testing the waters by selling skin care products in her native country, the Philippines. She now plans to start in the United States, since seeing that she has had success abroad.

In the Philippines, Maria's family manages her registered store, and she uses the income to support them. This business has been important for her family's well-being. In the past, they relied on her for remittances from the United States. They now feel empowered by being part of a business that they help to run.

Maria is ambitious and very determined. She wants to sell her products around the world, but plans to start in the U.S. The products she currently sells are new to the market, and she has been testing them out with her customers for two years, putting a lot of time into skin care product education.

loans.use: Inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
La señora Enedina P. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales han  pagado puntual mente.
Donde actual mente en la casa que esta viviendo es de renta y le están pidiendo que desocupe la vivienda, decido tener su propia casa y un lugar seguro para ella y su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la diferencia que tiene para que le puedan entregar su casa y así tener su patrimonio seguro para su familia. 
Doña Enedina tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada y nueva afuera de su vivienda este ingreso es para pagar el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares le ayudara su hija la señora Rosaura Juárez P. quien vive.
texts.en:
Enedina P. has had three loans with FVP, which she paid off punctually. She is currently renting the house where she lives, and they are asking her to leave the house. She decided to have her own house in a safe place for her and her family. She is a single mother, who is responsible for two children. She is asking for a loan to be able to pay the difference that she has to pay so that they will be able to give her the house. That way she will have a secure inheritance for her family. For over two years Enedina has been selling new and used clothes outside of her house. This income is to pay the loan. Her mother, Rosaura Juárez P., helps her with the family expenses. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the difference for a house bought through a government loan

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
E. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, 19, attends university and his two younger daughters, 16 and 14, both attend a local secondary school. E. operates both a clothing retail business and a taxi service in his town with the help of his wife. His wife is responsible for the clothing business and E. is responsible for the taxi service. They began their clothing business in 1998 and because of years of successful operation, they were able to purchase a car and begin their taxi service in 2008. He wants to purchase a shipping container in which to expand his clothing business in the future. He says, “All I want is to grow my businesses and maintain them successfully.” E. is requesting a 3,200,000 tugrug  (~1620 USD) loan in order to purchase clothing and machine repair parts for both of his businesses.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: To purchase clothing and machine repair parts for both of his businesses

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria I. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Maria Victoria is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maria Victoria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Maria Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Victoria is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maria Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S., 50, is married and lives with her three children and husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. S. is pictured with her husband in the photo.

S. has been involved in a business selling vegetables and fish since 1985 and is able to earn a gross income of US$18 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver everywhere in the province, earning an income of US$8 per day. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is a worker at a local garment factory, earning an income of US$4 per day.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living. As a result, S. is requesting a loan of US$1,200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a new motorbike for one of her children to use to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Siembra Y Cosecha Group

texts.es: A 5 kilometros del municipio de Tecpan, Viven las tres señoras, de derecha a izquierda, Lucia C., Trinidad A., Cristina M., Hacen una Platica entre ellas para obtener una nueva opción de trabajo  y solicitar un crédito mancomunado,  las señoras  tienen un promedio de edad de 52  años, se dedican en orden de nombre tienda de consumo diario, Venta de verduras  y retazos de tela, Elaboración de güipiles y servilletas, grandes y pequeñas,  aunque sus actividades son diferentes, su objetivo son similares, porque están apoyando a su esposo a lograr el objetivo familiar, con alimentación equilibrada, aumentar capital e ingreso para construcción de una casa, estudios para sus hijos, aprovechando que pueden trabajar todavía, hasta que puedan lograr su metas,
texts.en:
Just 5 kilometers from the municipality of Tecpan live 3 married women, from right to left, Lucia C., Trinidad A., and Cristina M.. They had a discussion among themselves and decided on a new work option, to solicit a communal loan. The women average 52 in age and are dedicated to running a daily consumer goods store. They sell vegetables and measures of cloth, and they make decorative native blouses and napkins, large and small. Although their activities differ, their objectives are similar, because they are helping their husbands to reach familiar objectives: sufficient food, an increase in capital and income for the construction of a house, and schooling for their children. They want to take advantage of the fact that they can still work, until they can reach their objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING VEGETABLES TO SELL AND THREAD FOR SEWING BLOUSES

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Chhum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank has seventeen people who all live in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Lay C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members; they will use the loan for different purposes. She owns wedding hall to hire out when someone is celebrating a wedding. Her husband, Mr. C. Ket, is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectare of land to grow rice on to support his family. However hard this family tries to work, they can earn little income because their wedding hall is too old to use.

Thus, in order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Lay C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more cL. to decorate the wedding hall. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to decorate the wedding hall

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is an aged woman. She is 58 years old and married with seven children. Carol is not only a wife and mother, she is also a grandmother, and this makes her happy and proud of her grandchildren. She sells colorful sarongs to make a living in Benin City. She loves her work because of the interaction she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her experience to attract and retain more customers to her business, which she hopes to continue to expand. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a shamba of mairunji to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Obwerere Tuhame Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
In the photo, Fulgensio B. is standing and raising his hand and the one squatting with a raised hand is his assistant in managing his group.

He has subsisted on a produce sales business for a timeframe of nine years. At the age of 39 years, B. Fulgensio is a fledgling produce sales business trendsetter whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other youth in his home area of Obwerere, Ibanda district. Many youth in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking alcohol.

With his hard work, Fulgensio has managed to take firm root and, in a week, he apparently makes 80,000 Ugandan shillings. With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business. This has, however, not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as the unpredictable weather patterns which, for the most part, mean he has fewer supplies from farmers.

Fulgensio’s dream is to build his own produce stalls and a store to keep his surplus goods. With this loan he hopes to implement this.

loans.use: To expand business by restocking with more foodstuffs

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza A. is currently in the business of selling various foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and cassava flour.  Tereza is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a captain in the police force. She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a super market.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and cassava flour

loans.name: Tumurchudur

texts.en:
Tumurchudur B., aged 26, lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, located in a small yard that they rent. 
Tumurchudur operates a wooden furniture manufacturing business in his own small workshop. He runs the business with his wife's help. He started his business with capital of 100,000 MNT after participating in a wooden products manufacturing training course in 2002. Since that time, Tumurchudur has been operating his business successfully and today has increased his capital to a level exceeding 2,900,000 MNT. His business earnings have enabled him to expand his business and purchase new equipment to manufacture his products. 
Tumurchudur is a very hardworking person and prides himself on creating a variety of products that his customers will like. He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase timber and to transport his products to other provinces to sell.

loans.use: To purchase timber and a GAZ truck to transport his products

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita V. is from the village of Brgy. Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Emerita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emerita raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Emerita has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from it.

In 2007, Emerita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Emerita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Topista

texts.en:
Topista is a single mother of five children all of school-going age. At 37 years of age, Topista is the head of her family and is responsible for the welfare and education of her children. She currently lives in a rented house in Bundibugyo, Uganda and she sells cocoa, beans, and rice as her business activity for income generation. 

Topista has been in this business for six years having been a pure farmer before. She says she hopes to open up a retail shop in the future to increase her sources of income and to keep the needs of her family like education and construction of her own family home in sight. Topista intends to use the loan funds to purchase cocoa for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing cocoa for resale at her stall

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a 27-year-old married man with a three-year-old child. He has been rearing chickens for five years and mainly rears layers for eggs which he sells in the local community.

Jason has been an active member of Faulu Kenya under a group and he saves money with the group on a weekly basis. He previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES to boost his business. He has requested another loan of 40,000 KES to buy chicken feeds. He hopes to supply eggs wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds

loans.name: Mujeres Inteligentes Group

texts.es:
Este comité sigue desarrollandose dentro del sexto ciclo del programa de comite de mujeres emprendedoras y todas se encuentran muy contentas de estar trabajando muy unidas realizando cada una sus actividades que les ayuda con los gasto especialmente para la alimentación de su familia además de mejorar los ingresos. 
La señora María Dominguez es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de comestibles, tiene su negocio con buena ubicación y bastante demanda, debido a la calidad de sus preparados, su forma de trabajo es la de levantarse muy temprano diariamente para trabajar por sus comestibles con la ayuda de su marido.
Y al amanecer ella se traslada hasta los lugares donde vende sus productos como en las paradas de buses, mercado y otros.
Ella desea incrementar sus ingresos para tener su local propio con más variedad de comidas, así como postres y bebidas.
Invirtirá el dinero en la compra de insumos como carnes, verduras, aceites, arina, arróz, condimentos, etc..
texts.en:
This group continues to demonstrate itself through the sixth cycle of the committee for entrepreneurial women, and all of the members are very happy to be working together to do the things they do to be able to feed their families and increase their incomes. Ms. María Dominguez is one of the members. She sells food and has a business in a good location and there is plenty of demand because of the quality of her items. Each day she arises early every morning to work on her food, with her husband’s help. At dawn she travels to the places where she sells her products; places such as bus stops, markets, and others. She would like to increase her earnings so that she can have her own location with a greater variety of food, such as drinks and desserts. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies, such as meats, vegetables, cooking oils, flour, rice, condiments, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Narelie

texts.en:
Narelie A. is from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. She is 19 years-old and married with a baby.  To make a living, Narelie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling milk and fish in the local community. Narelie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Narelie joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narelie is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 51 years old. Nicanora is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Nicanora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nicanora has been engaged in her business for over 13 years.

Nicanora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicanora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nicanora is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nicanora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizer

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor S. is a 30-year-old widow who lives with her two grandchildren in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. 

Dolgor operates a retail cosmetic business in a rented outdoor stall at a local market. She began her business in 2007 and has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. Twice a month, Dolgor purchases a variety of beauty products from Mongolia s capital city, Ulaanbaatar, restocking her business depending on her sales. Her children send her some Japanese cosmetic products from Japan where they currently live and work. 

Dolgor is a polite and responsible person. She says, "My children are abroad, and I work for my grandchildren to provide them a good education." She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more beauty products at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 44 años, convive con José, de 46 años, con quien tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos Diego de 18 y Ridick de 17 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Patay. Todas las mañanas desde hace 15 años, se despierta para atender su pequeña tienda de verduras, alimentos, frutas y panes. Nelly es muy conocida y respetada en su barrio, porqué todos los sábados y domingos se dirige a la ciudad a comprar los productos que venderá en su tienda; ella es la única que abastece el lugar con productos alimenticios, debido a la lejanía del lugar.  Con el pasar de los años, Nelly equipó su tienda con carnes, azúcar, arroz y ahora quiere adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer las necesidades de los habitantes de la ciudad y con ello obtener mayor capital para poder invertir en mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le ofreció su banco comunal en el progreso de su tienda. Con el crédito que solicita, completará el capital faltante para comprar un carro y así poder trasportarse constantemente.
texts.en: Nelly is 44 years old and she lives with her partner, José who is 46 years old. They have 4 children, but only two live with them, Diego, 18, and Ridick, 17. They own a house in the town of Patay. For 15 years she has been waking up early every morning to run her small shop where she sells vegetables, fruit, bread and food in general. Nelly is very well known and respected in her neighborhood, as every Saturday and Sunday she goes to town to buy the products she will then sell in her shop: she is the only one supplying the area which is very far away from the town. As the years went by Nelly supplied her shop with meat, sugar, rice, and she now wants to buy more products to be able to satisfy the townspeople’s necessities and thus increase her working capital to then invest it in the infrastructure of her shop. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she thankful to her communal bank who has supported her and the progress of her shop. The loan she is requesting will complete the amount she needs to buy a car to then be able to travel constantly.

loans.use: To reach the amount she needs to buy a car to be used for her activity.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
San Vicente se denomina este comité integrada por señoras que trabajan de manera organizada ya dentro del segundo ciclo del Programas Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Todas se encuentran muy contentas de formar parte del comité, y aseguran que seguirán trabajando para fomentar el grupo.
Una de las integrantes es  la Sra. Liz S. tiene quien tiene  30 años, con  3  hijos, su actividad principal es su copetín que tiene en el puerto Fenix, prepara almuerzo a las personas que trabajan en el puerto.
Ella es una señora muy  dedicada a su trabajo por no hacerle faltar nada a sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que esta con ella en el copetín.
Solicita el préstamo para renovar las herramientas de trabajo que ella utiliza para la elaboración de los comestibles, como sartenes, ollas, y cubiertos.
texts.en:
San Vicente is a co-op, and they are in their second cycle with the Women Entrepreneurs Committee. All the members are happy to be a part of the group and they pledge to continue working to keep the group strong.

One of the members Mrs. Liz S. is 30 years old with three children. Her primary business is a food stand that she runs in the Fenix port. She makes lunches for the people who work at the port. 

She is dedicated to her work and determined that her children will not want for anything. She works alongside her husband at the food stand. She will use her portion of the loan money to purchase the tools she needs to make her meals like pans, pots, and silverware.

loans.use: Purchase of cookware like pans and pressure cooks to use in the elaboration of food.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en: Afuwa N. lives in the Namungoona- Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Afuwa has a charcoal sales business. She has been in this business for less than than seven years, and she works seven days a week. Afuwa sells her charcoal from home. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. The main business challenges for Afuwa are transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to owning a delivery van. Afuwa lives in a home that she owns, but she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nora Yamilee

texts.es: Nora de 39 años, vive en la comarca san Rafael de mocorron. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ya que ella para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender productos como ropa, cosméticos, lápiz labial entre otras cosas. En la actualidad desde muy temprano se levanta ara ofrecer sus diferentes productos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler para tener más dinero para darles una mejor vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: Nora is 39 years old.  She lives in the San Rafael de Mocorron district.  She sells general goods.  As she wanted to help with her family expenses, she began selling products such as clothes, cosmetics, lipstick, etc.  She currently gets up very early to offer her different products for sale.  She would like to use the loan to buy products such as perfumes, creams and deodorants.  In the future, she would like to finish building her house and have rooms to rent so that she will have more money to provide her three children with a better future.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka G. is a single lady from Mshomoroni. She has been in the eggs selling business for the last two years and her business has been a success.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to add more inventory of eggs into her business. She hopes to get many orders which will increase her profits and enable her to grow as she reinvests back into the business.

Her dream is to live happily with her future family.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of eggs for her business

loans.name: Tsetsegsuren

texts.en:
Tsetsegsuren B. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and infant son in the Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works in the military army, while her son is taken care of by her parents. 

Tsetsegsuren operates a clothes trading business out of a stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2006 and has built a stable operation since then. She has plans to expand her business in the near future. Her goal is to one day have her own clothes retail shop. 

She is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan to buy more pants from Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more pants at wholesale price

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado mejorar cada día. Ella es una persona muy confiable pues siempre está pendiente de realizar el pago efectivo de sus cuotas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes ya que se acerca una buen temporada navideña y quiere aprovechar estas ventas.
texts.en: Maria Elena sells used clothing. This is not the first time she has worked in this business since with much effort and hard work she has improved it on a daily basis. She is a dependable person since she is always attentive to make her payments on time. She is requesting this loan to buy essential materials such as pants, blouses, skirts, and suits since the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to make the most of her sales.

loans.use: To buy essential materials such as pants, blouses, skirts, and suits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand mobile phone business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is 53 years old, married and has two adult children. She is from the village of Lower Lamac outside of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Gloria operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She is also newly into the RTW (ready to wear clothing) business. She sells her RTW to the local community and earns a 20% margin on every item sold.

In 2010, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that will be used to purchase more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arastun

texts.en:
Arastun K. lives in the Imishli district. He is a 30-year-old married man who has one son and one daughter, ages 5 and 2. Arastun has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business for over 4 years. In the past he was the main helper of his father, who is a farmer. Arastun was married in 2004 and decided to start his own business at that time.  

He requested a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN to purchase three more cows to raise and sell. This is his first loan through AqroInvest and Kiva. Arastun is very thankful because the income from this loan allowed him to increase the monthly income of his family up to 300 AZN. He plans to purchase at least ten more dairy cows in the next three years.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: William Israel

texts.es:
Don William Gonzales, vive en San Miguel junto a sus dos hijos de dos y siete años de edad y su esposa, el tiene 31 años de edad, el es empleado trabajando como vendedor de una comercial de repuestos automotrices hace 7 años, realiza su trabajo durante toda la  semana de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m.
El está solicitando un préstamo pues su vehículo familiar presenta problemas mecánicos y necesita llevarlo a hacerle ajustes a un taller. Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situación  ya que él no tiene los fondos suficientes para cubrir el gasto.
La aspiración de Don William es continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a su familia y poder preparar  académicamente a sus hijos.
texts.en: Don William Gonzales lives in San Miguel with his two children, ages two and seven, and his wife.  He is 31 years old and has been working for an automobile parts company as a salesman for 7 years.  He works everyday from 7:00 am until 5:00 pm.  His family vehicle has been having mechanical problems so he is requesting a loan so that he can take it to a shop for adjustments.  This loan will help him to resolve this problem as he doesn't have sufficient funds to cover the expense.  Don William's goal is to continue working to provide for his family and to prepare his children academically.

loans.use: Repair and maintain his family vehicle

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. is the owner of a provisions store in Abee near the coastal town of Elmina. Among the goods she sells are drinks, washing powder and some foodstuffs. For the past eight years her business has been growing slowly but steadily. 

Due to the loan Georgina is hoping for a boost. She would like to offer her customers a wider range of goods and increase her profit as a result. She is not married and takes care of her child all by herself. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit to be able to take better care of her child.

loans.use: to be able to offer her customers a wider range of goods.

loans.name: Gaudilia

texts.en:
Gaudilia R. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 43 years old. Gaudilia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Gaudilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gaudilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gaudilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gaudilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen V. habita en casa propia con sus tres hijos y un primo, quienes por el momento se encuentran estudiando. Doña María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, se las ingenia para salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su casa. Se dedica  a la venta de tamales de diferentes tipos como: tamales de chipilín, tamales pisques  y tamales de elote. En el Municipio de Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad sus ricos tamales son muy demandados por sus vecinos, ya que ofrece calidad, buen precio y sobre todo buen servicio. Ella tiene muchos sueños y uno  de ellos es mejorar su negocio, para esto solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en los materiales necesarios para la venta de tamalitos. Tales como: maíz, frijoles, pollo, condimentos, agua, hojas, y demás materiales que son indispensables para su elaboración. De esta forma espera lograr una mayor aceptación de sus sabrosos tamales y lograr incrementar las ventas las cuales traerían mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen V. lives in her own house with her three children and a cousin, who are currently in school. Maria is a very hard-working and proactive woman, and she's always thinking of new ways to support her family and come out ahead. She works selling different types of tamales, offering tamales filled with chipilín (a leafy vegetable native to Mexico) or sweet corn, as well as "pisques" tamales (which have a small amount of ash added in to the ground corn for color).In the Antiguo Cuscatlan Municipality in the La Libertad department, her delicious tamales are in high demand amongst her neighbors because Maria offers quality, a good price, and above all else, good service. 

Maria has many dreams, and one of these dreams is to improve her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loam from INTEGRAL to invest in the materials necessary to sell her tamales, such as corn, beans, chicken, condiments, water, leaves, and other ingredients that are indispensable to the creation of each dish. In this way, she hopes to gain even greater success with her flavorful tamales, and be able to increase sales, bringing more income into her family.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials to make tamales, such as corn, beans, chicken, condiments, water, and leaves for wrapping.

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nil

texts.en: Nil S., 36, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. and his wife sell food, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 11 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for the family use. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos Arturo M. D. L. H. tiene 55 años y vive en el barrio Las Palmas D. L. ciudad D. BarranquilL., con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades D. 18 a 35 años; allí se dedica a L. preparación D. almuerzos especialmente comidas corrientes.  Carlos Inició su  negocio D. comidas hace 25 años al lado D. su madre y elL. finalmente se lo cedió hace 5 años, debido a que por su edad debió retirarse;  desD. ese mismo momento empezó su cónyuge, él y su hija a fabricar almuerzos, comidas y en un futuro abrirá L. línea D. desayunos.  Su credikiva  es el primer financiamiento que recibe D. L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará  una carpa para protegerse del sol y D. L. lluvia, adecuará su local  y comprará 4 juegos D. sillas y 9 mesas con las cuales repondrá las D. madera que están en deterioro.  D. esta manera  brindará una mejor atención a sus clientes, quienes se sentirán confortables en su establecimiento cuando vayan  a alimentarse y el conservará o aumentará L. rentabilidad sobre las ventas que es no menor del 549%. Su sueño ahora es seguirse posicionando hasta lograr mucho prestigio en L. comunidad y su máximo desafío es  comprar L. carpa D. inmediato antes D. que llegue con fuerza L. oL. invernal a L. región.
texts.en: Carlos Arturo M. D. L. H. is 55 years old and lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the city of BarranquilL. with his wife and their 5 children aged 18 to 35.  Here he has a business making lunches, especially fast food.  Carlos started his food business 25 years ago along with his mother.  She finally left him the business 5 years ago, because due to her age she had to retire.  From this moment on he began working with his wife and daughter making lunches, meals, and in the future they will open a breakfast business.  This Kiva loan is the first loan that he has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it he will buy a tarp to protect him from the sun and the rain, he will upgraD. his place of business, and he will buy 4 sets of chairs and 9 tables which will replace the wooden ones that he has that are deteriorated.  In this way he will proviD. better service to his customers, who want to feel comfortable in his establishment when they come there to eat, and he will retain or increase the profitability of his sales, which is not less than 549%.  His dream now is to continue to position himself to achieve great prestige in the community, and his main desire is to buy a tarp right before the rainy season begins in the region.

loans.use: to buy a tarp to protect him from the sun and the rain, to make improvements to his place of business, and to buy 4 sets of chairs and 9 tables to replace ones that he has that are deteriorated

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La cliente es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado que acopia del río Paraguay, posee embarcación propia en la cual realiza su trabajo de acopio, sus productos lo comercializa en la ciudad de Pilar y también vende a compradores de otras ciudades.
La Sra. Carmen está acompañada, tiene dos hijas ya todas adultas y su compañero trabaja conjuntamente con ella en la pesca.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias  comerciales,  buen movimiento en su negocio, una micro empresa muy reconocida en la ciudad de Pilar. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de elementos para la pesca y destinar luego lo obtenido a la comercialización. Se compromete a cumplir en tiempo y forma con la responsabilidad asumida con la empresa.
texts.en:
The member is a salesperson; she buys and sells fish that she collects from the Paraguay River. She has her own craft where she does her fishing; her products are then sold in the city of Pilar and other buyers in different cities.

Mrs. Carmen has a partner, and has two adult daughters. Her significant other works with her in the fishing industry.

Mrs. Carmen is a very hardworking woman with good business references as she has a good return rate on her business, it is also a well-known microenterprise in the city of Pilar. She needs the loan to buy fishing equipment and use what she collects to sell. Mrs. Carmen is committed to meet her payments on time as well as being responsible with the loan organization.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment and tools for fishing like a fishing rod, bait, etc.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and two of her children are in school. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

 Florentina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Bilquis' Group

texts.en:
Bilquis is married. She is involved in a sewing business. She does this work to support her family financially. 

She learnt this art from her mother and it has served her well since her marriage. She can sew designer & non-designer dresses very easily. Her clients are very much satisifed with her work. In her working years, she has never received any complaint from her clients about her sewing. For this reason, she collects a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her to fulfill the timely orders of her clients because her current machine doesn't produce quality work and takes much time to sew a single dress.   

She is confident that an investment in her business will help her grow her business further and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 53 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carmencita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Carmencita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Carmencita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosie has a retail shop that sells snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Sandra  D. 23 años es una joven muy creativa dedicada a L. lencería y L. fabricación D. manualidades en general, posee un taller donD. se fabrican carteras bolsos  para damas, se decoran peinetas, pulseras  entre otras bellezas que elabora con sus propias manos;  actividad que inició cuando al terminar su carrera profesional como diseñadora, no logró encontrar en una empresa L. forma D. desarrollar su potencial y decidida emprendió su aventura D. negocios, aplicando las técnicas del diseño que aprendió en L. universidad, por eso sus productos son D. una excelente calidad y son muy aceptados y reconocidos entre sus clientes, porque a todo lo que hace le agrega el valor D. su saber y creatividad. Su meta es lograr posicionar una marca propia y tener un punto comercial especializado D. sus productos. Su credikiva es el primer crédito que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materiales e insumos a un mayor volumen, para obtener descuentos y sobre todo para tener materiales con los que diversifique, al aplicar las diferentes técnicas que conoce perfectamente. Mientras Sandra trabaja para lograr sus sueños, en su negocio maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor D. un 25%, una rotación D. inventarios D. 8 días y D. sus cuentas por cobrar 8 días también.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 23, is an extremely creative and dedicated young woman who sells lingerie and produces handcrafted items. She has a workshop where she makes wallets and handbags for women. Sandra decorates her creations by hand with ornamental hair pins, bracelet beads, and other beautiful items. She started this business after she finished her professional degree as a designer.
