However, she was not able to find a company where she could develop her potential, so she decided to pursue the path of starting a business. She applies the design techniques she learned in college and, as a result, she produces creations that are of excellent quality and have been well-received and recognized among her customers. Her knowledge and creativity add value to everything she produces. Sandra's goals are to obtain her own brand and to have a specialized retail shop for her products.

Her Kiva loan is her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Sandra will use the funds to buy materials and supplies in large volumes so that she can obtain discounts and have all the equipment that she needs to diversify and apply the various techniques that she knows perfectly. While Sandra works to achieve her dreams, her business manages to generate a sales profitability rate of no less than 25%. Her product rotation period is 8 days and her accounts receivable period is also 8 days.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies in large quantities.

loans.name: Kobenkoun V Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres qui composent le groupe KOBENKOUN V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Kafla, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SITAN, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of KOBENKOUN V are married women. They are on average 48 years old and have an average of 6 children each. They live in polygamous families in Kafla, one of the villages in the rural commune of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they grow are, among others, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With the loan, Sitan, 2nd from the right, standing, plans to buy inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing costs in order to maintain about 0.5 hectare of rice and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops are sold at at the local market in the village and at the Banco and N'Golobougou markets to customers who are both men and women.

Sitan expects to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller and small equipment.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and married with three children. Rosalie has been raising pigs in the Philippines for ten years. She also earns additional income by raising other livestock.

Rosalie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys, who has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years, is a 54-year-old widow.  Introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, she is now requesting her second loan, her previous one for Kshs 20,000 repaid in good time. Gladys plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer, and in the future hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mabongisi Y Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Vuvu is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus” which is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Vuvu is 41 and married, and has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2004. She operates a general store to the west of Kinshasa. She has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns about $80 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having three times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Vuvu has seven children between the ages of 6 and 22 years old. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying some sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mocuba, Provincia  da Zambezia, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo ( Boane) cumprindo com o serviço militar, é funcionário do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 25 anos e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BARCLAYS).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, chapas, areia, cimento, pedra, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.500.00mt,8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt,12.000.00mt,e 14.000.00mt, aplicados para a obra e bens da sua casa.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para concluir a sua casa e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Celestino was born in the district of Mocuba, in the province of Zambezia in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two school-age children. He went to school through the third grade but dropped out in order to complete his compulsory military service. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.
He left Zambezia for Maputo (Boane) to fulfill his military service. He's been an official at the Ministry of Defense for more than 25 years and earns a salary of 4,000 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account.He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (rebar, sheet metal, sand, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 5,500, 8,500, 10,000, and 14,000 meticals, were all also used for his home. He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and start his own business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (rebar, sheet metal, sand, cement, stone, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has a rope making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business. She has been in this business for eight years.  

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata. She is married, and has 4 children aged 17, 14, 8 and 5 years. In 2008, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business by selling door-to-door and now has a stall, choosing dresses for customers. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve the stock, buying trimmings, linens, ribbons and zippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to own a shop with a door rather than a stall. She thinks the loan will help to improve her family's lives. The previous loans also helped her to add on to her stock and to make more profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for clothing materials.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La socia tiene entre todas sus actividades la venta de quinua en granos, en otras ocasiones y a pedido venta de ollas, venta de frazadas y normalmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogos todo el año, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desea poder ahorrar dinero para invertir en la educación de su hijo y poder darle mejor calidad de vida, ella en esta ocasión desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos de quinua al por mayor por kintales, en la compra de frazadas para la venta al por menor y en la compra de ollas para la venta en el mes de diciembre.
texts.en: The member includes among her business activities the sale of quinoa grains, at other times and to order the sale of pots and blankets. She usually sells beauty products by catalogue throughout the year. The member is a hardworking woman and wants to save money to invest in her child's education and be able to give the child a better quality of life. This time she wants the loan to invest in buying quinoa grain in bulk by the quintal (1 quintal equals 100lb), blankets for retail sale and pots to sell in December.

loans.use: to buy quinoa in bulk, blankets for retail sale and pots to sell in December.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and is married with 9 children aged between 2 and 17 years old. She owns a mill for milling different products such as: cassava, sorghum, peanut etc. She has been in this business for 3 years and the hours of her work are from 8 am until 6 pm every day.

Grace has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying new materials for her mill to get favorable profits. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her mill.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Fred has been working hard to manage his small shop, which buys old metal materials to recycle and sell. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metal scrap for resale, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Fred, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more metal scrap for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 32 años convive junto a Edwin de 33 años; viven en su casa propia junto a sus 03 adorados hijos  quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. La tienda de Epifania es el más concurrido por sus vecinos de barrio en la ciudad de Quimbiri, todos los días sus clientes van desde muy temprano a la tienda de Epifania para comprar los productos que necesitan. Ella es una excelente vendedora ya que lo hace con mucha amabilidad, para que sus clientes puedan regresar ya que encuentran todo lo necesario que les haga falta. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es dar buen trato a sus clientes, lleva 01 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es no tener algunos productos ya que se terminan rápidamente. En adelante, espera incrementar productos para su negocio como: bebidas, variedades de golosinas, arroz, azúcar, conservas, entre otros. Este será su préstamo numero 07 con MFP, por tanto espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá comprando productos para su negocio como: bebidas, variedades de golosinas, arroz, azúcar, conservas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Epifania who is 32 years old lives with Edwin who is 33 years old. They live in their own house together with their 3 beloved children who are the reason for their efforts. 

Epifania’s store is the most popular neighborhood store in the city of Qiimbiri. Every day her customers go there early to buy the things they need. She is an outstanding sales person and attends to her work with much friendliness in order for her customers to return where they will find all they need that they don’t have. 

The thing that she likes most about her work is dealing with her customers. She has been in this business one year and what she considers the most difficult is not having some products that have sold out rapidly.

In the future she hopes to expand the inventory for her store, such as soft drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, canned goods, and other items.

This will be her 7th loan with MFP, and she is hoping for approval in order to continue with her plans.

With the 1000 soles she will buy products for her business such as drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, canned goods and other items.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, varieties of cookies, rice, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Elivilia

texts.en:
Elivilia is 26 year-old married woman with two children, one of them in school. She has had a food stall in Yambio, south Sudan for two years.
Elivilia is requesting this loan through BRAC, south Sudan, to purchase beans, rice and sugar for her stall. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar and rice for sale.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: Paula Argentina es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ella explica que gracias a la oportunidad que le han brindaron con el financiamiento ha cambiado su vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de carne lo cual ya tiene definido a sus clientes fijos y eventuales a los que les ofrece sus producto. Paula Argentina está nuevamente solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio y comprar carne de res, cerdo, pollo, pelibuey entre otras que le demanda.
texts.en: Paula Argentina is an entrepreneur who has worked before with Fundación León 2000. She explains that the opportunity they offered her with the loan changed her life. She sells meat and has regular  and new customers to whom she offers her product. Paula Argentina is asking for a loan again to invest in her business by buying beef, pork, chicken and mutton, among other meats her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, chicken, mutton and other meats that people have asked her for.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como periodista, el escribe revistas y luego lo vende en forma independiente, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño del socio es terminar de editar su revistas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para imprimir sus revistas y también para comprar papeles al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "San Valentin" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department.

He is 62, married, and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his work as a journalist. He writes magazines and sells them independently.  He works from 7:00am to 6:00pm. His dream is to finish editing his magazines. The borrower is applying for the loan in order to print his magazines, and also to buy paper at wholesale.

He is happy about the loan, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to print his magazines, and also to buy paper at wholesale.

loans.name: San Jose De Jutiapa Group

texts.es: ASDDFD

loans.use: COMPRA DE ABARROTERIA EN GENERAL

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 28 years old. She is married with three children. 

This is a new loan type for UOB. The loan will help to pay for a warehouse to store her maize produce prior to being  bought by buyers. 

The finished site will be available to the community members to store their produce in the building. UOB’s farmers will benefit during the post-harvest processes while they wait for the buyer to pay them. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to construct a warehouse.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy is a 40-year-old married mother of two. She is a very active woman and has been an entrepreneur since she was very young. In fact, Elsy sold clothes through college so she could afford to go to school. When she got married, her father-in-law sold goods in the towns, and he taught her a lot about sales. With over twenty years of experience in this business, Ms. T. has found her niche. Her husband helps her operate the business when he can, but he has his own job in a factory. On his days off, he is responsible for purchasing the clothing material and negotiating the prices with the suppliers. Both Elsy and her husband know the business very well, and they are constantly trying to think of ways to improve it. Their strength has allowed them to grow since first starting. Elsy wants to apply for credit so that she can offer other varieties of products, taking advantage of the frequent celebrations that the town throws. She envisions colorful garments for the party-goers as well as continuing the line of clothes she currently sells.


Mifex offers our clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy yards of cotton and silk material

loans.name: Yalchin

texts.en: Yalchin is the resident of Beylagan town. He is the client of Normicro Beylagan branch since 2001. He is engaged in food stuff sales. First he borrowed $400 then $600 and then $800. He used the loans to increase the working capital. Now he wants to buy a counter refregerator.

loans.use: To buy a counter refregerator

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini makes brooms to sell. In Samoa most people use brooms made from dried coconut leaves. Kuini gathers and buys these dried coconut leaves and works hard to make brooms from them. She makes brooms that people use inside their homes as well as brooms that people use to rake up leaves in their yards. She sells her product at the local market.  She works very hard but is rewarded at the end of every week when she balances the books for her business. She often finds that she has cleared ST 400 (USD 160) in profit. Her husband has a job as a salesperson in town and his wages bring in ST 180 (USD 70) weekly.  With the two incomes, Kuini and her husband can support their family. Kuini is justifiably proud of the entrepreneurial spirit that allows her to bring home an income substantially higher than her husband's.

loans.use: Buy material for making brooms

loans.name: Hakim

texts.en: A. Hakim, 29 years old, has a specialized secondary education. His specialization is car repair. He is married and has two children. He has a stall in the Dushanbe market, “Safariyon”, where he sells household goods. Many farmers come and sell their products in that market so they have the opportunity to buy household goods from Hakim. He has been in this business for 2 years. With a loan of $1000 he is going to buy household goods and increase his range of goods. Hakim is going pay off the loan amount in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy household goods

loans.name: Lesbia Marina

texts.es:
I sell clothing to people of very low economic resources. I have been working in this business for several years. Some people cannot buy new clothes because they do not earn much. My sales are strong on the weekends since people come from nearby communities to the city of San Lorenzo. I now need to buy several bundles of used clothing because my inventory is small and I want to increase my sales and provide better service. Thank you for your help with my business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

I of clothes on sale used to people of vajos economicos resources am east business already several years old, dico that cannot go to one must to buy new clothes since their income are very low. My sales are very strong the week ends since many people come from other near communities to buy to the ciuda of San Lorenzo. Now nesecito to buy several fardos of clothes since I have remained with less clothes and I want to aunmentar my sales and to give a good service. Thanks to its aid my gracido business to.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Rosa Regina

texts.es:
Rosita, as her friends and customers affectionately call her, is the mother of a four-year-old girl, the light of her life. Rosita has overcome deception and heartbreak and endeavors to give young Milagros a good home. She has opened a small grocery store in her parents' home where she lives. She tends the shop with good cheer and the business is growing. She is asking for a loan of $200 to stock up on more varied merchandise and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Please help this hard-working young mother fulfill her dreams and those of her daughter.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosita como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, es madre de una niña de 4 años; tras haber sufrido innumerables decepciones y sufrimientos en la vida, aún tiene una razón por la que debe seguir luchando, su hija menor Milagros, quien es la luz de sus sueños y la alegría de su hogar. Actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, donde decidió habilitar un ambiente para abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a la amabilidad y paciencia con la que trata a su clientela ha podido crecer con su negocio y obtener asiduos comensales, el deseo que tiene doña Rosita es aumentar la variedad de sus productos y así cumplir con la demanda de sus exigentes clientes. Para conseguir sus objetivos solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que le permitirá aumentar el stock y variedad de sus productos y promete retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Hagamos posible que esta joven y cariñosa madre mantenga a buen recaudo los anhelos de su pequeña niña con su desempeño diario.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan is 28 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old son. She keeps chickens at her house. She raises and sells them at the market. She also sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks in the morning. She usually earns $10 per day. Her husband sells vegetables at the market and usually earns $2 per day. She requests a loan of $100 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Sonia Hortencia

texts.es:
Sonia realized early on that starting a retail business would give her a good opportunity to increase her revenues since she saw that others in her community made a good living this way. Eight years ago she began selling clothes at retail. With a lot of hard work she began saving enough money to restock her merchandise. She is well known in her neighborhood for the quality of her apparel and the clients keep coming back.

However she is struggling to support her two young children, and she needs a loan of $475 to purchase stock since the money she had set aside for her business has been used for her family. Sonia is ready to return the loan in 6 months and with your help she will be able to pull through with both her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Stock purchase

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 54 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Kim Động, Hưng Yên province. Her main activity is poultry farming. She has been in this activity for 5 years. It is hard work but brings stable monthly income of 220USD. Her flock is more than 100 now. She is applying a L. of 1200USD to expand her business, buy feed and young stock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 54 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và ba con tại Kim Động, Hưng Yên. Công việc chủ yếu hiện nay của chị là chăn nuôi gà, vịt, ngan. Chị L. làm nghề này được 5 năm nay. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng mang lại thu nhập khá ổn định. Số lượng gia cầm của chị L. đã lên đến hơn 100 con. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của chị là 220USD. Chị đang xin vay 1200USD từ Quỹ để mua thức ăn gia cầm và con giống.

loans.use: Buy ducks and food for them

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es:
Mariana is 54 and lives with her son in Villa Flor de Managua. For the last five years she has been working for AHIMSA, an organization that provides free food, education and medicines to children from low income families in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

Mariana is the coordinator of AHIMSA's Family Social Program, and her social work with this program has contributed to the continued development of her community. What she earns for her work with this organization has been very beneficial, as it allows her to pay for her son's studies. He is currently studying to be able to obtain employment that will further his development. Mariana's husband currently works for Enacal [Nicaragua's state water and sewage utility]. Mariana and her husband have been working to improve their family's quality of life, and right now their most pressing need is to be able to finish construction on their house's porch. They have been unable to complete the project because they don't have the resources to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mariana tiene 54 años de edad, habita con su hijo en el barrio Villa Flor de Managua, hace 5 años trabaja en una Asociación llamada AHIMSA que opera en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en donde apadrinan a niños con padres de escasos recursos económicos, brindándoles alimentación, educación y medicina gratuita.

Ella coordina el Programa Social Familiar que realiza esta asociación, en donde su labor social ha contribuido al desarrollo integral de su comunidad. La ayuda que recibe la señora de parte del organismo por su trabajo, le ha sido de mucho beneficio, ya que con lo que percibe paga los estudios universitarios de su hijo, quien se esta preparando para llegar a obtener un puesto laboral en el cual se pueda desarrollar, el esposo de doña Mariana trabaja en Enacal. Estos padres han ido mejorando su condición de vida, la necesidad mayor de esta familia es la de terminar de construir el porche de su casa, ya que la construcción se encuentra detenida por falta de capital.

loans.use: Purchase of purlins, cement, sand, iron and zinc sheeting

loans.name: Vilma Lucia

texts.es:
VILMA R. is 48, lives in Villa Reconciliación and is married. Her husband works in a farming co-op, and is the co-op's President in Matiguas, in the Matagalpa department of Nicaragua, an area with high agricultural production. They couple has a 19-year-old son. In order to contribute to her family's income, almost two years ago Vilma began selling perfume and cosmetics, starting the business with her husband's help. She is now seeking a loan to buy clothing and perfume in bulk for her business. The income resulting from her business has brought greater stability to their home, helping them to offset the high cost of food.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

VILMA R., de 48 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación , es casada y su esposo trabaja en una cooperativa Agrícola de la cual es Presidente en Matiguas, departamento de Matagalpa, que es una zona muy productiva. Tienen un hijo de 19 años de edad. Con la determinación de aportar en los ingresos del hogar desde hace casi 2 años trabaja en comercio vendiendo cosméticos y perfumes, negocio que inicio con apoyo de su esposo. Solicita un crédito para comprar ropa y perfumes por docena en el mercado y ofrecer a sus clientes, este ingreso ha sido importante en la estabilidad de su hogar, ya que contrarresta el alto precio de la comida.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of clothing and perfume

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
María Nelly sees herself as a calm, hard-working, and responsible person. She began her business due to the need for an income aside from her husband’s to cover the household expenses. They have three children who grow each day, as well as their economical needs.

She began some time ago selling different products and even had a home-made food shop which she had to close because of the increase in the shop’s rent, and because the owners were asking for the shop. So, one of her aunts convinced her to sell clothes and offered taking her to places were she could buy clothes at good prices such as Moroleon, Monterrey, and the Federal District. She followed her aunt’s advice and began to sell clothes in April 2006, for Child’s Day (El Dia del Nino). Her sales went very well because her neighbors and friends put in orders for their children. She now has a fair number of clients.

Maria Nelly asks for US $300 which she will pay in 6 months to purchase seasonal garments. She wants to take advantage of the dates and have a more diverse variety of garments for her clients, which will allow her to increase her sales.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

María Nelly se considera una persona muy tranquila, trabajadora y responsable. Inició el negocio porque era necesario tener un ingreso aparte del de su esposo para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa, ya que tiene tres hijos y cada vez van creciendo más y sus necesidades también se van incrementando.

Comenzó hace algún tiempo vendiendo diversos productos e inclusive tuvo un negocio de comida casera, el cual tuvo que cerrar porque le subieron la renta y le pidieron el local, pero una de sus tías la convenció para que vendiera ropa y que ella le ayudaría llevándola a lugares donde se puede comprar ropa a buenos precios en ciudades como Moroleón y Monterrey y el D.F. Siguió su consejo y comenzó en Abril de 2006 vendiendo ropa para el día del niño y le fue muy bien ya que sus vecinas y amistades le hicieron pedidos para sus hijos y en la actualidad cuenta con un buen número de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar ropa de temporada aprovechando las fechas y poder tener un mejor surtido para sus clientes, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos,” her business is buying and selling small animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens). Her business is located on Raymondi avenue in Huaraz city, Ancash state

With the S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 50 guinea pigs, 20 chickens, 20 rabbits, and other items according to her customer’s needs.

She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. The oldest is 23 years old, studying at the high school; the other three are in primary school. Her husband is a temporary worker for the council, and both contribute to the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (cuy, conejo, gallinas), su negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Raymondi de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará 50 cuyes, 20 gallinas, 20 conejos y según las necesidades de sus clientes va adquiriendo.

. La señora Emma tiene 45 años y es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 23 años, esta estudiando en superior y tres de sus hijos están en educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en el consejo en forma eventual y ambos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase animals to resell

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy S. is a 57-year-old teacher. She sells groceries at her school and she earns around $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Meng Savuth, is 28-years-old and drives a motorcycle-taxi and he earns around $2 per day. They have five children, two of whom are married. Of the remaining children, two are in school and one is a motorcycle-taxi driver. 

Mrs. S. seeks a loan in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. The loan will allow her to improve her family’s income so that she can better manage her family's expenses and children’s school fees. The picture is of Mrs. S.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosa Magda

texts.es:
Rosa started her own business to get ahead because her husband did not make enough money to cover all the family expenses. She started her shoe sale business three years ago, selling footwear by catalogue and making small shoe demonstration parties amongst her friends and neighbors. She then started selling her merchandise both door-to-door and at the local markets.

She needs a loan of $800.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase more merchandise, make more shoe demonstration parties, and set up a shoe rack at the local flea markets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio para salir adelante por necesidad dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos familiares. Comenzó su negocio de venta de zapatos hace 3 años vendiendo solo sobre pedidos y haciendo pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas, después empezó con la venta casa por casa y en mercados.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comparar mercancía y poder realizar ya demostraciones así como poner un estante en los mercados rodantes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaeshi

texts.en:
Yaeshi is 36 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her children are 1, 5, 10 and 13 years old.

Yaeshi is a dress maker. She also has a business selling charcoal and firewood. Each day, she works at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Yaeshi now hopes for a loan so she can buy more firewood and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Ndef Leng Group

texts.fr: Le non respect des règles d'hygiène entraine des maladies. Pour lutter contre l'insalubrité, Le groupement Ndef Leng de (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) a eu pour idée de lutter contre les déchets plastiques dans l’écovillage et de créer des emplois de transformation de ces déchets dans le but de bien gérer l’écotourisme. Ayant acquis une formation en tressage pour fabriquer des cordes, en tricotage et crochage pour fabriquer des sous-tasses,  et une formation en tissage pour fabriquer des paillassons, ce prêt nous permettra d’acheter du matériel (bassines, balais, ciseaux aiguilles, sachets, fils coton, savon liquide) que nous utiliserons pour les collecter, les stocker, et les traiter. Tout ceci, pour veiller à la propreté  de notre  environnement et au bien-être de la population.
texts.en:
The lack of respect for the rules of hygiene brings on illness. In the struggle against illhealth, the Ndef Leng group (http://www.sem-fund.org/mbamfr.php) conceived the idea of taking action against plastic waste in the village ecosystem and creating employment by transforming waste with the goal of better managing the impact of the ecology on tourism. We have taken courses in braiding to make rope, knitting and crocheting to make table place mats, and training in weaving to make doormats. This loan would permit us to purchase materials ( basins, brooms, sewing scissor kits, packs, cotton thread, liquid soap) which we would use to collect, store, and treat products. This would be done to take care of both the property in our environment and the well being of the population.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material to manage plastic waste

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Sesilia D. from Mbeya, married with two children between the ages of 9 and 13. Sesilia has been running a grocery and crops business since 2007. After purchasing commodities such as rice, cooking oil, and soda wholesale from regional farmers, she retails them to people in the area. Assisted by one employee and her brother, Sesilia currently earns about $200 per month working 12 hours each day, 6 days per week.

She is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase additional crops and commodities such as cooking oil, sugar, soap and salt for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to open another business. Sesilia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional crops and commodities for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kim Thi

texts.vi: Chị Kim Thị Liệu năm nay 48 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 5 năm. Hiện nay nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị là từ buôn than và công thợ xây của chồng và con. Hàng ngày chị đi lấy than về đóng và bán cho người dân địa phương còn chồng và con lớn đi làm thợ xây nên thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Với mức thu nhập 4 triệu đồng/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Liệu đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. vòngvốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15 triệu đồng để đầu tư vốn mua thêm nguyên liệu phụcv ụ cho công việc sản xuất và kinh doanh than của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. L. Thi Kim, 48 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 5 years. Currently her family's main source of income is from selling coal and her husband's and son's salary as construction workers. Everyday, she takes coal home and packs it to sell to the locals, while her husband and oldest son work, so the family's total income is very stable. With an income of 4 million VND/month, the family's life is improving day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 15 million VND to invest in buying more raw materials to use in the family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to be recycled

loans.name: Keily

texts.es: Keily tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, vive junto a su conviviente quien está de acuerdo con todos sus propósitos de mejora de su negocio. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, lo tiene desde hace un año atrás, es usada para brindar servicio de transporte público, y es manejado por su esposo, quien también se encarga de cuidarlo. Se encuentra contenta y satisfecha porque su motocarro le genera buenos ingresos y como ella misma administra las ganancias, solo utiliza para los gastos familiares necesarios, y le deja un margen de ganancias muy bueno. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar la moto, para que trabaje adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Keily is 34 years old and the mother of two children. She lives with her partner who completely agrees with all of her plans to improve her business. She is the owner of a motorbike, which she has had for a year, and she uses it to provide public transportation. Her husband drives it, and he also is in charge of maintaining it. She is satisfied and content because her motorbike brings in a good income and as she herself administers their earnings, she only uses it for the family's necessary expenses, which leaves her a very good earnings margin. This is her third loan with MFP and she has proven herself responsible in her payments. With the money requested, she wants to buy spare parts to repair the bike so that it works properly.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair her motorbike.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine O., 33, lives in the village of Achuth in the Rongo District of Kenya. Christine is married to an accountant at the Kenyatta National Hospital. They have 3 children, 2 of whom are currently attending school. 
 
Christine runs a posho mill (a machine that grinds maize into flour) in Achuth, which she started in 2001. On a daily basis, Christine raises between 300-400 KSH. There is stiff competition in the area, as there are other posho mills around. 
 
In 2003, Christine started a second small business selling household items to the local community. She buys her inventory in bulk from Nairobi, where it is less expensive. 

With her two businesses, Christine is able to support her family by paying school fees and taking care of domestic expenses. Christine is rigorous in saving money so that she may soon purchase a parcel of land on which to start a poultry project.  

She is applying for a loan of KSH 22,500 ($USD 300) in order to have enough start-up capital for her dream of a poultry business. With the loan money, Christine will purchase at least 50 broiler chicks to raise and later sell.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoebe R. Velez, 41, is married and lives on Sunset Boulevard, Dawo Dapitan City. She has 4 children and all are in school. Her husband is her working partner in all she does.

They are managing “Sunset Pension and Beach Resort," inherited from her parents. Since there are local tourists and some foreigners who’d like to visit their resort, they want to maintain and improve the buildings so she looked for enough capital and found what she wanted at Paglaum MPC. She’s been a member since January 21, 2008. She is applying for 20,000 php for the purpose of repair and maintenance of the business establishment so as to provide a more desirable, accommodating and comfortable stay for their visitors. She aspires to send her children to school to have a degree for a better future.

loans.use: repair & maintance of their building

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene 20 años y vive en casa de su mamá. Ella tiene el don del canto, su voz melodiosa ha captado la atención de personas que la propusieron  a dedicarse netamente a ello, es así que formalmente hace 4 años ella incursionó en cantar música vernácular, la cual es la música típica de su tierra; ella recibe contratos para cantar en eventos musicales de su zona y con ese talento que posee, produjo un CD con canciones que ella misma compuso, Miriam tiene grandes sueños y anhelos de ser una cantante reconocida en su medio y le pone mucho esfuerzo en lo que hace, mientras tanto seguirá trabajando para lograr este gran sueño y poder solventar su producción musical, además del canto se dedica tambíen a trabajar comercializando mercerías en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está decidida a trabajar como una integrante más en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de un nuevo vestuario, ya que la imagen tiene mucho que ver para la buena aceptación del público y hacer que sus presentaciones logren mayor éxito; su traje está valorizado en 1000 soles porque tiene aplicaciones de bordados y otros detalles finos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 20 years old and lives in her mother’s house. She has a gift for singing and her melodious voice has captured the attention of many people who encouraged her to pursue singing. Four years ago she began singing formally—she performs popular folk music, the typical music of her home. She has contracts to sing at music events in the region and because of her talent, she produced a CD with songs that she composed. Miriam dreams of being a well-known singer and she puts a lot of effort into what she does. She is working hard to achieve her goal and support her music production. In addition to singing she also sells small items at the markets in her town. This is her first loan with MFP and she has decided to become a member of her community bank. The loan money will go towards the purchase of a new dress, since the public’s acceptance has a lot to do with the image she puts forth. The dress is valued at 1,000 soles because it has embroidery and other intricate details.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new dress for performances

loans.name: Rehema V.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Rehema M. from Tukuyu. She is married with 2 children, 4 and 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents passed away of HIV AIDS.

Rehema has been running a timber business since 2006. She buys timbers from farmers and sells them in town for a profit. She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rehema currently earns about 60 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more timber in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish a new business. Rehema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more timber in bulk

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma V. owns a small sari-sari store business. She is 47 years old and has two loving children. Her husband, Alberto V. is a fisherman. They work very hard to pay for their children's educational needs. They want them to achieve the highest educational attainment, so when they get old they won't be like them and could find better jobs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 21,000 from CEVI. Emma will use the loan to buy additional merchandise in her store. Some of the loan will also be used to repair their small boat. In that way, her husband could continue catching fish for their family's needs.

CEVI is helps its clients sustain and grow their businesses. They also provided credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to support their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is 38 years old and married with two children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers.

She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella Y. is forty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are daughters. One of her children is currently in senior high school while the rest attend junior high or primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the busy fishing/commercial town of Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the Central Region of Ghana. She works very hard to provide for the family. 

Stella is a food vendor. She fries plantain chips in her house and sells them by the roadside. Stella procures plantains and vegetable oil from the local market. She has operated business for three years and wants a loan to purchase plantains in bulk. Stella hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase plantains

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Mrs. Joan M.  has been a Paglaum member in good standing at Golden Center for more than 3 years, since April 2006. Married and blessed with 2 children, her husband is a farmer. Recently, she's requesting her loan in the amount of 6,000 php for the purpose of purchasing fertilizers and chemicals for their rice field. Lastly, she is very glad to be doing her daily work for the good of her rice field because this is one of their sources of income for their daily needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Jennifer M. from Mbeya. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 4. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can’t take care of them. 

Jennifer has been running a “kuku” business since 2006. "Kuku" is Swahili for chickens. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients, for a number of reasons. One of the many reasons is that they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Another reason is that they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. 

Jennifer works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her two young sisters. She currently earns about 700USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her chickens. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Jennifer thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Sophronia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Sophronia M. from Mwanza. She is single with three children, between the ages of 14 and 22. Sophronia has been running a café business since 2007. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Sophronia currently earns about 300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase rice, cooking oil, and wheat flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sophronia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: Goya tiene 35 años, en su pareja encontró el mejor apoyo y la perfecta compañía, con quien tiene un hijo y juntos viven en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron conseguir. Desde que aprendió el oficio de costurera empezó a recibir grandes pedidos para bordados, decorados, confección de prendas, etc., lo cual le ayudó a mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Goya trabaja en su casa en un espacio donde implementó su pequeño taller de costura y los materiales que utiliza los compra al por mayor para desarrollar mayores cantidades de prendas. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, tiempo que aprovechó para relacionarse con varios empresarios clientes y espera que esa lista siga creciendo. Para un futuro cercano espera contar con mejor maquinaria para realizar trabajos adicionales que le permitan incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Los 6 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA le permitieron mejorar su negocio, al igual que los de sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde vienen trabajando con mucho compromiso, este sería su 7mo préstamo. Los 2000 soles que solicita serán para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los acabados de las prendas.
texts.en:
Goya is 35 years old. She found the best support and the perfect company with her partner. They have a son and they live together in a house that they were able to get through a lot of effort. Ever since she learned the trade of seamstress, she began receiving large orders for embroidery, decorations, sewing clothes, etc. This helped her improve her income. Goya works out of her house in an area where she set up her small sewing workshop. She buys the materials she uses wholesale to make a larger number of clothing articles. She has been doing this for 2 years. She took advantage of this time to get acquainted with various customers who are business owners and she hopes the list will continue to grow. She hopes to count on better machinery in the near future to do additional jobs which would allow her to increase her income. She was able to improve her business with the 6 loans she has had with Microfinanzas PRISMA, just like the members of her community bank that have been very committed to working. This would be her 7th loan. The 2000 PEN she has applied for will be used to purchase materials to make the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing material

loans.name: Siitu

texts.en:
Siitu P. (10100006976) is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Faleseela. She is engaged and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Siitu operates a family member's business raising crops. This business is primarily planting & harvesting taro for sale. Siitu has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

In 2009, Siitu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Siitu is requesting this loan, of 1000 WST, to be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Siitu from SPBD. Siitu plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes S. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Gertrudes is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gertrudes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 53 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos (2 a su cargo), tiene estudios D. primaria completa, vive en el centro poblado D.  Rosa Cami.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, Lucia se dedica a la venta D. tortas y postres en su puesto del mercado central.

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. harina, azúcar, leche, gelatina, para la preparación D. postres y tortas.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades D. pago y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Flor” (New Flower) that is located in the Ilave district, Collao Province, Puno State. She is 53 years old, is married and is a mother of 5 children (2 in her care). She comopleted primary school, and lives in the Rosa Cami town center. Mrs. Lucia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 3 years. Her initial loan was for s/.500.00 soles. Lucia sells pastries and desserts at her stand in the central market. Presently, she ask for a loan of S/.500.00 soles to buy flour, sugar, milk, and gelatin to prepare the various desserts and pastries. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the payment and savings arrangements at Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk and gelatin

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 40 años, es una mujer que trabaja arduamente, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo, quienes son su mayor tesoro. Sus deseos de progresar la motivaron a implementar una tienda de comestibles dentro de su casa, a la que sus vecinos están acostumbrados a visitar. Asimismo, trabaja en el comedor popular de su localidad, el cual tiene 10 años de creado. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede dedicarse a sus dos labores durante el día y percibir algunos ingresos adicionales que le ayuden a mejorar su condición de vida. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender ambas actividades a la vez, pero está muy contenta de mantenerse ocupada, aunque termine muy cansada por la noche. Para el futuro, Reyna espera lograr implementar su bodega con nuevos productos solicitados por sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende su crecimiento económico.
Este es su primer préstamo individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir trabajando con  la misma responsabilidad que con su banco comunal, donde la consideran una de las socias más cumplidas del grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos soles solicitados espera ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos para sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel S. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina C. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old and married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This  will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto es un hombre muy noble, tiene 59 años, está casado con la madre de sus 5 hijos, pero todos ya son mayores y viven fuera de casa, ahora él y su esposa viven con sus nietas. 

Además de dedicarse a la venta de condimentos y verduras en horas de la mañana, por las tardes siembra y trabaja en sus chacras de papas y ollucos, mientras que su esposa se dedica al restaurante que hace dos años abrieron en un local de la municipalidad de su zona. 
Durante las horas de almuerzo Modesto le ayuda a su esposa porque en el restaurante ella no se abastece para atender a todos los comensales. Sólo así, logran pagar el alquiler del local y cubrir la educación de su nieta.
Pese a todas sus carencias económicas, ellos no quieren perder a sus nietas, pues la mayor de sus hijas se fue y las abandonó y a ellos no les gustaría que algún día venga por ellas, pues las pocas ganancias que tienen las comparten con mucha alegría con ellas y su presencia les da mucha alegría a su vida.

Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y hasta el momento no ha fallado en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Modesto, 59, is a gentleman. He is married to the mother of his 5 children, all of whom are adults and live independently. Currently, he and his wife live with their granddaughters. Besides selling seasonings and vegetables during the morning, in the afternoon he plants and tends to his potato and olluco (Andean tuber crop) fields while his wife tends to a restaurant they opened two years ago in a rented unit in their municipality. During lunch time, Modesto helps his wife because she can't tend to all of her customers by herself. It is only thus that they are able to earn enough to pay the rent on their rental unit and pay for their granddaughter's schooling. Despite all their financial needs, they do not want to lose their granddaughters. The eldest has already abandoned them and left and they would not like it if someday she would return for the others. What little profits they earn they happily share with them and their presence brings much joy to their lives. This is his fourth loan with MFP and, to date, he has never faltered in his repayments. The funds requested now are to buy chemical fertilizers for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira J., 24 years old and living with her parents, is a well-known seamstress in her community, having worked there for more than nine years.  She decided to take advantage of her reputation five years ago and bought a tailoring machine, providing tailoring services since then to the community.  Mohira now has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls ordering the national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase new modern fabrics for sewing dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Mohira and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of new modern fabrics for sewing dresses.

loans.name: Davhardavaa

texts.en:
Davhardavaa N. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two oldest children are 26 and 24 years old and they both go to universities in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The youngest son is 19-year-old and goes to a local secondary school. Davhardavaa has a small family business retailing coal. He owns a truck that he uses for transporting coal from the mining site to the town. He runs the coal retail business with his wife and his children. Once he brings the coal from the mine, his wife sells it by the bag to local families who use the coal to heat their houses and cook their food. Coal retail is a good business, especially during a cold season like winter, he says. He has been doing this coal retail business since 2004 and been quite successful. He says that he aims to purchase a house for his family with the accumulated earnings from his business. He requests a loan to purchase more coal for his business. 

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase coal to sell

loans.name: Genny

texts.en: Genny B. manages a small rice field in Banga, South Cotabato. She is 40 years old and capable of handling a business. She says that as she continues to work on the farm, she really needs additional capital. She says that working on a farm is not easy – hard work, patience and money are needed to achieve your desired harvest. Genny would like a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest. When she has firmly established her business, she dreams of buying more land to help her relatives.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
60-year-old Dometila is a rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has two children. Her business provides income for her family and that’s why she gives her best to make her rice farm productive.

Dometila is now preparing her land for planting. She will need seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs for her farm. She applied for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to acquire the farm inputs she needs. Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Dometila and her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa L. de 55 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, vive sola en su propia casa, esto debido a que sus hijos ya son mayores y residen en Los Estados Unidos.  La señora Rosa trabaja elaborando ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres, la cual posteriormente sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de Zapotitán y Ciudad Arce, siempre ubicadas en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a este trabajo desde hace ya varios años. Debido a su arduo trabajo y gran esfuerzo diario, Rosa logra obtener ganancias aceptables, a pesar que las ventas no siempre son muy buenas, ya que hay día en los que las ventas son pocas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela, hilo y todo tipo de materia prima para la elaboración de prendas de vestir y de esta manera poder ofrecer mayor cantidad de estilos, tallas y colores de ropa, tratando de obtener más clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para tener una vida digna, suplida de todo lo necesario para vivir, así mismo, desea poder terminar de reparar su casa, ya que algunas paredes están dañadas, así como el techo, es por ello que necesita mejorar sus ganancias para contar con el dinero necesario para mandar a hacer estas reparaciones.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is 55 years old and lives in the city of Arce located in the Province of La Libertad. She lives alone in her own home because her children are grown and they all live in the United States. Ms. Rosa makes clothing for men, women, and children that she used to sell by walking the streets of Zapotitán and Arce, both in the Province of La Libertad. She has worked in this area for many years. Because of her hard work and daily effort, she has achieved an acceptable profit in spite of sales not always being good, and some days when the sales are very low. She requested a loan through which to buy more fabric, thread and all kinds of raw material for making clothing and thus be able to offer as many styles, sizes and colors of clothing, and to try to get more customers. She does all this in order to have the money to make a decent living, and be supplied with all the necessities. She also wants to finish repairing her house, as some walls and the roof are damaged. That is why she needs to improve her profits to have the money to do these repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material and supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Pach Moeng Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group has ten people. They all live in Thmey village in Kandal province. Mrs. Pach Moeng is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They use their loans for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Sam, are farmers and they own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting their family living. In the crop field, they have some problems because it is infertile soil and it has a lot of insects, but they did not have enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Pach Moeng decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fuel. She is a mother of three children, one is employed in garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
41-year-old Elona B. is involved in rice farming. She is married and has four children. She said that her farm really helps her family a lot. But as the needs in her household continue to increase, she tried raising pigs so there would be another source of income for her family. School fees for her children are also a challenge to Elona and her husband, but they are determined to give their children a proper education.

Elona asked for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She said that she would use it to buy farm inputs and also feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor  Juan A., tiene 41 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Maria Ramirez, tienen 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 8 años, para poder da inicio a la misma vendió ganados vacunos que poseía, y compró los implementos para el desarrollo de dicha actividad.
    La actividad que desarrolla es la producción de materiales de construcción para casas, a base de barro cocido, denominado ladrillos, y tiene bastante éxito, ya que los ladrillos que produce son los de mejor calidad en la zona.
El préstamo solicitado es para la reparación de una maquinaria utilizada en la actividad.
 El deseo del Señor Juan es la de llegar a producir una mayor cantidad de ladrillos, para así tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Mr. John A. is 41 years old and is married to Mrs. Maria Ramirez. They have 4 children, all of them go to school..

He is dedicated to the production of bricks that are used to build homes. He has been in the business for about 8 years and is quite successful since the bricks he produces are the best quality in the area. Before he started the brick’s business he sold beef cattle he owned, and bought the tools for the development of this activity.

The loan he is asking for will be used to repair a machine that he uses in his activity. Mr. Juan whish is to eventually produce a greater quantity of bricks, so he can have a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a machine that is used to make bricks

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn G. is from the village of San Juan. She is 24 years old. Jovelyn is the leader of a 8-member loan group sponsored by ASKI.
