Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jovelyn G.'s Group.

Jovelyn is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jovelyn raising and sells pigs. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase pig feed and supplies. This will be Jovelyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and supplies

loans.name: Sarita Celedonia

texts.es:
Sarita V. de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es jardinero en el colegio “La moderna”, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 28 y 26 años que ya se casaron. 

Sarita inicio hace 7 años a vender productos Yambal (es una empresa que da oportunidades a pequeñas empresarias para que vendan la líneas de productos como perfumes, cremas y obtener cierto porcentaje de ganancia). Invirtió sus ahorros comprando perfumes y cremas y empezó a recorrer las zonas que conocía vendiendo los productos.

Ahora ella tiene muchos clientes fijos que le piden todos los meses productos Yambal, trabaja tres horas del día para vender sus productos y el resto del día se dedica a ser pastora de una iglesia de su sector. Con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes y cremas para vender más. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender mejor lo productos y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Sarita V., 51, lives in a periurban zone in El Guasmo, Guayaquil (named after a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia, El Guasmo is a popular, low-income neighborhood). Her husband is a gardener at the “La Moderna” school; they have two children, 28 and 26 years of age, who are married. Seven years ago Sarita started selling Yambal products (a company that provides opportunities to small businesswomen who want to sell products like perfumes and creams earning a percentage of the profits). She invested her savings to buy perfumes and creams and started combing the areas she was familiar with selling her products. Now she has a lot of regular customers that place monthly Yambal orders with her. She works three hours a day selling her products and spends the rest of the day working as a pastor in a local church. She will use the funds to buy perfumes and creams to sell more. In the future, she would like to have a fixed location to sell her products better and to be able to better build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods of various kinds. Due to the ways she prepares her foods, she is able to win the heart of her customers. She is 5 years old in this business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to cook and sell. 

Mary is married with 4 children. She is 45 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She appreciates LAPO and Kiva  lenders for their help.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to coo and sell

loans.name: Abed Alateef

texts.en:
Abed Alateef A. M. is a 19-year-old young man from Jenin. Abed Alateef started working in an early age. He bought a small truck and started distributing fruits and vegetables. He has become a reliable vendor to many shops in the city. Because he is a very active and happy person, everyone wants to deal with him.

Abed Alateef took a $500 loan from FATEN to pay the last payment of the truck he purchased. Abed Alateef is now very relieved that he owns the truck and all benefits of his business will be his.

In the photograph, Abed Alateef sits in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay for his business truck

loans.name: Sohrab John

texts.en:
Sohrab John R. is from the village of Brgy. Palabotan, Dupax de Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 45 years old. Sohrab John is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sohrab John owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Sohrab John has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when he sells his mature animal.

In 2010, Sohrab John joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sohrab John is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Sohrab John from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Don Gustavo  de 42 años de edad , labora para el INTA desde hace 10 años como operario de campo, tiene 3 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la Escuela Rigoberto Cabezas de Nueva Guinea.  Su esposa se encarga de los  quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos.

Gustavo esta solicitando su 5to credito para hecharle el piso a una habitaciòn, es importante mencionar que este cliente siempre se le apoyado con estos pequeños creditos, ya que su ingreso es poco pero ha sido un cliente excelente. 

Sueña con tener su vivienda bonita y darle las comodidades basicas a su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 42 years old and has worked for INTA (Nicaragua Department of Agriculture) for the past 10 years as a field operator. He has three children who are studying at Rigoberto Cabezas School in Nueva Guinea. His wife is in charge of the household chores and taking care of the kids. Gustavo is requesting his fifth loan so he can put down a floor in his home. It's important to mention that this client is always supported by these loans, since his income is meager, but he has been an excellent client. He dreams of having a beautiful home and providing his family with basic commodities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put down a floor in his home

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Bancomunal Amaquella, tiene 45 años, es madre D. tres hijos, la mayor D. 25 años y la última D. 11 años. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, huevo, frutas y gaseosas) este negocio lo viene realizando hace cinco años en su casa que es propia, también ella compra tara, cochinilla y cuero. La meta D. Teresa es que sus hijos salgan profesionales y también hacer los acabados D. su casa del segundo piso.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la compra D. abarrotes en general para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest one is 11 years old. Teresa sells groceries (sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, fruit, and sodas). She has managed this business for five years out her house.

Teresa also sells tara, cochineal, and leather. Her goals incluD. seeing her children become professionals and finishing the second floor of her house.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy groceries for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, fruit, and sodas

loans.name: Amabengeza Group

texts.fr:
Josiane D.  est une femme de 30 ans, née à Nyamata, province de l’Est du Rwanda. Elle est mariée et à trois enfants, le moins âgée a  7 mois et le plus âgée à 4 ans, 2 parmi ses enfants sont allé à l’école. Josiane avec sa famille habite Gisenyi.

Concernant son activité, elle est commerçante des produits alimentaires  comme riz, haricot, huile, sorgho,…. elle a une expérience de 2 ans dans ce domaine.
Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le deuxième, le précédent lui a aide d’ameliorer son business de commerce ambulant et payer le loyer pour sa famille qui habite a Nyamata
Dans l’avenir, elle pourra avoir un nouveau prêt bien d’un gros montant pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires ainsi elle pourra acheter ou bâtit sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Josiane D. is a 30-year-old woman who was born in Nyamata, in East Province, Rwanda. She is married and has three children, of whom the youngest is 7 months old, and the oldest is 4 yours old. Two of her children are attending school. Josiane lives with her family in Gisenyi. Regarding her business, Josiane is a merchant selling foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, oil, sorghum… She has two years of experience in this domain. The loan signed with the micro-finance institution ACB is the second one. The previous one helped her to improve her itinerant business and to pay the rent for her family living in Nyamata. In the future, she will be able to obtain a much larger loan to increase her sales. Thus, she will be able to buy or to build her own house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beans, rice, sorghum for retail sale in her store

loans.name: Esunjol

texts.en:
Esunjol T. is 28 years-old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, western Mongolia. His two children are too young to attend a school so they stay at home and his wife helps him out with his fruit selling business. Since 2004, Esunjol has been operating two types of businesses from rented stalls at a local trade market - fruit retailing and furniture sales. 

Esunjol started his business with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT but after several years of stable earnings, he used his savings to expand his business.  The working capital now exceeds 3,5000,000 MNT and he was able to purchase a truck for his business. Esunjol is a hard working and polite person who wishes to buy a small car as well.  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large quantity of fruit and vegetables for his business from Hovd, a neighbouring province of Bayan-Ulgiy.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Maria Manuela A. P. tiene 40 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 24, 22, y 19 anos. 

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Maria se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y un negocio de vender verduras. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el crédito para ampliar el negocio y poder mantener a la familia. Con el apoyo del préstamo la permitiría tener un negocio fijo. Su sueno es tener un negocio en un lugar bien establecido en un lugar fijo. Se desafia con la competencia en su negocio. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Manuela A. P., 40, is married and lives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province, Ecuador. She has 7 children who are 24, 22, and 19 years of age. Maria is a member of the Gradas Chico communal bank located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. It has 20 members in total who are corn, wheat and potato farmers and cattlemen for the most part. This is their third loan from the cooperative. Maria is a farmer. She grows corn and she has a vegetable selling business. She makes her purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda’s market. She is asking for funds to expand her business to be able to support her family. Help from the loan will make a stable business possible. Her dream is to have a business in a well established, stable site. Her challenge is competition in her line of work. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis M. M. is thirty-seven years old, married and has three children aged between one and half and seven years old. His business is located in Bombolulu, a residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions, including the Indian Ocean’s white sand beaches.

Francis has been selling mobile accessories for the last five years to local people. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he faces is that in his area there are so many people doing the same kind of business as he is. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He describes himself as customer-friendly.

Francis is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more phone accessories to expand his business. He hopes to grow and be able to improve his family's living standards. He also hopes to give his children a quality education and own a house some day.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories

loans.name: Jesus Nelson

texts.es: El señor Jesus vive en la zona del barrio Internacional, en la zona del Plan 3000, él hace 10 años que se dedica al servicio del transporte urbano, empezó como chofer trabajando para otras personas  y actualmente esta pagando su propio vehiculo, él necesita el crédito para terminar de construir en su casa un cuarto que tiene a medio construir y tambien quiere hacer algunos arreglos al motor de su vehiculo, ya que como es su herramienta de trabajo necesita que este en optimas condiciones porque el trabaja desde las 06:00 de la mañana hasta las 23:00 para poder cumplir con las obligaciones y responsabilidades que tiene, el junto a su familia quieren mejorar sus ingresos por lo que sueñan con comprar muy pronto otro vehiculo para poder generar más ingresos. El señor Nelson se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y cumplido.
texts.en:
Señor Jesus lives in the International neighborhood, in the region of Plan 3000.  For the past 10 years he has been running an urban transport service.  He started as a driver working for other people and now he owns his own vehicle.  

He needs a loan to finish the construction on his house as he has a room that is half-built.  He also wants to make some repairs to his vehicle since he is dependent on it for work.  He needs his vehicle to be in optimal working condition because he works from 6:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night in order to meet his obligations and responsibilities.  He and his family would like to buy another vehicle very soon so that they can generate more income.  

Señor Nelson is known for being a very responsible and accomplished person.

loans.use: To finish construction on his house and make repairs to his car

loans.name: Lydia Ailo

texts.en:
Lydia Ailo O. is a 43-year-old skilled and experienced businesswoman who has a longstanding relationship with her school. She operates her own Private School where she earns a living. She is married to Kaloli Wandera. They have five children aged 25 years, 21 years, 17 years, 16 years and 8 years, respectively. They live in Kabiyemit Eldoret, Kenya

Lydia started her business in 2005 with Ksh. 25,000 startup capital. She has been in this business for the past five years with an income of Kshs. 60,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.25, 000 with KADET LTD. With her loan, she plans to buy stationary and desks.

loans.use: To buy stationary and desks.

loans.name: Shake Hand Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Shake Hand” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is forty-two years old, married with six children – four are in primary school and the other two are no longer attending school. Fatmata  sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables. She has been doing this business for ten years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients such as rice, tomatoes, palm oil, etc wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as rice, tomatoes, palm oil, etc wholesale

loans.name: Walter Emmanuel

texts.es:
Walter reside en el Transito, departamento de San Miguel, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su abuelo y juntos trabajan el cultivo de maíz, su abuelo ha sido quien le ha enseñado a sembrar ellos tienen sus propios terrenos para realizar el trabajo y no tienen horario fijo.
Actualmente están preparando la tierra para hacer la siembra pero aun no han comprado los materiales que necesitan para el cuido de la milpa, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, esto le ayudara para desarrollar una buena labor en el cultivo y de esta manera darle el mejor cuido para obtener una buena cosecha de maíz.
Él sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida para él como también para su abuelo, además desea tener una buena cosecha de esta siembra.
texts.en:
Walter lives in Transito, in the department of San Miguel. He is 21 years old, single, and lives with his grandfather. Together they farm maize. His grandfather taught him to farm; they own their farmland and have a flexible work schedule.

Currently, Walter is preparing the land for planting but he hasn't purchased the necessary supplies to take care of his crop. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy manure, chemical fertilizers, and pesticides. These agricultural inputs will help him take care of his crop throughout the season and obtain a better maize yield at harvest.

Walter dreams of improving his and his grandfather's quality of life. He also hopes for a good harvest this season.

loans.use: Purchase of organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides.

loans.name: Takussan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKUSSAN est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par proximité et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de SOURWACOUNDA.

Madame Fatou B., à droite de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 06 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés.

Elle s'active dans la vente de sucre. Elle s'approvisionne à Ziguinchor, environs à une trentaine de kilomètres pour revendre dans son village.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et soutenir son époux dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Takussan solidarity group was created December 19, 2001. It consists of nine women from the same village who came together as neighbors and through bonds of affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois SOURWACOUNDA.

Mrs. Fatou B., seen at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the head of the group. She is 60 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is also responsible for six other children who were entrusted to her.

She sells sugar for a living. She buys her stocks in Ziguinchor, about thirty miles away, for resale in her village.

With her new loan, she will increase her stocks in order to bolster her profits.

Her goal is to help pay for her children’s tuition, and to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: To buy sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to sell to his customers

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Huancheñas”  del distrito Huancané,  provincia de Huancané y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos  (02 independientes), realizó estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja desde hace  01 año  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  R., su  préstamo inicial  fue de S/. 500.00, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales casero y venta de verduras.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá comprando 02 sacos de zanahoria, un saco de cebolla, 06 cajas de tomate, apios, camote, beterraga, papa, etc., trabaja junto con su esposo, quien también trabaja como esquivador en volquetes.

Su sueño es terminar de arreglar su casa y mejorar su negocio.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, lo que gana sus ahorros, su seguro de vida e intercambiar palabras con la socias, y sobre todo estar alegres..
texts.en:
Jacinta is a member of the “Las Huancheñas” community bank which is located in Huancané district, in Huancané province, in Puno department.  She is 53 years old, married and has 4 children (2 of whom live independently).  She studied up to elementary school level.

Jacinta has been working with Movimiento Manuela R. for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles which she invested in her business buying and selling animals and selling vegetables.

Jacinta is requesting a new loan for 800 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying two sacks of carrots, one sack of onions, six boxes of tomatoes, celery, sweet potatoes, beets, potatoes, etc.   She works together with her husband who also works as a dump truck driver.

Jacinta's dream is to fix up her house and improve her business.  What she likes about her community bank are the meetings, what she makes from her savings, her life insurance, chatting with the other members and, above all, being happy together.

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of carrots, one sack of onions, 6 boxes of tomatoes, celery, sweet potatoes, beets, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth K. is 40 years and married to Musa Kipkule. Together with her husband they have been blessed with ten children whom she and her husband bring up.  She runs a hotel and a grocery stall and she has been in business three years with a monthly income of Kshs 4,000. 

She is borrowing her second loan of Kshs 10,000 which she plans to use to purchase more stock for the retail shop and grocery. She plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to expand the grocery. 

She hopes is to have a big shop in the near future.

loans.use: To add stock to the hotel

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Hourt M., 29, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. M. sells motorbike spare parts, earning an income of about $5 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more motorbike spare parts to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 1st loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more motorbike spare parts to resell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad N. is a young father of one daughter. He lives and works in Jenin city and he owns a cafe in the city. Ahmad also takes care of his parents and brothers who are still students.

Ahmad's brother is an employee with a decent salary.  Ahmad's brother's house needs urgent repair such as fixing the kitchen. Ahmad took a loan from FATEN to help his brother make the repairs he needs.

Ahmad appears in the picture here.

loans.use: Helping his brother repair the house

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 22-year-old wife and mother of one son. Abeer's husband Hasan runs a grocery store in Jabalia Refugee Camp in the Gaza Strip which is known for its high population.

Abeer and her husband need to expand the business so as to sell more and attract the maximum number of customers. Abeer took a loan from FATEN to purchase more goods and different types which are needed in households.

Abeer's husband appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman, as are most Gaza Inhabitants.

loans.use: Purchasing goods to increase sales

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz belongs to a small city of Punjab province of Pakistan called Khanewal. It is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Shanti Nagar with her husband and four sons. She shifted here 25 years ago. Her husband’s name is G. and he is a daily wage laborer. His income is not enough for the whole family, andthat’s why Mumtaz started a clothes sewing business to share the financial burden with him. She is very skillful and earns a good profit from her work.

Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide education facilities to her elder children. Her eldest son works on monthly wage. The next two are also daily wage laborers. Her youngest son is studying in class 6. 

Mumtaz is a very active lady; besides her business, she also performs her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish her work quickly and earn better profits.  

She has been doing this business for the past 10 years. She is sure that she will be able to do a lot better by purchasing a new sewing machine. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and knows her responsibilities very well. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting. This is her 3rd loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mumtaz.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said M. H. is a 44-year-old man. He is married to Mwanahawa H. and they have been blessed with four children. Said has been a poultry farmer for the last six years and he gets good profits from this business. 

He has now applied for his first loan from KADET and he plans to purchase three hundred chicks and a sack of feed for the poultry. The anticipated profits will be directed into the renovation of the poultry house. 

Said’s dream is to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase three hundred chicks and a sack of feed

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan V. T. is 48 years old and has three children, two of whom attend university. He has been a farmer for many years, and today grows a range of crops that include rice and vegetables. He also owns a small herd of cows. He joined our microloan program in 2007 and has made good use of loans to expand his farm. Because he has been such a reliable client, the size of his loans has increased annually. He is now applying for a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy  fertilizer for his next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is currently in a business of selling tomatoes and maize grain. She is 40 years old and married, with 5 children, all of whom go to school. Celina requested a loan to stock more tomatoes and maize grain to sell. 

She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes and maize grain to sell.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. His two children, ages 13 and 16, both attend local secondary school.

With the help of his older brother, Battulga manages a wooden product-making business that he started in 2007; his wife helps to paint and wax those products. After gaining much experience and building up his clientele, he was able to move his production from his backyard to a workshop ger. Battulga now owns sufficient equipment to produce quality wooden products that are well-known amongst his customers.

An honest and hardworking man who says, "Life is good," he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of wood.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos está  casado con la señora Rosalina, tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son menores que aún están en la escuela primaria y 2 son mayores están trabajando en forma independiente.
Tienen una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja Rosalina.
Se iniciaron en la actividad con una platita que recibió Carlos como parte de una indemnización de un trabajo anterior que él realizaba. 
Carlos  además de su despensa trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una empresa contratada por Itaipú, para que de esa manera pueda ayudar  con los gastos del hogar y educar a sus hijos.
El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es a través de los créditos, porque  resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en:
Carlos is married to Rosalina. They have 5 children, 3 of whom are still at primary school. The other two are older and have jobs. 
Carlos has a well-stocked store, where his wife Rosalina works. 
They began this business with some money that Carlos received as severance pay from a previous job.  
In addition to having the store, Carlos also works as a security guard for an Itaipu-based firm. With the money he earns from this job, he is able to cover the household costs and provide for his children's education. 
He explains that the only way of being able to develop the business is through loans, since it is very difficult to secure sufficient capital through other means. It is for this reason that he has requested the loan. He is a very responsible person, who wants to succeed. He has a jovial spirit and is enterprising. There is a little doubt that he will be able to achieve all the goals he has set himself.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, noodles, sugar, and other basic foods

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
Nhim is a rice farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. In addition, Nhim also weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling them. She also orders baskets from other villagers and sells them to make additional income. 

Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing and tapping the palm trees behind his house. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance in order to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing costs, and hire some domestic laborers to transplant seedlings.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing costs, and hire some domestic laborers to transplant seedlings.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years old and a single mother of three. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from her retail shop.  She has been operating the business for three years. She was able to get capital to start the business through the support of Faulu Kenya. Previously, she was selling second-hand clothes.

Susan has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.  She hopes that one day she will grow her business into a wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 38 years old. She is married with three children. 

She has a shop that sells variety of food products like snacks, canned goods and juices. She has had this business for three years.  She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to sustain her variety store.

Christy has been a member of HSPFI for two years. In the future, Christy hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell like snacks, food products and drinks

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 53-year-old married man, father of two children. He has worked in construction for the past 31 years. He started to work on his own in 1982 because he was planning to learn how to deA. with cement and to move along with planning his future and so it was.

Mahmoud is borrowing from A. Majmoua - Kiva's partner - for the first time. He is requesting a loan in order to buy new tools necessary for his business. Most of his customers are neighboring villagers and contractors. He is a man with a good reputation and is recommended to others to deA. with since it's hard these days to find a trustful person who works with a conscience.

Mahmoud hopes to stay healthy and capable of working to provide his family with the necessities for living.

loans.use: To buy new tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria  de 53 años de edad,  vive en  el barrio Las estrellas con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15 a 23 años;  ella en su casa tiene un restaurante y estadero, negocio  que inició hace más de 23 años , con una pequeña mesa ollas y estufa casera; Hoy no solo ha crecido su infraestructura física que ya cuenta con una cocina industrial y todo el menaje,  sino que se ha convertido en un restaurante, con 3 empleados que la ayudan a que diariamente pueda responderle a su diversa y exclusiva clientela,  con los menús que son más apetecidos.  Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores ha logrado hacer crecer su capital de trabajo, mediante su reinversión y trabajo disciplinado. El financiamiento actual está dirigido a  hacer  adecuaciones a su cocina, agregándole un mesón en lámina galvanizada, el cual es muy  higiénico y fácil de asear;  así mismo comprará más menaje y materias primas e insumos, para responderle a su creciente clientela, que muchas veces se devuelven porque la comida se ha terminado.  Mientras Gloria fortalece su sueño de ampliación de su espacio físico, para lograr el confort de los clientes y el suyo propio, maneja su negocio con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 25% , apoyando firmemente su ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Gloria, 53, lives in the “Las Estrellas” neighborhood with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 15 to 23.  She has a restaurant/tavern at home, a business she started over 23 years ago with a small table, pots and a home stove.  Today, not only has its physical infrastructure grown since it now has an industrial stove and all kitchenware but it’s become a restaurant with three employees that help her meet the needs of her diverse and exclusive clientele with daily meals that are quite appealing.

Her Kiva loan is the third loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She used the previous ones to increase her working capital through reinvestment and disciplined work.  The current loan will be used to do some kitchen refurbishing.  She will add a galvanized steel work table, which is more hygienic and easier to clean.  She will also buy more kitchenware and raw materials and supplies to meet growing customer demand who sometimes have to be turned away because the food has run out.  While Gloria strengthens her dream to expand her physical space to attain customer comfort, she runs the business with a profit margin of no less than 25% firmly supporting her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy a galvanized steel work table, more kitchenware and raw ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Parkimaso

texts.en:
Parkimaso, 46 years old, is married with four children. He has been a mixed farmer for fifteen years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. This is his third loan with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plough back into farming and part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Mcharuko Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. He also takes care of his mother. He has been a tailor for 10 years now. He works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more materials and made more dresses to sell. He also bought fabrics to sell and has paid his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more materials to make more dresses. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mcharuko" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make more dresses

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 32, is married and they have three children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years.

He learned of KADET through a registered client. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make a profit and use that profit to purchase sheep for fattening.

He dreams that at the age of 40, he will be stable and his children will live better lives.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase amplifiers for his DJ project.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia  do mesmo nome, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos destes 2 frequentam a escola.Fez o ensino primário e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma sobrinha que vive com ela. 

trabalha  como servente no colegio nhamunda ha mais de 9 anos e tem um saláio de 4.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar fardos de roupa usada para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.  
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para ampliar a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Rosalina was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has four children; two of them go to school. Rosalina finished primary school but did not continue because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports a niece who lives with her.

She has worked as a helper at Nhamunda school for more than nine years and has a monthly salary of 4,600 meticais. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Rosalina has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is her first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy bundles of used clothing so she can increase her inventory. 

She promises to make her payments with no problems, and in the future she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell used clothing.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is from the town of Jimenez Misamis Occidental. He is 39 years old, married with 2 children. James owns & operates a business project, operating a habal-habal or a single motorcycle transport to make a living. This kind of transportation is common in rural areas, for travel from towns to barangays (villages). Each month, he earns PHP 4,500 doing this type of activity, He requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. He operates three motorcycle as of now.

In 2010, James joined GDMPC and he is now on the fifth cycle of loan. James is a good member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative. In the future, he hopes to have another motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts  for better service

loans.name: Douglas Antonio

texts.es: Douglas ,31 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada, el es zapatero. El inicio en sociedad este negocio con su suegra hace dos años, pero se independizo de ella, lleva dos años administrando por si solo su zapatería , el vende zapatos que el mismo elabora en la ciudad de Granada y Masaya  es en base a este negocio que mantiene su hogar , paga el colegio a sus hijos. A el le gusta y siente orgullo de ver sus zapatos son muy demandados ya que son fruto de su trabajo y elaborados por sus propias manos. El requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima tales como cuero, mostasia, cambreyon, suelas, clavos que son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para elaborar sus zapatos de cuero. Con la inversión podrá comprar con más facilidad a un buen precio la materia prima que necesita. Sus planes según nos cuenta es expandirse en departamentos del país tales como Matagalpa, Chinandega , lograr tener una pequeña tienda donde pueda dar empleos , tener estabilidad económica para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Douglas, 31, is married and has two children, ages 8 and 10.  A native of the city of Granada, he is a cobbler.  He began this business with his mother-in-law two years ago but became independent from her.  For two years he has been running his shoe business by himself.

He sells shoes that he makes himself in the city of Granada and Masaya.  With this business he supports his household and pays his children's school expenses.

Douglas enjoys and feels proud of seeing his shoes in high demand, since they are the fruit of his work and made with his own hands.

He needs the loan to buy materials such as leather, beads, shanks, soles, and nails, which are part of the materials he uses to make his leather shoes.

With the investment he will be able to buy the materials he needs more easily at a good price.  According to what he tells us, his plans are to expand into other departments in the country like Matagalpa and Chinadega, get a small store where he can give jobs, and have economic stability to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, beads, shanks, soles, and nails.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is married with 4 children. Ana Maria is 45-years-old and lives in the Philippines.

Ana Maria owns and operates a business venture, selling wood and wood-related products in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earns 4,000.00 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 PHP to pay for the cost of canvassing supplies  and delivery.

Ana Maria has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Ana Maria hopes to finish the education of her children and to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of canvassing supplies and delivery.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El socio actualmente se dedica  ala agricultura como principal actividad, el socio tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa; el socio también tiene junto a su conyugue una panadería y juntos estan obteniendo buenos resultados, el socio también tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad, el socio desea invertir el prestamo de ahora en la compra de levadura, harina, azucar, y para su pequeña tienda de abarrotes con su conyugue cerveza, es una tienda pequeñita y hay lo basico para consumo diario, el socio desea seguir creciendo y ahorrar para la educacion de sus hijos el desea verlos profesionales. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, azucar, cerveza.
texts.en:
This member currently works in agriculture as his principal activity; he has fields where he grows corn and potatoes.  He also runs a bakery with his wife, and together they've had good results from it.  The member also has a small store selling everyday products.

The member wants to invest the current loan in purchasing yeast, flour and sugar, and also beer for his small grocery store that he runs with his wife.  It is a very small store which just has everyday basics.  The member would like to continue to grow his businesses, and to save money for the education of his children as he would like to see them become professionals.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing flour, yeast, sugar, and beer.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, sugar and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, doña Juana, trabaja en una institución de la comunidad buscando la manera de llevar el sustento a su casa y así beneficiar a sus dos hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Juana atraviesa, es de mejorar a lo inmediato sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que amerita efectuarles ciertas mejoras para que sea más duradera y evitar que se siga deteriorando. 

Ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, cemento, bloques, arena, hierro y mano de obra para realizar las mejora en la casa, para brindarle mayor seguridad a su vivienda debido a que por medio de esto brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the Department of León, Doña Juana works at an institution in the community in order to sustain her household. Her two children benefit because she is able to provide them the necessary conditions for their development.

One of Sra. Juana’s existing needs is to proceed with immediate improvements to her home to prevent further deterioration and to make it more durable. She made the decision to approach CEPRODEL and request a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, sand, iron, as well as pay for labor to complete these home improvements. The end result will provide greater security in her home and better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor needed for home improvements.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар вдова и любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле- продажей скота. Она начала свой бизнес с продажей молочных продуктов и скота и до сих пор продолжает этот бизнес. Более 10 лет она в этом бизнесе и имеет богатый опыт. Гавхар хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Гавхар хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Gavhar is a widow and a loving mother of three children.  She is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She started her own business with the sales of dairy products and livestock and still runs this business now.  She has been in this business for over ten years and has a rich experience in it.  Gavhar wants to expand her business and make a good profit.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to refill her revolving capital.  Gavhar relies on your help and thanks you in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. El distrito peruano de Huayllabamba es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en el Departamento del Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú. 

Rayda tiene 26 años edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella tiene dos actividades economicas principales que son: ella vende verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, tomates, ajo y otras más en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Urubamba y ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad Rayda requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras como tomates y cebollas. Su sueño de Rayda es abrir uina tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad donde nació.   

Rayda es integrante del banco comunal “Virgen Natividad” y el grupo está conformado con 15 socios que viven unos en el ciudad de Huayllabamba y otros en el ciudad de Yucay. El distrito peruano de Yucay es uno de los siete distritos de la Provincia de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Rayda was born in the city of Huayllabamba, and she lives in the same city where she was born.  The Peruvian district of Huayallabamba is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province in the Cusco department, Cusco Región, Perú.

Rayda, age 26, is married and has two children.  She has two main business activities.  She sells vegetables like onions, tomatoes, garlic, and others in one of the most popular markets in the city of Urubamba.  She also raises young animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

At this time Rayda needs the loan to buy more vegetables like tomatoes and onions.  Rayda’s dream is to open a grocery store in the city where she was born.

Rayda is a member of the Virgen Natividad communal bank.  The bank is comprised of 15 members.  Some of them live in the city of Huayllabamba, and others live in the city of Yucay.  The Peruvian district of Yucay is one of the seven districts of the Urubamba province.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Umu.  She is married and has three children aged 15 (a male in form 1), 4 (a female in nursery school) and 2 (female). She has no additional dependents. 

 In 2001, Umu established her textile business. She started business after she completed form 3. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 324,000 as profit every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.

 Umu requires this loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. In future, Umu plans to educate her children and also want to be a great businesswoman.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cotton materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy detergents, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. to add to her stock.

loans.name: Salome Sandrine

texts.fr: Solange est une femme âgée de 30 ans, fiancée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre entre 05 et 12 ans. elle mène une activité de vente de frais (ignames, patates, tomate) depuis 15 ans dans un marché de la place. elle sollicite ce crédit augmenter son stock permanent de marchandise afin de résoudre le problème de rupture dont elle est souvent victime. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle compte dans l'avenir agrandir son comptoir et diversifier sa marchandise afin de mieux assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Solange, age 30, is engaged with four children aged 5 to 12. She has been selling fresh produce (yams, potatoes, tomatoes) at a local market for the past 15 years.  

She is seeking this loan to build a permanent stock of merchandise, which would solve the shortage problems that she often faces. She has a good experience in her activity. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and diversify her stock to help cover her children’s tuition and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Aburukundo Cb Group

texts.en:
Beatha is a group leader aged 35 years. She is married with six children aged between 3 and 16 years. Four of them go to school.

The group is called Aburukundo Cb; "Aburukundo" means “the lovely people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for positive change and a better future.

Beatha sells charcoal and has been running her business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sisney

texts.en:
Sisney G. is a 40-year-old married mother who runs a tailor shop for men and women. With 18 years of experience, Sisney reached the point where she needed her own office space to manage all of the business she was getting. Originally, she learned how to be a seamstress from years of working in a factory, but she opened Costuras de Doña Sydney in her own house. Her helper is her only son, who cuts the molds and measures the material. Ms. G. works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm every day of the week. She is asking for this loan so that she can purchase more fabric and thread and set up an exhibit window for her work. Sisney has had to run the business on her own with some help from her son, and she wants lenders to know that she is very entrepreneurial and does not quit.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about Ecuadorian businesses and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: purchase more fabric and thread and set up an exhibit window for her work

loans.name: Ibadulla

texts.en: Ibadulla has run this business for 4 years.His neighbors know him and buy milk, butter and cheese from him. He has a steady stream of customers and places to exhibit his animals. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a milk cow and to improve the butter and cheese he produces.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is a 44-year old mother of four children. She sells all different kinds of goods which attract both locals and tourists. Samoan artisans make the merchandise she sells, and her stock ranges from women’s jewelry to hand-printed fabrics to men’s clothing. She works long hours at her stall, which is open six days a week. She can earn up to ST 160 a day (USD 65). This is enough to support the basic needs of her family, but Navy dreams of being able to grow her business and increase her income further. She is seeking loan funds to purchase additional goods from Samoan artisans to re-sell at her stall.

loans.use: Buy goods to resell at flea market

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en: Lubov has developed a successful small business by selling very practical items – socks and hosiery. Her kiosk at the Rushski market in Melitopol is stocked with a colorful selection of socks, leggings and women’s hosiery. In a typical month, Lubov sells about $2,000 worth of products and makes around $840 in profit. One of the things she likes about this type of retail operation is how easy it is to handle small items, such as socks, rather than other, larger items. She is also helping her daughter establish a small enterprise. Lubov has requested a loan of $900 for her own business to purchase new products and maintain an adequate inventory.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Solemna E. is newly married, and has just moved to a new home. Her husband spends his days working as a farmer. Solema and her husband work hard cleaning and weeding their farming area. She heard about the local microfinancing organization through some village women, and this will be her second loan. She will use the $300 dollar loan to buy tools for farming. Solema is also planning to start a mini market in the village so she can sell their crops. Mrs. E. will repay the loan over 18 months.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um Y., age 54, works selling foodstuffs and provisions, earning only $1 per day of profit. Her husband, age 56, works as a farmer, making about $1 each day. They have seven children, two who are mechanics, two who are students, three who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $300 in order to purchase piglets to raise for additional profits. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and resell at the market for a profit.

loans.name: Sharofiddin

texts.ru:
Sharofuddin G., who is 30, is married and has 2 children. He has his own dealership center in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is in the business of selling sim and prepaid cards from mobile phones. Using the funds from the loan, he plans to purchase a large amount of sim and prepaid cards. Currently, these products are very popular among population of the city because many people use this method of communication. This loan will give the people of Qurgan-Tube and those who visit the town an opportunity to purchase these cards at lower prices, as Sharofuddin had contracts directly with operators of mobile connections. He plans to pay off the credit in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Гафуров Шарофиддин, возраст 30 лет, образование среднее, семейное положение – женат, имеет 2 детей. Гафуров Шарофиддин имеет диллерский центр в городе Курган-Тюбе. Он занимается продажей сим-карт и препэйд-карт для мобильнхых телефонов. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести большое количество сим – карт и препэйд – карт для мобильных телефонов. Данный товар в настоящее время пользуется большим спросом среди населения, так как очень много пользователей мобильной связи. Этот кредит даст возможность населению Курган-Тюбе и людей приезжающих в этот город, приобретать эти карты по более низким ценам, так как Шарофидин имеет прямые договора с операторами мобильной связи на их приобретение. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of sim cards and prepaid cards for cell phones

loans.name: Eneyda

texts.es:
10 years ago Eneyda started her business selling typical food (from the Peruvian jungle) at her house’s doorstep. Indeed, she is a very hard working woman and the economical need pushed her to start this business.

Before having the food business, she would wash clothes for others and she would help her husband at his carpenter's workshop. Nevertheless, when her husband hurt his back, Eneyda started to sell food and as sole infrastructure, she had a grill, a table and a batan (a kitchen utensil from Peru made in stone). Still, she has a good eye for business and that is why she would like to open a store at her house or to put a roof on the 2nd floor in order to rent rooms. Indeed, there is a high demand of housing in the area as a University will open soon right in front of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Las necesidades económicas hicieron que Eneyda, hace 10 años, pusiera un pequeño puesto de platillos típicos de la selva peruana en la puerta de su casa. Y es que ella siempre fue una mujer trabajadora. Antes de este negocio, lavaba ropa y ayudaba a su esposo en su carpintería. Pero cuando su esposo se lesionó la columna, Eneyda comenzó a vender sus productos solo una parrilla chica, una mesa y un batán. La visión de Eneyda para los negocios no tiene límites. Por eso, le gustaría poner un bazar en su casa o, en caso contrario, techar el segundo piso de su vivienda para poder alquilar cuartos ante la inmensa demanda que hay por la zona y la próxima inauguración de una universidad frente a su casa.

loans.use: She would like to open a store at her house or to put a roof on the 2nd floor in order to rent rooms

loans.name: Meri

texts.es:
Mrs. Meri is part of the community bank Bellavista, which is located at Jr. Calleria N° 651, Calleria District, Department of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and mother of five children. With the first S/ 300 loan she received from Mauela Ramos, she invested the money to buy food to sell. She is currently selling food as her business. She wakes up very early to purchase groceries from the market, and she dedicates her afternoon preparing the food that she will later sell at night. Her children also help her with her business. With the S/.1,000 loan that she will repay in 5 months, she will buy rice, sugar, chicken meat, fish, pork, vegetables, and other products she uses daily. Although Mrs. Meri is busy everyday, she always saves time to spend with the family because the family is most important to her. She is grateful that Manuela Ramos has provided her with loans for her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Gabrielle Sham.

La señora Meri pertenece al banco comunal Bellavista, ubicado en el Jr. Calleria N° 651, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años, es madre de 5 hijos y su esposo es obrero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300, decide invertir en la venta de comida. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de comida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar sus víveres, en las tardes se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas para que en la noche salir a vender. Sus hijos la ayudan. Con el préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, carne de pollo, pescado, chancho, verduras, etc, que necesitara para la venta diaria. Meri, a pesar de realizar muchas actividades diarias, siempre se da un tiempo para compartir con su familia porque para ella es muy importante la unión familiar. Gracias a Manuela Ramos que le brinda los préstamos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, chicken meat, and other products

loans.name: Guillerma's Group

texts.es:
Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia have belonged to the communal bank "Los Claveles" for 8, 8, and 7 years respectively.

Guillermina is married, 45 years old, and has five children. She has a store where she sells general goods, vegetables and fruits in her community of Huayllapampa in the Pacaycasa district. In addition, Guillermina buys and sells the products of the native tree, tara. Guillerma, on the other hand, is married, 44 years old, and has five children. She sells fruits from a traveling cart in the boulevard near the cemetery, and she also prepares fruit juices.

Juila, meanwhile, is married, 36 years old, and has four children. Julia has a grocery store in Huayllapampa. She also sells beverages outsiD. the local stadium.

Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia need loans for 1400 soles, 600 soles, and 800 soles ($1000 total) that they will invest in buying rice, sugar, noodles, oil, various native fruits and vegetables, including chirimoya and lúcuma, plantains, oranges, cookies, candles, soap, and detergent.

Guillermina, Guillerma, and Julia dream of making of their businesses prosper, of providing a good education to their children, and of improving their houses.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia pertenecen Banco Comunal Los Claveles hace 8, 8, 7 años respectivamente.

Guillermina es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Guillermina tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas en su comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Distrito D. Pacaycasa. Además Guillermina compra y venD. tara.

Por otro lado Guillerma es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Guillerma venD. frutas D. manera ambulatoria en la alameda del cementerio y también prepara jugos D. frutas.

Mientras que Julia es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Distrito D. Pacaycasa. Además Julia venD. bebidas en el estadio D. su comunidad.

Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia necesitan préstamos D. 1400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, chirimoya, lúcuma, plátano, naranja, galletas, vela, jabón y detergente.

Los sueños Guillermina, Guillerma y Julia son que sus negocios prospere, sus hijos tengan una buena educación y mejorar sus casas.

loans.use: Invest in the womens' businesses with groceries, fruits, vegetables, and general goods.

loans.name: Rita Guadalupe

texts.es:
Mrs. Rita Guadalupe R. P. lives in the San Martin region, in the Picota province, district of Picota. She belongs to the “Dynamic Women” Communal Bank, and works selling juices and sandwiches. Her stall is located inside market 1 in the Picota district. Thanks to the guidance of her parents, she works in the business of selling fruit juices and extracts, as well as snacks such as sweets and cakes, among other things. She begins selling her products very early each day. With this loan of 1,300 soles ($500), which will be repaid over 6 months, she will buy a new blender, dishes such as glasses appropriate for juice sales, as well as flour, sugar, and butter by the kilo, and other ingredients for the preparation of breads. Rita lives with her husband and her daughter. Day after day they do their best to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rita Guadalupe R. P., vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota pertenece al Banco Comunal .”Mujeres Dinamicas”, su puesto de venta de jugos y emparedados se ubica en los interiores del mercado N° 1 del distrito de Picota. . Gracias a la orientación de sus padres se dedica a este tipo de negocio, la venta de jugos y extracto de frutas y refrigerios como: dulces, kekes, entre otros que ha diario es ofrecido desde muy tempranas. Con el crédito de S/. 1300.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará una nueva licuadora, vajillas como vasos apropiados para la venta de jugos, además comprará harina, azúcar, y manteca en kilos y otros insumos para la elaboración de los panes Rita, vive con su esposo y su hija, juntos día a día se esmeran por alcanzar sus objetivos.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
Jamshed G. is 33 years old. He and his wife have 2 children. Jamshed’s children are small now, but he already is working hard to ensure the best future for them. Jamshed is the only breadwinner in the family and he is really hard-working.

Jamshed has a shop in the central market of Istaravshan. For more than 3 years he has sold soft drinks from this location. Jamshed offers a wide range of soft drinks at attractive prices. His shop is very popular in his neighborhood and brings in a steady income. Jamshed is asking for a loan of 3200 somoni (925 $ US dollars) to expand his inventory. The loan will be repaid in 12 months.

Your support will really help him. Let’s get behind this dedicated father and help him with make his children’s dreams a reality.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is single and supports himself and his younger brother working as a taxi driver. He owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. Sergei is physically challenged - he has cerebral palsy. The taxi business is his only income source, and he puts much hope in its further growth. Sergei works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to earn enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and pick-up passengers a lot faster. 

Sergei has been in this business for 8 years. His determination to succeed has helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and has promoted its expansion. Sergei has paid back all the loans that he ever borrowed from “Nadiya Ukraine.” Currently, his daily income is about US$30-40, and he would like to take out a short-term seasonal loan to be repaid within two months. With the help of the money, Sergei would be able to do some repair work on his vehicle and, in the future, remodeling of his apartment. Sergei's modesty, diligence and responsibility so far have helped him develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers, and it will also help him promptly repay the current loan.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Channeary

texts.en:
Mrs. Channeary T., of Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, is a 47-year-old widow with six children, one of whom is a tailor while another is employed in a garment factory. The third child is attending school while the remaining three are of preschool age.
Since her business as a vegetable seller in the local market is doing well, Mrs. Channeary T. is asking for a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Seleman

texts.en: Seleman R. runs a small business selling phone accessories in the Buguruni business section of Dar-es-Salaam. He has three children, two in primary school and one in kindergarten. He would like to expand his shop, and has requested a loan of $550 to make that possible.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Rza

texts.en:
Rza A. is a 48-year-old man who breeds calves and sells dairy products to the local people and dairy factories. He is married and has 3 children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in his life made him recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 8 years he has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening and then selling them.

Raising livestock is the main financial income source in his family, beside this Rza works as a school teacher in a local school. But his salary as a teacher is quite small and he has focused more on improving and expanding his livestock activity.

Rza wakes up early every morning to feed his calves and cow with the goal of selling them at the best price in the local market when they will be grown enough.

Rza `s main goal is to provide education for his children, and with this purpose in mind, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1200 USD to buy calves in order to expand his business. Let's support this hard-working man and hold our hands out to help him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing for her small business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị L. 45 tuổi tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 1996, chị có 3 con, 2 con  hiện đang đi học, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, chồng chị làm nông nghiệp ngoài những lúc nhàn rỗi anh vân thường hỗ trợ chị trong công việc kinh doanh, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hóa, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị rất phát triển thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 150.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ đầu tư mua hàng hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs Phạm Thị L. is 45 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 1996. She has 3 children, 2 of which are still in school, the other one is already married. Her husband is a farmer. In his free time he would help her out tending her grocery store. Loans from last rounds were invested in her store. It is a successful business. Her family income is 150.000 VND a day. This time she is seeking a L. of 12.000.000 VND to buy more products for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two daughters. When she opened her small vending kiosk, her family was in a very tough financial situation. However, Irina decided to take a risk and start a small business that sells pet food, treats and accessories in the local market.  Presently, she has about 25,000 Grivnas in working capital and monthly income of around 8,000 Grivnas. 

Irina has been receiving loans from Nadiya Ukraine since 2001. She has promptly repaid each of the loans received from the organization. Irina is asking for a loan of 3,000 Grivnas to increase her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of pet supplies such as feeders, bowls, mats, collars, leashes, toys, and canned/dry pet food. She believes a good assortment of supplies for dogs, cats, birds, small animals and fish will meet the needs of more pet owners, helping them find the right product for their pets. This loan will not only help Irina re-stock her inventory and boost her sales, but it will also help her earn enough to support her family and provide a better livelihood for them.
This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Damilola

texts.en: Damilola is 28 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial taxi driver. She sells underwear. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of  40,000 NGN to purchase more underwear to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

loans.name: Abdul Nafee

texts.en:
Abdul nafee is married and he lives with his own family. He has butcher shop and also has land for agriculture. He has been involved in this business for a long time. He got his first loan and used it to further his business. Now he plans to enlarge his business. He wants to take out his second-cycle loan.

Therefore Abdulnafee has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis (USD$1075) with a term of 27 months to enlarge his business, complete his stock and buy some seeds for his land. He would love to be a good business dealer in the future.

Abdulnafee is happy. He plans to open a retail food shop in Jalalabad city in the next five years. He wants to say that without this loan it was impossible to get his business to be its best, and he hopes that it is going to be the best in the future.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his business.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carlita C., 67 years old, is a widow. She lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Carlita is a very industrious woman and is popular with her neighbors. She plays the role of a mother and a father at the same time for her family.

She primarily earns a living buying and selling coconuts. It is a very important business. With the profits from her business, she is able to feed her children and meet their daily consumption needs. She also raises pigs.

Joining Paglaum Cooperative really helped Carlita solve her financial problems. She also joined so she could benefit from its other resources, such as insurance. The assurance that her family gets from Paglaum MPC, is very important to her.

She has now applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 so she can buy sacks of food to feed her pigs. She has 3 piglets, which she is raising in addition to her main business. In the future, she looks forward to a comfortable life. She wants to have her own piggery one day.

loans.use: To buy food for her pigs

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members. Its leader N., 37, is the mother of three children, all of whom are single and under her care. She is married to Khun, 40, who is a motor taxi driver. N. has served as a farm worker since 1999. She is well-known for working hard and being a responsible neighbor. N. is taking a loan to buy a new motor for her husband's business, because the old one has been causing difficulties. The loan will help the family with its transportation needs and will also help them attain a better standard of living. 

The other members of the group are: N., 42, who works in a massage center, and is taking a loan to build a house for herself and her family; S., 52, who serves as a firewood provider, and is taking a loan to buy some poles for her new house; N., 55, who sells traditional Khmer noodles to the whole community, and is applying for a loan to invest in her business; and L., 19, who works in a massage center, and is requesting a loan to buy more wall slides for her house. They all live in Sienm Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a new motor for her husband's business

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia V. is a 52-year-old widowed mother of seven. Three of her children are still in primary school, two are in high school, one attends college, and one is a university graduate.  Eufemia lives in San Jose, the capital of beautiful Antique Province.  Much of the economy in Antique Province revolves around fishing and farming.  Eufemia sells fish from a stall at a public market, a business she inherited from her parents. She plans to use the proceeds of this loan as rolling capital for her fish-selling business.  Eufemia hopes that someday she'll be able to buy her own vehicle to transport fish back and forth. Her goal is to earn enough income to be able to put all her children through college.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is thirty-five years old. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives independently in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana. She works very hard to make ends meet.

Comfort is a food vendor. She sells kenkey (a fermented maize dish) and fried fish. She prepares it in her house and sells by the roadside in the daytime. Comfort procures bags of maize and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for over six years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and improve her business.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize to make cooked food to sell

loans.name: Ata

texts.en: Ata Y. is 35-years old. He is married and has three children, two sons and a daughter. The children are in junior high and primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
