His wife is a seamstress. Ata is a herbalist. From local herbs, he manufactures ointments and concoctions which he distributes to drug store operators in his community. He also hawks and treks to other towns to sell his products. He procures his raw materials from Dormaa, the district capital. Ata has been in business for seven years and is requesting a loan to procure raw materials in bulk. He is hopeful to expand his business and give his children the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy herbs in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 57-year-old Joyce T. from Mwanza. She is married with five children between the ages of 19 and 26 years old. Joyce has been running a clothes business since 2006. She sells clothes to different customers. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. Joyce currently earns about 250USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Joyce thanks you for her support!
ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa García ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
En esté momento está Solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de una cuarto ya que sus dos hijos están creciendo, necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Pagaría el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como vendedora de servicios funerales, ya que su esposa el señor Tomas Flores se encargaría de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Alma Rosa García has already received three loans with Kiva partner FVP, all of which she has repaid punctually. Currently she is requesting a loan to begin construction on a room in her home, since her two children are growing and need their own space in the home. She will repay the credit with income from her work in funeral services, while her husband, Tomas Flores, takes care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to her home

loans.name: Fuaselela

texts.en:
Fuaselela F. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Tafitoala. She is married with five adult children. Fuaselela owns and operates a bakery. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from baking and selling cakes to the local community. Fuaselela has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 850 WST a month.

In 2004, Fuaselela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fuaselela has successfully repaid a previous loan, to purchase additional cooking ingredients, of 2250 WST from SPBD. Fuaselela is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used for the same purpose. The loan will be her fifth loan from SPBD. Fuaselela plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Rotilda

texts.en:
Rotilda has been working hard to provide a better life for her children. Her husband makes an income from their welding shop while she works as a vegetable vendor in their village to be of help in sustaining their family. She is hoping for their business to be more progressive in order to be more profitable for the future of her children.

Rotilda is already 47 years old, her family lives in the big community of San Ignacio Ilagan, Isabela. In her vending routine, she is generating an average income of PHP 150 daily. That amount is already of big help for her family but according to her, it's too little for their growing needs and the educational needs of her children.

She wants to increase her income and in order to achieve this goal, Rotilda is seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. Rotilda has a lot of dreams for her four children who are all enrolled in school. She hopes that all of them will be able to go in college and finish their studies so that in due time, they will be able to obtain a good and stable job in the future.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Ana Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ganado ovino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor, la señora Ana Cristina también se dedica a la chacra.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas y los ahorros
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Cristina is a member of the "24 de Junio" Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, Province of El Collao, Puno state. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished high school and lives in Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos association for several years and is one of the founding members. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of sheeps.

At this time she applied for a loan of $525 for the purchase of cows. Mrs. Ana Cristina is also active in the farm field.

Her desire is to keep working to give an education to children. She likes the speeches and savings

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline tiene 24 años, es una joven muy optimista, vive con su madre a quien trata de apoyar con los gastos de la casa, pues su mayor deseo es mantener el bienestar de su hogar. Su interés por los cosméticos la llevó a emprender su trabajo como vendedora de productos de belleza. Ahora trabaja ofreciendo a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos diversos catálogos de muestra, pero lo que les agrada a sus clientes es el trato que reciben y la bonita personalidad de Jackeline. Lo que a ella más le gusta de su negocio son los premios que recibe de las diversas líneas de belleza por el incremento de sus ventas. Lleva 5 años en este rubro y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los cobros a las personas que se retrasan en sus pagos. Para el futuro, Jackeline desea instalar en su domicilio un stand con los productos de belleza que tiene en stock, lo cual le permitirá tener ingresos diarios, sin tener que esperar la entrega de los pedidos cada fin de mes.
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y es consciente que su permanencia en la institución tendrá que ver con la puntualidad en sus cuotas de pago. Con los dos mil soles solicitados realizará mayor cantidad de pedidos y tendrá la posibilidad de acceder a las ofertas que brindan las líneas de belleza.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: Thaong P. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make US $2 of profit each day; her husband, Nov Dy (pictured here) stays at home making and selling brooms at the local market. He typically makes about US $4 of profit each day. Thaong P. would like to take out a loan of US $800 so that her husband can purchase a motorbike, with which he can transport brooms to the market.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar G. is from the village of Barra, Tudela, Misamis, Occidental. She is 42 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp in the local community. Maricar has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maricar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Maricar is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay tuition fees for her children. 
--------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 52 años de edad y es madre de siete hijos, todos mayores de edad, está separada de su esposo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de granos como maíz, arroz, frejoles, etc. pues tiene un hermano que es agricultor, el cual le provee de estos productos a precio bajo. Ella  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza” desde hace cinco años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de pescado, los compra directamente a los pescadores a precio cómodo para luego venderlos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado en la compra granos para luego venderlos en el mercado de la localidad. La meta de Antonieta es tener un local para vender  sus productos.
texts.en:
Antonieta, 52, is a dynamic and hard working member of the "Juan Zaplana Belliza" communal bank. She has been a member for five years. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Yarinacocha district. She has seven adult children and is separated from her husband. She buys and resells grains like corn, rice, beans, etc. because her brother is a farmer and he provides these items at a low price. Her first 300 sol loan was used to buy fish directly from the fishermen at a reasonable price to then resell. Currently, she needs a 1,500 sol loan to buy grains to resell in the local market. Antonieta's goal is to have her own place from which to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains at wholesale.

loans.name: No Joke Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata B., Christiania E., Francis K., Alima S. and Mbalu S.. They called their group 'No Joke'. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They’re requesting a loan of around SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. This will help them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve many of their problems.

Fatmata B. (left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Tongo, a town in eastern Sierra Leone. She is forty years of age, married to a businessman, and they have two children. One of her children is in university and the other is in senior secondary school II. Fatmata sells shoes, clothes and soft drinks. She has been in business for ten years now. Fatmata will use her share of the loan to buy clothes, shoes, soft drinks and plastic containers of water.

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, soft drinks and plastic containers of water

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en:
Florentina B. is from the village of San Jose. She is 49 years old. Florentina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Marcos.

Florentina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: C. is a local rice farmer, aged 29. In addition, she works to sell cake around her village for extra income. She also depends on her husband’s income; he works as a food cooker for wedding parties. The couple has been married a lot of years and is blessed with four teenage children, who are students and dependent on their income. C. said that her current income is not adequate to cover her family expenses and she hopes to resign from her job and then go to work as a house cleaner in Malaysia through the private company. Because she is required to pay the company a service fee, she decided to seek a loan of $300 from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: To pay a service fee to a new employer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ngeh

texts.en: V. is single and was born in 1952. She is the mother of two children. She lives in her own house situated at Foncha Street, Nkwen, Bamenda, Northwest province, Cameroon. This is V.’s third loan since she joined GHAPE. The first was for 37,500 FRS and the second 200,000 FRS obtained in 2007 and 2008 respectively. V. plans to invest the current loan in cultivating her farm, buying farm inputs, piglets and firewood. She plans to use the profits to increase her capital and build a kitchen for herself. V.’s difficulties have mainly been illnesses of family members and the death of some relatives. The loan will help the community in providing vegetables, manure to farmers and firewood to households, reducing the cost of going to the market to obtain these items. V. believes she will succeed because she has been in this business for a long time. GHAPE is most preferable to V. because its interest rate is low and the repayment conditions are very good, notwithstanding the conditions of granting the credit to its borrowers. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, piglets and firewood

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman who has five children in school. She runs a shop while her husband is employed by the county council.  Her business has been running for two years.  She is also employed by the Teacher's Service Commission.  

Agnes as participated as a member of Faulu Kenya by taking loans and she has borrowed two loans in the past. She has requested a loan of Kes.20,000 to add more stock. Her dream is to buy a motorbike and a car in the future. She says that she is very hard-working.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: George

texts.en: George M. M. is twenty-nine years old, single, and has no children yet. His business is located at Hazina Estate, near the road to Nairobi. He has been selling phones, cables, and mobile accessories for the last four years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is power rationing. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy a computer and a printer to expand his business. He hopes to become a millionaire in future. He is very hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: buying a computer and a printer for his business

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a young 22-year, married with single son. She lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband name is M. A. who runs a timbers selling business. He has been doing this work for the back 6 years. He earns approximately Pak Rs. 15,000 on monthly basis. 

Khalida is a seamstress. She handles her personal life and work with full obligation. She is known as responsible and hardworking lady in her community. She takes order from her neighbors. She can sew all types of women wearing such as (designer clothes and simple clothes). She is applying for a loan to buy timbers in bulk to expand her husbands’ business.

She has three other ladies in her loan group. Razia wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Safia wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. Saima wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy timbers in bulk

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita H. is from the village of Tinongos, Pugaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Amelita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: P-3, Pugaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tomas Andres

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomás C. es de la compañía Potrero de la ciudad de Carapegua, el mismo cuenta con casa propia y se dedica a la venta de productos empaquetados, específicamente remedios naturales, golosinas, y granos en general, entre otros, realizando este trabajo hace varios años, teniendo como zona de acción las compañías y ciudades aledañas.

   Cuenta con clientela formada gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos.

   El crédito solicitado fue utilizado para compra de mercaderías (granos, remedios yuyos o naturales, golosinas) a modo de incrementar su nivel de inventario y mejorar su nivel de ingreso.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomás C. is from the Potrero neighborhood of the city of Carapegua. He owns a house and sells packaged goods, namely natural remedies, candy, and grains, among other goods. He has been in business for several years, serving the surrounding neighborhoods and nearby cities. He has a solid client-base thanks to his high quality products.

He is requesting this loan to purchase goods (grains, herbal remedies, candy) so that he can increase his inventory and improve profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural remedies, candy, and grains like beans, and corn in bulk

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda M. is from the village of Brgy. Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married. To make a living, Rosalinda runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane Traoré  est un homme marié de 29ans monogame, qui vit   avec ses deux  enfants et leur mère à Fakola, un des villages de la préfecture de Kolondièba dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la République Mali.
Monsieur Souleymane fait le commerce de carburants, de lubrifiants et de quelques articles divers (liquides de freins, liquide refroidisseurs de radiateurs...). 
Pour augmenter son capital et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grande, il adhère au programme  crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à son troisième  cycle de prêt, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents. Son lieu de vente  se trouve au marché de Fakola, où il est très sollicité et apprécié.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 10 fûts d’essences ordinaires. Il s’approvisionne à Guèya  en Côte-D’Ivoire, un pays frontalier de la république du Mali, auprès des grossistes et revend en détail et au comptant et rarement à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à payer  de la nourriture et  le reste sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane Traoré is a married man who is 29 years old and monogamous. He lives with his two children and their mother in Fakola, one of the villages in the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Mr. Souleymane has a business trading in fuel, lubrification oil and other miscellaneous items (brake liquid, cooling liquid for radiators...). In order to increase his capital and satisfy his growing customer base more readily, he joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and is now on his third loan cycle with the institution. He repaid the previous two loans on time. He sells his products at the market in Fakola, where he is in great demand and much appreciated. With this loan he is planning on buying 10 barrels of ordinary petrol. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Guèya in the Ivory Coast, a country which borders on Mali. He resells on a retail basis for cash and rarely on credit to a very diverse customer base. He is expecting to make a monthly profit of 90,000FCFA which will be used to pay for food and to reinvest in his business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fuel

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is from the village of San Marcos. She is 48 years old. Zenaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El  solicitante es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio San Jose, esta  casado. Tiene casa propia y es propietario de una despensa en su casa, con buena clientela y buen surtido de mercaderias.
 El señor Felix sueña con tener un local mas amplio y cómodo para todos sus clientes con buen surtido de mercaderías su negocio. 
 Nos comento que empezó a trabajar como vendedor ambulante en el mercado de Santani y que siempre  tenia en su mente  tener una despensa en su casa, ahora recurre a nuestra entidad para un apoyo de financiación para invertir en su negocio ya que desea ampliar su negocio, es una persona trabajadora, honesta, reponsable y muy servicial en su barrio.
texts.en:
Felix B. is from the San Jose neighborhood of the city of San Estanislao. He is married and has his own house. He owns a store that is set up in his house. The store has a good customer base and is well-stocked with merchandise. Felix dreams of having a bigger location for his store that would be more comfortable for all of his customers and that has a good assortment of merchandise. He tells us that he began to work as a street vendor in the Santani market, and he always had in mind having a store in his house. Now he has turned to our entity for financial support so that he can invest in his business, since he wants to expand his business. He is a hardworking, honest, and responsible person who is very helpful to others in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: No Promise Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu K. sells bowls, dishes, spoons, plates, cups, etc. She was born in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Rugiatu is 37 years of age, married to a businessman and they have three children: one is attending primary school, another is in secondary school and the youngest is not of school-going age. Rugiatu has been running her business for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more goods wholesale to add to her current stock. 

Rugiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. They are members of the “No Promise Group". They run small businesses in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living conditions will improve.

loans.use: To buy bowls, dishes, spoons, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat des t shirts; pantalon; curottes;...en vu de les detailler

loans.name: Samir

texts.ru:
Samir A. 43 let. On yavlyayetsya  Samir pereselenec in Fuzuli , seychas on projivayet v Fuzuli regione, . On jenat i imeyet 3 detey , sin 17 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i xodit na shaxmati , dochka kotoroy 13 let ona toje uchitsya v shkole  i zanimayetsya tancami i dochka 9 let kotoraya xodit v shkolu i ochen lubit uchitsya. 

Samir uje 3 let kak otkril etot maqazin i rabotayet v nem. Etomu biznesu eqo naushil starshiy brat. Seychas Samir nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti  dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Samir A. is forty-three years old and lives in the Fuzuli region. He has three children: A seventeen-year-old son, who enjoys playing chess, and two daughters, thirteen and seven. The former is an avid dancer, while the latter likes going to school. Three years ago, Samir opened a store. He learned the bussiness from his brother. Now Samir needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for resale.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana es una joven madre de familia de 19 años de edad que vive junto a su menor hijo en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona perteneciente a la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a vender tamales (plato oriundo de varios países de latinoamérica consistente en una masa de maíz molido rellena de carne y envuelta en hojas de plátano). Ella prepara el producto en su vivienda y los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe, a veces también recorre las calles del distrito para ofrecer su mercadería. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo, quien se encuentra trabajando en Lima, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Diana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos, de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y también sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y garantizarle a su menor hijo un futuro estable y próspero, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y progresar, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer luchadora y entregada a su familia. En la imagen ella nos muestra la masa del tamal antes de ser cocinada.
texts.en:
Diana is a young mother. She is 19 years old, and she lives with her young child in the Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province. This area belongs to the La Libertad region. It is over one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young she has sold tamales (a native dish in many Latin America countries; which consists of dough made from ground corn, filled with meat, and wrapped in banana leafs). She prepares the product at her home, and she sells them at the Guadalupe city market. Sometimes she also traverses the district streets to sell her merchandise. With the income from this business she helps her husband, who works in Lima, with the family’s expenses. Diana wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more supplies. That way she will be able to increase her production, and her sales will also increase. To achieve this objective she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to guarantee her young child of a stable and prosperous future. She is always working hard to get ahead and progress. The people who know her consider her to be a tenacious woman who is devoted to her family. The photo shows her making the dough for the tamales before it is cooked.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make tamales to incease production in her business

loans.name: Marjie

texts.en:
Marjie P. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures, a general store and a food vending business. She lives in Hacienda Bino in Barangay 1, a part of Kabankalan City in the Negros Occidental province of the Visayas islands. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4000 PHP.

Marjie is now borrowing 12,000 PHP so that she can buy more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marjie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: La Sra. Diana es una muchacha joven que se dedica al comercio de zapatos, pero adicionalmente  trabaja como mesera de jueves a sábado en una discoteca para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su bebe quien apenas tiene 3 meses, es madre soltera pero se da modos para poder seguir estudiando ya que solo le falta un año para `poder terminar la universidad con este negocio se costea los gastos de estudios. Los fines de semana por el día trabaja limpiando y cocinando en el domicilio de su garante quien la conoce desde que ella era pequeña. Este crédito necesita para poder ampliar su mercadería ya que tiene bastante pedido pero no el capital suficiente para poder cubrir la gran demanda que tiene.
texts.en: Diana is a very young woman who works in the shoe business. She also works as a waitress from Thursday through Saturday in a disco in order to improve her and her three month old baby's living conditions. She is a single mother, but she finds a way to keep going to school since she only has one more year until she can finish college. She pays for her schooling with this business. On weekends, she works during the day cooking and cleaning in her co-signer's house, who has known her since she was little. She needs this loan to be able to increase her merchandise, since she has a lot of orders but not enough capital to be able to cover the high demand that she has.

loans.use: To purchase shoes via catalog

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He rents a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is electricity.

He has operated his green vegetable stall for more than four years, selling to his neighbours and passers-by. Joseph faces the major challenge of seasonality. During rainy seasons, vegetables are scarce in supply. He hopes to start a motorcycle business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase green vegetables (sukuma wiki) and a sack of tomatoes for resale. Joseph decided to join Yehu because of accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase sukuma wiki (green vegetables) and a sack of tomatoes.

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es: El Sr. Benicio   vive en el barrio San Antonio de la zona del plan 3000, vive en la casa de sus suegros, tienen un hijo, su esposa trabaja en el mercado como encargada de ventas en una ferretería, el señor Benicio tiene un foto estudio en un calle muy populosa de la zona, el tiene una computadora y dos impresoras con las que realiza su trabajo, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar una impresora mas apta para el foto estudio y un escáner. El señor Benicio con el apoyo de su esposa se esfuerza para salir adelante, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Benicio lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Plan 3000 region.  He lives in his in-laws' house.  He has one child.  His wife works in the market where she is in charge of sales at a hardware stall.  Benicio has a photo studio in a very busy street in the area.  He has a computer and two printers on which he does his work.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a better printer for his photo studio and a scanner.  Benicio, with the support of his wife, works hard every day to get ahead.  He is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is very grateful to the organization for the support which it has given him.

loans.use: A printer for his photo studio and a scanner

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a housewife, she stays at home and does her household work.  She has no child. She is a citizen of a city named Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Her house is located in the area named Akhter town, which is the small residential area of the city. 

Her husband, M. R., is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a fruit selling business. He buys fruits from the fruit markets at cheap rates and sells it on different streets of the town for good profit. 
 
Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity to sell to his customers.  He has been doing this business for the past 10 years, and Zarina hopes that this loan investment will be profitable for his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application.  In previous loan years, she has proved herself a responsible loan user who paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy fruit in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy natural products.

loans.name: Kiruuma Twekambe Group

texts.en: S. Levicato is a 46-year-old farmer who makes a living selling produce such as beans and maize in his town of Kiruuma. He also leads the Kiruuma Twekambe group and is raising three children. He has been in this business for more than 20 years and is doing well by buying produce from local farmers and selling it to local traders. His dreams are to buy a car to use in his business, and to continue paying his children's school fees so they can have a good education and succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize to resell to local traders.

loans.name: Janneth Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Janneth Rodríguez es socia del banco comunal Nueva Vida, vive por el sector de la Virgen de Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su arquitectura, sus paisajes, su gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños y su gente es muy calida y amable.

La Señora Janneth tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 11 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija  en la escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional y labora conduciendo un taxi, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Janneth trabaja en un centro comercial muy reconocido de la ciudad como cajera, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y su horario es rotativo, labora de domingo a domingo. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de sabanas, trabajo que realiza hace 4 años.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y le gusta por el compañerismo que existe entre todas las socias,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más sabanas. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Janneth Rodrígez is a member of the “Nueva Vida” [New Life] communal bank. She lives in the Virgen de Bronce neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for the beauty of its architecture, beautiful views, cuisine that captivates both locals and foreigners, and its friendly and welcoming people.

Janneth is 31 years old. She is married and has 3 children who are 12, 11, and 4 years old. Her first daughter is in high school, and her second daughter is in grade school. Her husband is a professional driver and he drives a taxi. They don’t have their own house, which is why they rent. 

Janneth works as a cashier in a well-known shopping center. She has been at this job for one year and her schedule is variable. She works from Sunday to Sunday. In her free time she sells sheets, which she has been doing for four years. 

This is the fourth loan she has taken with the communal bank. She likes it because of the friendships between the members. She will use the loan to buy more sheets. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy sheets.

loans.name: Kamuyu United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Kamuyu United” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in order to seek for a loan of SLL 400,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Abubakarr K.. Abubakarr was born in Magburaka, thirty-five years ago. He is married and has three children – two in secondary school and one in primary school. Abubakarr is a welder and has been in the welding profession for many years. With his share of this loan, he will buy welding materials such as iron robs, fuel, etc. to improve his business. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Mohamed L. Tarawalie handing over the loan to the clients)

loans.use: Buys welding materials such as iron robs, fuel, etc to improve his business

loans.name: Engelen

texts.en:
Engelen A., 27, is from the village of Datu Tangkilan and a group member of PMPC. She is married with three children, two students and one infant. To make a living, Engelen owns and operates a sari-sari (retail) store selling products for daily consumption.

In 2010, Engelen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to add to her capital and inventory. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as capital and purchase inventory for her sari-sari (retail) store.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en:
I Wayan W., 49 years old, is married and has four children. He works as a driver who earns an average income of Rp. 70 000 .- per day. He took out a loan of Rp.3000.000 .- to be used for car maintenance because the route he drives is very long every day, approximately 240 km. This  requires a good car to give  the passengers a safe and comfortable ride. 

I Wayan W. plans to save from his profits which will be used for the future of his son. I Wayan W. lives with his wife. Two of their children are still in school now. 

I Wayan W. spends Rp. 50 000.- per day for family needs. To help with the family income, his wife sells bananas and coconuts  at the market. This is his first loan at KSU MUK.

loans.use: used for car maintenance

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica M. L. está solicitando un crédito con nosotros para comprarles uniformes a sus hijos.
Verónica es madre soltera y es la encargada de mantener a su hijos, debido a esto no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poderles comprar dichos uniformes, ella no quiere que sus hijos tengan problemas en la escuela al no portar su uniforme correctamente, por lo cual pidió nuestra ayuda.
Ella pagara este préstamo con algunos de sus ingresos como operaria en una maquiladora.
texts.en:
Mrs. Verónica M. L. is asking us for a loan to buy her children school uniforms.

Verónica is a single mother and she must support her children.  She does not have the necessary funds to buy them their uniforms and she doesn’t want them to have any problems in school for not wearing their uniforms correctly; this is why she asked us for help.

She will repay the loan with income she earns working at an assembly plant.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une femme de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa maman alitée depuis plusieurs années. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Keur Khaly depuis le début en 2000. Elle est membre du comité de gestion et occupe le poste de trésorière. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de chaussures, de bijoux et de vêtements. Elle s'approvisionne à la capitale (Dakar) et à Ngaye (une ville artisanale) environs à 20 km. Elle a une bonne expérience du petit commerce pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis son jeune âge, avant qu'elle ne se marie.

Son nouveau crédit 500.000 francs CFA lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de l'accroitre

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari qui est malade depuis plus de dix ans. Elle prend entièrement la charge de ses enfants tout en maintenant son activité qui lui procure des revenus financiers
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of five children. She also takes care of her mother, who has been bedridden for several years. She joined the Banc Villageois of Keur Khaly at the beginning of 2000. She is a member of the management committee and holds the position of treasurer.

She runs a small business selling shoes, jewelry and clothing. She gets her merchandise in the capital (Dakar) and in Ngaye (a craft city) about 20 km away. She has a good experience of small businesses from having been engaged in such activities from a young age, before she got married.

Her new loan of 500,000 FCFA will allow her to better develop and expand her business.

Her goal is to support her husband who has been ill for over ten years. She bears the full responsibility of providing for her children while also sustaining her activity, which generates financial income.

loans.use: To order 50 pairs of shoes, buy jewelery and clothing to sell

loans.name: Howell

texts.en:
Howell C. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. He is 27 years old, married and has 1 infant. Howell owns and operates a business providing computer games services to local community members. Howell has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Howell joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Howell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Howell is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and utilities needed to maintain his service. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Howell from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and utilities needed to maintain his service

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly F. is from the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Beverly is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Beverly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, detergents & junk foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Beverly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, detergents & junk foods.

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: François

texts.fr: François R. est salarié, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 28 ans, il est marié, né au Rwanda, il a 3 enfants entre 10 et 4 ans, François a fini  8 ans de l’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son 2 eme cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter le sable, porte métallique, ciment pour la construction de sa maison.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire une bonne maison d’habitation.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et assurer le bien-etre de sa famille.
texts.en: François R. is a salaried employee and has been a client of ACB since 2008.  Born in Rwanda, he is 28 years old, married and has three children whose ages range between 10 and 14.  François completed 8 years of elementary school.  This is his second loan with ACB and he is going to use his loan to buy sand, metal doors and cement to build his house.  His strategy to grow his business is to build a fine house to live in.  He would like to self-finance and to provide for his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy sand, metal doors and cement to build his house

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old. Lydia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to  purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to  purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to  purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for the labor cost

loans.name: Virgen Del Paso Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Elena, que vive en la cuidad D. Itape. Encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité D. Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Virgen del Paso".
Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la Artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron D. sus padres y va pasando D. generación en generación.
Confeccionan hermosas prendas D. vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, en ao po'i, también las integrantes se dedican al comercio D. productos alimenticios, como así también compostura D. calzado, empleada doméstica y ama D. casa.
La Sra. Irma Concepción necesita del crédito para mejorar su labor en la artesanía, adquirir materiales D. buena calidad para confeccionar telas, camisas, manteles, en los cuales realizar mejores y distintos diseños D. bordados y así poder enseñar a sus hijos siguiendo la costumbre familiar.
texts.en:
This committee came together thanks to Elena who lives in the city of Itape.  They gladly accepted forming a Committee of Rural Women named “Virgen del Paso” committee.

The group members are artisans, a skill passed down from their parents and which is passed down from generation to generation.

They make beautiful articles of clothing like shirts and tablecloths using ao po’i (traditional embroidery technique).  Other members sell food, repair shoes, and are domestic employees and housewives.

Irma Concepción needs the loan to improve her crafts making.  She wants to acquire good quality supplies to make textiles, shirts and tablecloths on which to embroider better and unique designs and to be able thus to teach her children to follow the family tradition.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, fabric and shirts to embroider on.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim is a 41-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently buys corn from other villagers at a low price and then she takes it to boil for sale. She runs her business next to her house and is earning approximately of $1.25 a day. Her husband is a local farmer and a well digger. The humble couple has six children; one is working at a garment factory. 

This approaching rainy season, Mrs. Thim is applying for a loan to purchase a cow to plow her land so she can start to plant a rice crop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to plow her land.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 36 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason. She is married with two children. For the past year, Gemma has sold a variety of products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP for her work. 

Gemma joined PMPC this year. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to sell.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to sell

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Shryl

texts.en:
Shryl is a 25 year old married woman with 1 child. She and her husband are farmers. She helps her husband till their land located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. They primarily grow rice to sell.

Shryl has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to increase profit and improve her family's living conditions. Shryl also hopes to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, age 21, is married to Hannah, and they are blessed with one child who is nine months old. John operates a motorcycle transport business that has been in operation for two years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 21,000 (~$236).

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy another motorcycle. John hopes to own a fleet of commercial vehicles in future.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es:
Omar tiene 28 años de edad  y es padre de un pequeño hijo. En su comunidad se le conoce por ser un joven honrado y trabajador, que tiene muchos deseos de superarse. Vive en casa con su madre en el distrito de Castilla – Piura. 

Omar se dedica a la producción y comercialización de chifles. La ciudad de Piura es famosa por sus deliciosos chifles, que son snakcs de plátanos fritos (chips). Omar cuenta con este negocio desde hace 3 años y los desarrolla en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Omar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar los insumos que la preparación de sus chifles necesita. La demanda de Omar ha aumentado y es por ello que se  ha visto en la necesidad de  solicitar el crédito. 

Omar es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, y ha cancelado adecuadamente sus pagos. Es un hombre que goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Omar, 28, has a little son.  He is known in his community for being a hard working, honest young man who very much wants to get ahead.  He lives at home with his mother in Castilla-Piura District.

Omar makes “chifles” to sell.  Piura is a city famous for its delicious chifles which are snacks made from fried bananas (chips).  Omar has had the business for the last three years and he makes them at home.  He has a well established clientele in the area.

Omar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy ingredients needed for the chifle production.  Omar’s demand has increased and this is why he finds himself in need of requesting the loan.

Omar is a repeat client of our firm and has repaid his loans adequately.  He is a man who enjoys good personal and work-related references.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make "chifles" (fried banana chips).

loans.name: Tserenchimeg

texts.en:
Tserenchimeg, age 37, runs a clothing retail business at a local market in Ulaanbaatar. She has three years of work experience in the hospitality industry; however, she decided to start her own business in 2005 and has made much progress since then. She usually sells women’s clothing imported from China, and this loan will help her to increase her product variety.

She and her husband have two small children, ages three and four. The family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works at MCS Properties Co., Ltd., so her father babysits their children during the day.

Tserenchimeg is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to import more clothes for fall, which is a very high shopping season. She is planning to expand her business by increasing her product variety, which she is confident will help her business’s sales to increase.

loans.use: to import more clothes for the fall shopping season

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, a driver, and is a mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually proviD. income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Jean operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. AsiD. from this, she also sells home-cooked meals and retails electronic cellular phone loads to her customers.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Jean dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day, and finish his studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 36-year-old divorced man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and a sibling. He has 15 years of experience working as a home electrician. In 1997, he started to work on his own serving clients upon their request. He has two part-time employees helping him since he works in parallel as a calligrapher and must satisfy all his customers' demands. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase additional tools and supplies. This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will allow him to achieve substantial growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and supplies.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 32 years old, married to John and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Gladys hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dative is 30 years old and has four children between the ages of 2 and 10. Two of them are currently in school.  Her husband is a welder.

Dative sells hardware and home building supplies. She has been doing this for four years and it has enabled her to buy some land. She needs this loan to buy different materials to sell in her store, such as window panes. If she is able to realize profits from her business, she plans to build a house on her land.

loans.use: to buy hardware and home building supplies to sell in a store

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a car repair shop since 2010 and has more than 10 years of experience working as a mechanic. His main activity is to paint and repaint the cars. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. equipments needed. He will also perform the needed maintenance on his polishing machine to provide his customers with a better service.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his car repair shop

loans.name: Etendard De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Milose est la coordonatrice de son groupe ETENDARD DE OUANAMINTHE

Milose habite dans la ville de OUANAMINTHE d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Milose a dirigé son business pendant les 6 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce, Elle  etait a l’ecole Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du produits alimentaires. Milose espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Les autres membres Etendard ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et des vetements uses.

Milose dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant dit que ses buts principaux sont l’augmantation du bussiness.
texts.en:
Milose is the coordinator for the Etendard de Ouanaminthe group. She lives in the town of Ouanaminthe in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water very restricted. She has run her business for the past six years. Before she began doing this she was at school. She would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of groceries. Milose hopes that the loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the Etendard group need a loan for businesses such as the sale of charcoal, rice and used clothing. Milose says that her principal challenge is the lack of buyers and that her main objective is to grow her business

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Flor De Campo Group

texts.es:
L. señora Maria Blanca es uno D. los intregentes D. un grupo llamado Flor D. campo el cual esta conformado por doce personas las cuales son muy amables y trabajadoras cada una D. ellas tiene una actividad economica difrente Alejandro venD. sandalias, Galdina tiene una papeleria, Julissa venD. carne y tamales, Albera venD. reloj, Juana refrescos y dulces, Tomasa abarrotes, Juana B veneD. pan, Esteban tiene una panaderia, Aurora venD. ropa,Magdalena antojitos mexicanos y maria Guillermina zapatos.

L. señora Maria blanca tiene L. edad D. 54 años, estudio solo hasta L. secundaria y esta casada con el señor 
Juan que trabaja en el campo, ellos tienen tres hijas las cuales ya están casadas. Doña Maria Blanca nos platica que ha elL. siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero hace un poco mas D. cinco años con el apoyo D. su esposo abrio una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes para ganar un poco D. dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, elL. platica que gracias a Dios L. tienda va creciendo poco a poco y con el tiempo ha ido hacendo clienteL..

ElL. se encuentra muy contenta D. haber recibido este credito el cual piensa invertir en L. compra D. sopa, arroz, frijol, aceite, galletas, jabon y refrescos para resurtir su pequeño negocio.

elL. agradece a L. fundacion por el prestamo que se le ha otorgado y espera que con esta credito su negocio prospere y pueda dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida y poco a poco ir agrandando su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria Blanca is one one of the members of a group called Flor D. Campo which is maD. up of 12 people who are very friendly and all of them work in a different field. Alejandro sells sandals. Galdina has a stationery store. Julissa sells meat and tamales. Albera sells clocks, Juana sells drinks and sweets. Tomasa has a grocery store. Juana B sells bread. Esteban has a bakery. Aurora sells clothing. Magdalena sells Mexican appetizers. Maria Guillermina sells shoes.

Maria Blanca is 54 years old, studied through secondary school, and is married to Juan who works in the fields, and they have three daughters who are already married.

Maria Blanca talks to us about how she has always liked her work but about five years ago with the help of her husband she opened a little grocery store in order to earn some extra money and to help her husband with the household expenses. She continues by saying that thanks to God the store is growing little by little and with time she has built up a client base.

She thanks the community bank for the loan that has been approved and she hopes that with this loan her business will prosper and she can give her family a better quality of life and bit by bit enlarge her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, drinks, sweets, soap and canned foods

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La socia Antonia actualmente se encuantra trabajando sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz y papa, la socia tambien sigue con su fabrica de adobes, ella contrata personal para la fabricacion de adobes y ella tiene los contactos para la venta, la socia ha crecido en cuanto a la produccion de adobes motivo por el cual ella en esta ocacion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de motobomba, carretillas, paja entre otros materiales para elaborar adobes. La socia desea a futuro tener una fabrica grande de elaboración de adobes para poder vender fuera de sus poblado y abastecer a las otras comunidades adyacentes. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de carretillas, motobomba, paja entre otros materiales para elaborar adobes.
texts.en: Antonia currently farms her corn and potato fields but also continues with her adobe factory.  She hires personnel to manufacture adobes that she has sales contracts for.  Adobe manufacturing has been growing which is why on this occasion she wants to use the loan to buy a generator, wheelbarrows and straw, among other adobe making supplies.  In the future she’d like to have a large adobe manufacturing factory to be able to sell outside her town and supply adjacent communities.  She requests the loan to buy wheelbarrows, a generator and straw among other adobe making materials.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows, a generator, straw and other adobe making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of holiday items such as candles and souvenirs.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en:
Mrs. Pum is 26 years old. She is a married woman with two young children and comes from Baray district, Cambodia. She is involved with the business of raising pigs in order to make her living. She earns additional income by providing a rice-husking service for the people who live in her area. 

Mrs. Pum has a life partner in her husband, who is dedicated to animal husbandry, primarily cattle. He buys and sells at commercial markets in the provinces. Mrs. Pum has asked for this loan to purchase additional cattle to support her husband’s business. In years to come she hopes to improve her standard of living as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.ru: Эркинджон женат и имеет одного сына. Более 10 лет он занимается скотоводством. Ему нравится заниматься скотоводством, ведь этот бизнес приносить ему хорошую прибыль. Сейчас он имеет 5 голов быка. Кроме этого он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Данное время у него проблемы с финансами, но он очень усердно работает, чтобы выйти из трудного положения. Он очень трудолюбивый и старательный человек, он справляется с любыми трудностями. Эркинджон запрашивает займ для покупки скота и корма для них.
texts.en: Erkinjon is married and has one son. He has been raising cattle for over 10 years. He likes this work because his business brings him a good profit. At present he has five heads of cattle. He also plants crops. Currently he has financial difficulties, but he works very hard in order to overcome his  difficult situation. He is a very hard working and dedicated person. He can manage any  challenge. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle and animal feed.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 38 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 school-age children. 

To make a living, Rebecca owns & operates a business selling a variety of fruit products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio de 19 años, es un joven entusiasta que vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad nativa de San Román Bajo en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. A su corta edad, él ya se desenvuelve con facilidad en los negocios y la agricultura. Gracias a sus padres cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas. En ellas siembra café, pues es el producto que más ingresos genera en su zona. Cada cosecha está vendiendo como 60 sacos de 70 kilos. No se puede queja, posee ahorros que el permiten darse algunos gustos como joven y a la vez ayuda económicamente a sus padres. Todos los días se dirige a sus sembríos para verificar su crecimiento y limpiarlos de la mala yerba. Comenta que invierte mucho en abonos pero que al fin y al cabo las recompensas son mayores.
Eugenio es visionario y emprendedor. Con los ahorros que tiene y piensa obtener se comprará un motor para generar luz, así empezará otro negocio dentro de su comunidad. Éste sería el primer préstamo que Eugenio obtendría de MFP. Se siente emocionado por eso. Ahora forma parte del banco comunal “La Bella Durmiente”, del que se muestra esperanzado. Con el dinero podrá pagar los servicios de los jornaleros para el macheteo de la mala yerba y adquirir algunas bolsas de abonos.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 19 years old, an enthusiastic youth who lives in his parents' house in the native community of San Roman Bajo, Perene district, Chanchamayo province. At his young age, Eugenio has already developed an ability in business and agriculture. Thanks to his parents, he has 3 parcels of agricultural land on which he plants coffee, the product that generates the most income in his zone. Each harvest he sells around 60 sacks of 70 kilos each. 

Eugenio can't complain; he has savings that permit him to give himself some youthful pleasures and at the same time, help his parents economically. Every day he heads for his fields to check on their progress and pull weeds. He comments that he invests a great deal in fertilizers so that, in the end, the recompense will be larger. Eugenio is a visionary and an enterprising person. With his savings he wants to buy a motor to generate lights and, thereby, begin another business in his community. 

This will be his 1st loan obtained through MFP. He is excited about it. Eugenio has joined “La Bella Durmiente” (The Sleeping Beauty) Communal Bank, with which he has high hopes. With the loan Eugenio will pay day laborers to chop down weeds, and he'll purchase some sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with 6 children. Delia is 55 years old and lives in Ubay,Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Delia sells food snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Delia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Delia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un joven de 20 años el cual es muy trabajador y sobre todo muy entusiasta, el vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, uva, entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música y en ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”. David vive al lado de su pareja, quien es su mano derecha y quien lo apoya mucho en todo lo que el emprende, por ello el se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante ya que desea tener un pequeño mas adelante para felicidad de su familia. Debido a sus recursos económicos el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Agrónoma.
